title: Junior Quantitative Researcher
description:
Quantbox is a technology-driven proprietary trading firm that specializes in systematic alpha research and electronic market-making on various exchanges. We trade across a multitude of asset classes and trading venues with significant market share. We are looking for Junior Quantitative Researcher/Trader to join our team.

What you’ll need:
• You possess a bachelor's degree / PhD in mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, or a related field
• 1-2 years of experience in research or trading a plus
• Ability to think independently and use creative approach in problem solving
• Familiarity with python, C++, R programming languages

You will be responsible for building and improving the models that keeps us competitive in the market. You will work alongside the traders, software developers and our engineering scientist, you would learn, research, improve, test, build our trading algorithms to increase trading profitability. A typical day involves applying rigorous scientific method, machine learning techniques to a vast array of datasets in order to create insights on how the market behave.

Quantbox is an equal opportunity employer.

Quantbox is a place of friends and colleagues, where people convert their passion into action. We believe in togetherness that brings out the best in ourselves and our Company. Our open and casual work culture gives you the space to innovate and deliver. Everyone on the team is approachable.
Employee remuneration packages are reviewed regularly to ensure that they remain competitive. In recognition of our employees’ contributions and performance, for full time permanent roles we provide:
• Competitive compensation
• 4 Weeks of paid vacation
• Medical insurance
• International team outing

Quantbox is an equal opportunities employer.

title: Senior Quantitative Trader/Market Maker
description:
We are a leading full-stack, high-frequency proprietary trading firm strategically located in New York, Taipei, and Singapore. Our company is equipped with a proprietary, latency-sensitive trading system, state-of-the-art trading algorithms, and a highly efficient execution platform, designed to optimize trading strategies across various asset classes. Moreover, we maintain comprehensive access to major exchanges worldwide, allowing us to execute complex trades efficiently and at scale. This global reach, combined with our technological expertise, positions us at the forefront of the financial trading industry.

About the role:

In this role, you will apply mathematical and quantitative methods to evaluate financial products or markets in order to find trading opportunities and calculate risks.

Responsibilties:
• Research DeFi markets, protocols, strategies, and manage a sizeable portfolio.
• Conduct in-depth research on Cefi and/or Defi markets and blockchain data.
• Design and deploy algorithmic trading strategies to the production environment.
• Expand automated trading business to new trading products and venues, calibrate and fine tune the performance.
• Provide reporting on daily market sentiment, risk exposure, P&L.
• Conduct post-trade analysis of trading strategies and algo performance risk mitigation strategies and responsible for portfolio/strategy optimization.

Who you are:
• STEM Degree from a top college or university.
• A quantitative trading strategy that is currently and consistently profitable in any asset classes. (not only in a simulation or back-test environment).
• We are open to small holding periods and mid to high trading frequencies.
• Excellent Return on Capital (ROC) A proven track record (not just back-test data).
• Ideally, experience at a proprietary trading firm, or hedge fund.
• Crypto experience will be a plus but not necessary.
• Must be able to do hands-on coding. It could be in any language of Rust/C++/Golang/Python.

General requirements:
• Candidate must be able to relocate to NYC office or Taipei office in Taiwan.
• For all the roles, 2-3 rounds of coding tests should be expected for 2-3 hours each.
• Excellent written and spoken English, any other languages will be a plus.

Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary
• Semi-annual discretionary bonus
• Relocation assistance if needed
• Dedicated mentors to accelerate your growth
• Fully stocked kitchen
• Unlimited sick days
• Friendly start-up working environment
• 15 days of PTO and 15 days of WFH on an accrual basis.
• Team lunch/ dinner.
• Gym subsidy
• Breakfast catering
• Social events
• Opportunity to visit our global offices

(For NYC candidates, 100,000 - 250,000 USD per year)

Please provide the following when you apply
• Summary of your research and/or trading strategies
• If applicable, whether your trading strategies have been (a) simulated/backtested only, or (b) traded live in production (if the latter, how long trading has been live)
• Your role on the team, and what tools or components you have experience building
• Daily PnL Breakdown
• Capital Allocation, Leverage, and Book Size
• Return % (please specify whether % of GMV or ROC%) Annual PNL (or Average Daily PNL)
• Max Drawdown
• Sharpe Ratio
• Target Volatility
• Holding Period
• Potential for scalability
• Market Capacity

As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title: Algorithmic Trader
description:
Binance is a leading global blockchain ecosystem behind the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume and registered users. We are trusted by over 250 million people in 100+ countries for our industry-leading security, user fund transparency, trading engine speed, deep liquidity, and an unmatched portfolio of digital-asset products. Binance offerings range from trading and finance to education, research, payments, institutional services, Web3 features, and more. We leverage the power of digital assets and blockchain to build an inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world.

The business provides quantitative trading solutions in market making, trade execution, and settlement services on various cryptocurrency exchanges. The Algorithmic/Quant Trader will be an early member of a high-growth business in a high-growth industry, and will play a key role to shape and expand the trading desk.
• *Responsibilities**:

- Responsible for the trading logic design, daily operation, and improvement of high performing algorithmic trading strategies running across various crypto electronic platforms.
- Own the “trading desk” of your strategies, maximize P&L, define your strategies expansion roadmap, while ensuring alignment with the overall business mandates.
- Work closely with quant developers to provide design specifications, and ensure efficient deployment of strategies and risk controls into production systems.
- Collaborate with operations, clearing and other stakeholders to ensure smooth and accurate new trade instruments onboarding, P&L calculations, and funding needs.
- Participate in and initiate various exciting projects to innovate liquidity solutions across centralized crypto platforms as well as DeFi.
• *Requirements**:

- Master's or higher degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science
- 8+ years of experience in a similar role. Preferably in market making firms, hedge funds, or HFT firms, with a proven track record of success.
- Experience in market microstructure and analysis of market, order books, and trade data.
- Experience in market making, and arbitrage strategies. Alpha signal generation is a plus.
- Solid knowledge of quantitative modeling. Be able to independently build algo specifications for new trading strategies and collaborate with developers to deliver.
- Strong programming skills in Python and SQL. (C++, or Java are a plus)
- Excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Self-motivated and highly independent.
- Excellent communication skills, and comfortable to work with a global team in a fast-paced environment.
• *Why Binance**
- Shape the future with the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem
- Collaborate with world-class talent in a user-centric global organization with a flat structure

title: Forex Trader
extensions: ['28 days ago', 'SGD\xa04K–SGD\xa08K a month', 'Full-time', 'No degree mentioned']
description:
About Quant Matter

At Quant Matter, we are an innovative quantitative trading firm specializing in crypto market-making and multi-asset algorithmic trading (including futures, equities, commodities, FX, and digital assets). We develop and deploy high-quality quantitative strategies and predictive signals (alpha) with a focus on sustainable, long-term success in global financial markets.

Our edge lies in our ability to combine advanced technology, data-driven insights, and market expertise to deliver consistent, high-performance trading.

What You’ll Do
• Lead and manage your own trading desk, taking full ownership of your strategies and P&L
• Develop, implement, and continuously enhance quantitative trading strategies
• Conduct market research to uncover new alpha opportunities
• Test and optimize trading models and algorithms to enhance performance
• Stay on top of market trends and macroeconomic developments that affect your trading strategies
• Collaborate with quant researchers, engineers, and traders to optimize and scale strategies

What We’re Looking For
• Experience: Minimum 2 years in trading (Forex)
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages like Python, C++, Java, or Matlab (desired for algorithmic traders, but discretionary traders with strong track records are also welcome)
• Quantitative Knowledge: Strong foundation in quantitative analysis, market microstructure, and alpha generation
• Self-Motivated: A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to manage your own trading desk independently
• Passion for Trading: A keen interest in algorithmic trading and high-frequency trading (HFT)
• Communication Skills: Ability to clearly articulate trading ideas and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team

Bonus Points For
• Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT) strategies
• Expertise in risk management and execution systems
• Track record in building and scaling trading strategies

Why Quant Matter?

We offer a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where you have the freedom to manage your own desk and the resources to develop high-impact strategies. At Quant Matter, you’ll have access to a global trading network, cutting-edge infrastructure, and the opportunity to grow and scale your trading desk as you see fit.

If you are a motivated quant trader with a proven track record and an entrepreneurial spirit, we want to hear from you!

Ready to Join? Apply Now!

Send your resume, P&L track record, and a brief summary of your trading approach to fikri@quantmatter.com or click the 'Apply' Button.

title: Expert Trader
description:
Quantitative Trading Expert

We are seeking a highly skilled Quantitative Trading Expert to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of trading and make a significant impact on our business.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in quantitative modeling, market microstructure, and analysis of market data. They will be responsible for designing and implementing high-performing algorithmic trading strategies that maximize profit and minimize risk.

In this role, you will work closely with our quant developers to provide design specifications and ensure efficient deployment of strategies into production systems. You will also collaborate with operations, clearing, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth and accurate new trade instrument onboarding, P&L calculations, and funding needs.
Responsibilities:
• Design and implement high-performing algorithmic trading strategies
• Work closely with quant developers to provide design specifications and ensure efficient deployment of strategies into production systems
• Collaborate with operations, clearing, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth and accurate new trade instrument onboarding, P&L calculations, and funding needs
Requirements:
• Master's or higher degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science
• 8+ years of experience in a similar role, preferably in market making firms, hedge funds, or HFT firms, with a proven track record of success
• Experience in market microstructure and analysis of market, order books, and trade data
• Experience in market making, and arbitrage strategies, alpha signal generation is a plus
• Solid knowledge of quantitative modeling and ability to independently build algo specifications for new trading strategies
• Strong programming skills in Python and SQL, C++ or Java are a plus
Benefits:
• Competitive salary
• Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning
• Results-driven workplace
• Autonomy in an innovative environment
Others:
• A flat structure and user-centric global organization
• An inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world

title: Quant Developer / Tech Lead – C++ (Hedge Fund, HFT, Systematic trading, Algorithm, High-performing team)
description:
My Client:

My client is a systematic hedge fund looking to expand its systematic equity effort. This role focuses on building execution infrastructure and working closely with quant researchers to bring high-frequency strategies into production. You’ll take ownership of low-latency systems that directly impact strategy deployment and live trading performance. This new position has just been opened up and offers a unique opportunity to join a high-performing team.

Job Responsibility:
• Collaborate closely with quant researchers to understand strategy needs and contribute to the implementation, deployment, and real-time optimization in live trading environments.
• Design high-performance, low-latency systems to power high-frequency trading execution, with a focus on scalability, reliability, and runtime stability.
• Build and maintain research infrastructure and simulation frameworks to support faster, more robust strategy development cycles.
• Take technical ownership of system architecture decisions and lead the resolution of complex engineering challenges.
• Work cross-functionally with operations, strategy and engineering teams to ensure seamless deployment and issue resolution.

Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, with 5+ years of hands-on software engineering experience.
• Proficient in modern C++, with strong fundamentals in multithreading, networking, and system-level performance optimization.
• Familiarity with trading system components such as exchange connectivity, order lifecycle management, and market data pipelines. Prior exposure to execution systems or low-latency trading environments is highly preferred.
• Proven ability to design and evolve distributed systems in latency-critical environments, coupled with strong engineering discipline to deliver robust, maintainable, and production-grade code
• Solid communication skills and a collaborative mindset, with prior experience working across functions to deliver real-time trading solutions.

What they offer:
• High-growth, multi-strategy business environment with strong long-term momentum
• Well-funded engineering organization with deep investment in infrastructure and tech excellence
• Competitive compensation for exceptional talent candidate

If it sounds like your next move, please don’t hesitate to apply. Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Appreciate your understanding. Data provided is for recruitment purposes only.

title: Campus Quantitative Researcher (Intern)
description:
Jump Trading Group is committed to world class research. We empower exceptional talents in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science to seek scientific boundaries, push through them, and apply cutting edge research to global financial markets. Our culture is unique. Constant innovation requires fearlessness, creativity, intellectual honesty, and a relentless competitive streak. We believe in winning together and unlocking unique individual talent by incenting collaboration and mutual respect. At Jump, research outcomes drive more than superior risk adjusted returns. We design, develop, and deploy technologies that change our world, fund start-ups across industries, and partner with leading global research organizations and universities to solve problems.

Our trading teams are each comprised of a dynamic group of traders, quantitative researchers, and engineers who work together to examine the global markets, seeking to understand the complexities of various traded products and exchanges. They leverage their impeccable statistical analysis and data mining skills, using the results of their research to make forecasts and develop profitable predictive trading models.
• Quantitative Researcher, Internship (Singapore/Mumbai)
• Timing of application consideration and interviews will vary to accommodate university timelines. -------------------------------

About the Role:

We build predictive models from big data and develop algorithms to automatically execute trades in dozens of financial exchanges around the world.

At Jump you will have the opportunity to contribute in a blend of three roles – quant researcher / data scientist, trader, and software developer – based on your incoming skills and background, interest and curiosity, and the new skills and industry knowledge that you will learn at Jump.

Our 10-week internship program begins with a training program focused on enhancing your knowledge of trading, programming, and quant research. The training consists of in-house courses and trading simulation developed and delivered by experienced quant researchers, traders, and developers. We have experts from around the firm who will teach you advanced skills in a variety of areas such as Machine Learning, Trading / Market Mechanics, Statistics, R, Python, C++, and our research process.

You will later be coached to successfully apply those skills during rotations with trading teams and research projects with mentorship from experienced quants/traders. You will help build predictive models, leveraging one of the largest supercomputers in the world, and devise automated trading strategies to test in the markets against world-class competition. Other duties as assigned or needed.

Who Should Apply?

We are seeking the sharpest analytical minds from top undergraduate and graduate programs. Ideal candidates have an uncommon drive to learn and improve, an entrepreneurial spirit, and strong skills in programming and/or quantitative analysis (statistics, data mining, mathematics, machine learning, etc.).

No prior knowledge of finance or trading is necessary. We’ll give you the training that you’ll need.

Reliable and predictable availability required.

Although we strongly value training in Computer Science and Mathematics, we are excited to meet people with exceptional achievements in any technical discipline. Recent hires include students from fields such as Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Neuroscience, Materials Science, Operations Research, and more.

If you have outstanding skills in math and programming and you are curious about the challenge of improving research with daily feedback from competitive markets, we hope you’ll apply.

title: Advanced Algorithmic Trading Specialist
description:
High-Frequency Trading Software Developer

We are seeking a skilled Software Developer to join our team in the field of High-Frequency Trading. The job requires the ability to troubleshoot Linux environments, work in large-scale mission-critical environments, and collaborate with top engineers to drive next-gen technology. If you are passionate about platform engineering and have a strong educational background, this could be the perfect role for you.

Up to SG$150,000 (very negotiable DOE)

Job Description:

An Elite Quant Trading Firm in Singapore is looking for a Platform Engineer to join their world-class team. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable and secure platforms to support high-performance trading operations.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Relevant experience working in a Platform, DevOps, or SRE position
• Strong educational background

title: Efx Trader
description:
Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.

This role is based in Singapore and as such all normal working days must be carried out in Singapore.

Join us as an eFX Trader
- You’ll manage the day-to-day operations of the eFX and eFI trading business, providing feedback and ideas to the Support, Technology & Quant Trading team in order improve the overall E product
- We’ll look to you to ensure that pricing remains available and competitive in line with the overall strategy, and to maintain customer service and profitability
- You’ll actively review client performance as well as using the full suite of analytics to improve business performance
• *What you'll do**:
Working for the Head of eFX Trading, you’ll implement the current strategy for the eFX Trading product, and deliver the business objectives of financial targets, client delivery, and risk and control. You’ll manage all day-to-day risks efficiently from the automated market making and risk management business. You’ll also highlight any issues to the Support, Technology and Quant Trading team in order to be remediated and ultimately for product improvement.

By engaging with quantitative research teams, you’ll optimise the eFX product design and configuration, and you’ll collaborate closely with the eFX Quant trading team to implement and monitor the current eFX strategic design. As such, you’ll implement change more systematically, and provide feedback where appropriate.

You’ll also:

- Collaborate with the eFX Quant team, providing real times observations based on the current set up, and contribute to the system process through controlled experimentation and data review
- Actively review the automated market making and risk management performance as well as using the full suite of analytics to improve business performance
- Effectively manage liquidity provider relationships, and collaborate with global sales teams to drive forward the client agenda, helping to produce relevant MI, actions, and product improvement
- Provide regular business updates on delivery and successes to management and other stakeholders
• *The skills you'll need**:
Along with in-depth knowledge and experience of eFX pricing and risk management strategies, you’ll have a solid grasp of eFX or eFI ecosystems, and a track record of leading a quantitative approach to risk management.

We’re also looking for:

- A background in developing successful alpha generating models
- Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, and a business-building aptitude
- Experience with high frequency databases, database software, in particular KDB, and research toolboxes, ideally Python
- A strong mathematic background, ideally including statistics and modern machine learning methods
- Experience in running risk in eFX or eFI

title: Junior Quantitative Developer
description:

The team is looking to add proactive and talented Junior Quantitative Developers who will make a direct and measurable impact on our trading decisions and performance.

Job Description

The successful candidate will have a strong programming background, familiarity with mathematical techniques and the fluency to leverage both skills to produce trading solutions and high-performance production code.

1. Data gathering

2. Data analysis (Modelling)

3. Strategy development

4. Back testing

5. Trading algorithm development (and Low-latency related technologies)

title: High-Performance Trading Systems Architect
description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in shaping the architecture of our trading systems.

We are looking for an experienced professional who can work closely with our Institutional team to reduce complexity and improve trading performance.

The ideal candidate should have expertise in designing, maintaining, and supporting low-latency trading systems, ensuring minimal delays in data processing and transaction execution.

Additionally, knowledge of containerization tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Nomad is highly desirable.

Familiarity with CI/CD technologies like GitHub Actions is also required.

• Work closely with traders and engineers to take ownership of trading & operational issues
• Contribute to our cloud-native continuous delivery stack improving developer experience and deployment processes
• Liaise with the core SRE team to provide feedback on tooling and implement upstream policies

• Hybrid model working from home and office location in Singapore

description:
Highly skilled professionals are sought to design, deploy, and maintain fast and reliable networks in a high-frequency trading environment. The ideal candidate will have experience with low-latency networks, multicast routing, and industry-leading network design.
About the Role

This is a mid-senior level position that requires a strong background in network engineering, with expertise in Cisco, Juniper, and Arista technologies. Automation skills, such as Python scripting and Ansible, Chef, or Puppet, are also highly desirable.
Key Responsibilities
• Design and implement global network infrastructure to meet the needs of high-frequency trading teams
• Implement optimizations to build low-latency networks
• Support trading teams with high-frequency trading needs
• Automate processes, plan capacity, and enhance connectivity
Ideal Skills and Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have:
• Cisco CCIE/CCDE or CCNP level experience in a trading environment
• Strong background in low-latency and multicast networks
• Experience with automation tools, such as Python, Ansible, Chef, or Puppet
Benefits

This role offers a great culture, hybrid working, and a top-end base salary plus bonus. The client may consider candidates in various locations.

title: Senior Electronic Trading Support Engineer
description:
Hudson River Trading (HRT) is looking for a Senior Electronic Trading Support Engineer to join our Trade Operations (TradeOps) team. This team is responsible for managing HRT's live trading environment, one of the most robust and efficient electronic trading platforms in the world. This includes configuring, monitoring, and optimizing the firm's trading as well as handling risk, regulatory, and development tasks. The TradeOps team focuses on automating common tasks and preparing for the unexpected. Your day could consist of debugging to get a process running in time for the market open, making a difficult on-the-spot decision that balances compliance, risk, and PnL during trading hours, or coordinating the technical rollout of a new trading strategy.

Responsibilities include handling order flow from HRT's trading desks, responding to external market alerts and outages, and interfacing with exchanges & other external parties to support trading. The team's scope covers everything from systems infrastructure, to compliance, risk management, overnight clearing, and performance improvement.
• *The Role**
- Responsibilities include responding to external market alerts and outages, and interfacing with exchanges & other external parties to support trading. The team's scope covers everything from systems infrastructure, to compliance, risk management, overnight clearing, handling order flow from HRT's trading desks and performance improvement.
• *The Profile**
- Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (CS, Engineering, Physics, Math, etc.)
- Strong working knowledge of Linux systems
- Ability to identify areas for platform improvement in a complex technical environment
- You can take difficult projects that involve coordination with multiple parties (internal and external), and bring them to fruition
- Excellent communication & prioritization skills
- Experience with a scripting language (Python, Perl, Bash)
- You are skeptical by nature and have a high attention to detail
- You respond well to working under high pressure scenarios
• *Qualifications**
- Strong understanding of on-exchange and off-exchange / OTC products
- Working knowledge of FIX, OUCH, & other market-specific protocols
- Extensive experience supporting electronic trading systems
- 5+ years of experience
• *Culture**

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we welcome a variety of expertise: mathematics and computer science, physics and engineering, media and tech. We're a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automation in every part of our organization—from trading, to business operations, to recruiting and beyond. We value openness and transparency, and celebrate great ideas from HRT veterans and new hires alike. At HRT we're friends and colleagues - whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we'd love to get to know you.

title: Quant Developer

description:

title: Quantitative Developer, Market Risk
description:
Jump Trading Group is committed to world class research. We empower exceptional talents in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science to seek scientific boundaries, push through them, and apply cutting edge research to global financial markets. Our culture is unique. Constant innovation requires fearlessness, creativity, intellectual honesty, and a relentless competitive streak. We believe in winning together and unlocking unique individual talent by incenting collaboration and mutual respect. At Jump, research outcomes drive more than superior risk adjusted returns. We design, develop, and deploy technologies that change our world, fund start-ups across industries, and partner with leading global research organizations and universities to solve problems.

Jump Trading's risk team manages risk globally for all trading teams and is responsible for evaluating the many facets of risk across trading strategies, markets and products. One facet of risk that the firm manages is market risk.

As a Quantitative Developer, you will employ your software development skills and interest in quantitative methods and research to improve the firm's capabilities to monitor, manage, and hedge market risk across a multitude of businesses and asset classes. Some examples of these capabilities are instrument modeling, risk measurement, and empirical research. This role requires both the nimbleness to quickly attack new business needs as well as the thoughtfulness to organize and deploy data, compute, visualization, and decision-making workflows at scale.

The team is looking for someone who is passionate about agile software development, is willing to learn and deploy quantitative methodologies via code, demonstrates intellectual curiosity, and is comfortable challenging the status quo with both humility and clear communication. If you have an interest in deepening your understanding of financial markets while continue to grow your quantitative and software development skills, talk to us!

Skills You'll Need:
• At least 5+ years of relevant technical experience required
• Strong programming experience in Python along with common packages such as Pandas, Polars, Numpy, and Scipy
• CFA Charter holder or equivalent foundational financial markets knowledge
• Bachelors or Masters degree in Financial Engineering, Finance and/or Statistics Direct experience in working with at least one financial asset class
• Practical experience in working with data at scale (whether daily or intraday)
• Experience in CI/CD framework
• Great written and verbal communication skills – good at ELI5
• Self-directed and able to take ownership of projects and responsibilities
• Experience in having to learn something substantial from scratch while on the job

Bonus Points:
• Experience in development within a distributed Linux environment
• Experience with financial instrument modeling and/or empirical research
• Familiarity with C++ Familiarity with columnar data / databases

title: Quant Dev, Exotics
description:
QCP is Asia's leading digital asset partner, empowering clients to seamlessly integrate digital assets into their portfolios.

We offer a comprehensive range of solutions - from spot on/off ramping and fixed income strategies to vanilla options and bespoke exotics.

Driven by the vision to be the most trusted partner in digital asset markets, we provide innovative solutions that make digital assets a core component of every portfolio, balance sheet, and treasury.

Since our founding in 2017, we have witnessed the potential of digital assets to transform financial markets and the world at large. We exist at the centre of change, successfully navigating three market cycles and bridging institutional and crypto ecosystems.

We work to build trusted partnerships, putting client success and care at the heart of everything that we do.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Quantitative Developer / Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in quantitative finance, extensive programming skills, and a deep understanding of trading, risk management and exotic structured products in cryptocurrency markets. As a quant developer in a high-performance options market making firm, your role will be within a trading desk quantitative development team that is building and maintaining the proprietary risk engine and systems as well as providing trading desk analytical support.
• Work within a small team of quant developers under direction from the product manager responsible for the front office trading team.
• Use creative problem solving to build scalable, robust systems that work seamlessly across all asset classes.
• Collaborate with other team members to design and implement execution algorithms and risk management protocols and tools to design and develop a world-class next-generation risk analytics platform.
• Work on large-scale financial data problems, in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and highly collaborative team.
• Perform analysis using statistical modelling, machine learning techniques, and other quantitative methods to support due diligence for executive trading and risk decision making.
• Build and maintain high-performance derivative pricing models and analytic libraries to calibrate to market conditions as well as infrastructure (adaptors and gateways) to price and risk manage exotic structures.
• Conduct research into and analysis to formulate arbitrage free valuation models which are fit-for-purpose for pricing and risk management of exotic products and structures.
• Provide training for traders, structurers and sales staff on new exotics model and products rollout
• Generate technical and research document on model formulation, research, testing and usage.
• Develop, back tests, and optimize execution strategies using statistical modelling, machine learning techniques, and other quantitative methods.
• Monitor and analyse market data, liquidity, and execution quality to continuously refine trading strategies and improve performance.
• Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

Our ideal candidate will have the following profile:
• Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field. Advanced degree (e.g., MS, PhD) preferred
• At least 10-years experience working in a formal programming language. Knowledge in C# / C++ design patterns, data structures, containers and C# based industrial quantitative libraries is an advantage but not a requirement,
• Strong Experience in working on derivative products, pricing models and risk management, probability theory and statistics, stochastic process and stochastic calculus; numerical methods including Monte-Carlo, PDE (Finite Difference and Finite Element) and Tree engines, Euler and Milstein schemes, and random number generation; linear and non-linear optimization methods; application of data analytics and machine learning techniques to derivatives pricing; valuation and modelling of exotic derivative options; crypto, equity and currency exotic products.
• Experience in developing trading systems; delivering tools to trading and structuring teams that tailor products to clients' needs; building models that facilitate the trading desks' hedging practices;
• Experience in developing trading systems and exchange gateway integrations
• Solid understanding of blockchain technology, cryptocurrencies, and the factors influencing their prices and market dynamics
• Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced trading environment
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders

The Environment We Offer

As a growing firm with a tightly-knit team, we respect and listen to all our employees. You will get the chance to make an impact by having your voice heard by everyone, including the management.

Our employees enjoy a high level of autonomy at work. We focus on substance, not form - as long as you can perform, you will be recognized and rewarded. We are also dedicated to supporting our staff and ensuring they develop holistically to maximize their potential in the long- term.

We also provide flexible working arrangement as required and a casual and fun environment to boot!

title: Quant Developer / Tech Lead – C++ (Hedge Fund, HFT, Systematic trading, Algorithm, High-performing team)
description:
My Client:

My client is a systematic hedge fund looking to expand its systematic equity effort. This role focuses on building execution infrastructure and working closely with quant researchers to bring high-frequency strategies into production. You’ll take ownership of low-latency systems that directly impact strategy deployment and live trading performance. This new position has just been opened up and offers a unique opportunity to join a high-performing team.

Job Responsibility:
• Collaborate closely with quant researchers to understand strategy needs and contribute to the implementation, deployment, and real-time optimization in live trading environments.
• Design high-performance, low-latency systems to power high-frequency trading execution, with a focus on scalability, reliability, and runtime stability.
• Build and maintain research infrastructure and simulation frameworks to support faster, more robust strategy development cycles.
• Take technical ownership of system architecture decisions and lead the resolution of complex engineering challenges.
• Work cross-functionally with operations, strategy and engineering teams to ensure seamless deployment and issue resolution.

Job Requirement:
• Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, with 5+ years of hands-on software engineering experience.
• Proficient in modern C++, with strong fundamentals in multithreading, networking, and system-level performance optimization.
• Familiarity with trading system components such as exchange connectivity, order lifecycle management, and market data pipelines. Prior exposure to execution systems or low-latency trading environments is highly preferred.
• Proven ability to design and evolve distributed systems in latency-critical environments, coupled with strong engineering discipline to deliver robust, maintainable, and production-grade code
• Solid communication skills and a collaborative mindset, with prior experience working across functions to deliver real-time trading solutions.

What they offer:
• High-growth, multi-strategy business environment with strong long-term momentum
• Well-funded engineering organization with deep investment in infrastructure and tech excellence
• Competitive compensation for exceptional talent candidate

title: Enterprise Sales - Junior Client Quant Developer (Excel & Python), Desktop Build Group - Singapore | Singapore, SG
description:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight. We use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. To ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Desktop Build Group (DBG) works closely with Bloomberg's existing and prospective clients to find solutions to business needs using Bloomberg's API for Excel and Python. Last year we delivered over 2500 projects to clients and our API solutions on the Bloomberg Terminal are used by over 120,000 financial professionals. We are a global team with colleagues based in London, New York, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney.

What's the role?
You will use your financial markets knowledge to consult with Bloomberg clients or prospective clients, helping them to develop and implement their investment strategies and research on leveraging our Excel APIs, VBA, our cutting edge query language (BQL) and Python based quant platform (BQuant Desktop).
You'll directly impact our revenue by working closely with our Sales teams to develop new tactical desktop applications to sell Bloomberg Terminals. Your role will involve full life-cycle development, from initial demos to prospective clients, requirement gathering, prototyping, implementation, deployment and adoption. In addition to software development, you will be expected to create resources and client-facing content that is both strategic in its appeal to our audience, while also taking advantage of current events in the marketplace.

We'll trust you to:

• Partner with Sales teams to build tactical Excel, Python, Power BI, and BQuant solutions to increase revenue opportunities for the company
• Provide assistance on new strategies or migration projects the clients wish to implement by using Bloomberg APIs
• Work on projects to provide short-term product gap solutions for the Bloomberg Terminal
• Provide continued support for clients to ensure adoption of BQuant Desktop
• Maintain and support Excel models accessible via the Bloomberg Terminal
• Work closely with our Product Development and Software Engineering teams to help drive improvements to our Excel APIs
Training and team support will allow you to gain:

• In depth knowledge of the Terminal and Bloomberg APIs
• A deep understanding of financial markets and investment processes on both buy-side and sell-side
• Experience of open source Python technologies for advanced data visualizations, widgets and analytics
You'll need to have:

• Minimum 3 years of experience working in financial services or a financial technology company
• Experience developing financial models using MS Excel/Python
• Experience in pitching or providing support on quant products / research to external clients
• Financial markets knowledge and exposure to one or more asset class (Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities, FX, etc.)
• A strategic mindset and proven commercial acumen which allows you to weigh up the business opportunities of a project before execution
• Confidence to have highly articulate and consultative interactions with clients
• Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation
• Strong presentation and communication skills in English
• Bachelor's degree or degree equivalent qualifications
We'd love to see:

• Experience or qualifications in Data Science
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/products/bloomberg-terminal/research/bquant/

Why Bloomberg?
We're individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We're interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

Learn more about our office and benefits:
Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore

Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, you'll need to have legal authorisation to work full-time in Singapore, without Bloomberg sponsoring your work authorization, to be considered for this role.

description:
Qube Research & Technologies (QRT) is a global quantitative and systematic investment manager, operating in all liquid asset classes across the world. We are a technology and data driven group implementing a scientific approach to investing. Combining data, research, technology and trading expertise has shaped QRT’s collaborative mindset which enables us to solve the most complex challenges. QRT’s culture of innovation continuously drives our ambition to deliver high quality returns for our investors.

Your future role within QRT:

As a Quantitative Developer - Research Team, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and supporting the software infrastructure that underpins our trading signal research. You will collaborate closely with quantitative researchers and traders, contributing to the continuous enhancement of our trading strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with large datasets, high-performance computing (HPC), and machine learning models, in a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating environment.

title: Senior Developer - Systematic Trading Tools
description:
Overall Purpose of the Role

We are seeking a senior technology developer with strong experience in C#. This role covers the full software development lifecycle, including stakeholder engagement, requirements gathering, analysis, development, testing, deployment, and ongoing support.

The role includes taking ownership of an existing stand-alone backtesting system written in Rust and over time integrating it into the wider company toolset, which is primarily written in C#. You will focus on building and maintaining tools to support systematic trading, contributing across the entire strategy lifecycle—from research and backtesting to production deployment and operational readiness. The role is currently based in London, with the expectation of relocating to Singapore after approximately six months. Similarly, we are open to candidates based in Singapore, who will come to London for six months of training.

Key Responsibilities
• Take ownership of existing systems and processes, ensuring their stability and effectiveness.
• Design and implement new solutions in response to evolving requirements, maintaining close communication with traders and other stakeholders.
• Collaborate with other developers and consultants to maintain a consistent, high-quality codebase.
• Develop a deep understanding of the firm’s technology infrastructure and tooling.
• Actively contribute to the continuous improvement of development practices and system architecture.
• Mentoring more junior members of the team, from time to time.

Education and Qualifications
• Degree in a relevant technical or quantitative discipline.

Experience
• Significant professional experience as a C# developer.
• Experience in a systematic trading environment is strongly preferred.
• Prior exposure to Rust (or strong C++ experience with the willingness to learn Rust).
• Proven ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Skills
• Strong proficiency in C# (required).
• Rust experience (preferred) or strong C++ background with a desire to learn Rust on the job.
• Proficient in Python (desired).
• Solid understanding of relational databases (required).
• Familiarity with messaging systems such as RabbitMQ or Kafka (preferred).
• Highly motivated, pragmatic, and solutions-focused, with a “smart and get things done” mindset.
• Willingness to relocate to Singapore after an initial London-based period (~6 months).
• Competitive salary
• Private medical insurance
• Life assurance
• Pension
• Corporate gym membership (and a complimentary wellness space in our London office)
• Employee restaurant with free breakfast, lunch and dinner

title: Quantitative Developer, Market Risk
description:
Jump Trading Group is committed to world class research. We empower exceptional talents in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science to seek scientific boundaries, push through them, and apply cutting edge research to global financial markets. Our culture is unique. Constant innovation requires fearlessness, creativity, intellectual honesty, and a relentless competitive streak. We believe in winning together and unlocking unique individual talent by incenting collaboration and mutual respect. At Jump, research outcomes drive more than superior risk adjusted returns. We design, develop, and deploy technologies that change our world, fund start-ups across industries, and partner with leading global research organizations and universities to solve problems.

Jump Trading's risk team manages risk globally for all trading teams and is responsible for evaluating the many facets of risk across trading strategies, markets and products. One facet of risk that the firm manages is market risk.

As a Quantitative Developer, you will employ your software development skills and interest in quantitative methods and research to improve the firm's capabilities to monitor, manage, and hedge market risk across a multitude of businesses and asset classes. Some examples of these capabilities are instrument modeling, risk measurement, and empirical research. This role requires both the nimbleness to quickly attack new business needs as well as the thoughtfulness to organize and deploy data, compute, visualization, and decision-making workflows at scale.

The team is looking for someone who is passionate about agile software development, is willing to learn and deploy quantitative methodologies via code, demonstrates intellectual curiosity, and is comfortable challenging the status quo with both humility and clear communication. If you have an interest in deepening your understanding of financial markets while continue to grow your quantitative and software development skills, talk to us!

Skills You'll Need:
• At least 5+ years of relevant technical experience required
• Strong programming experience in Python along with common packages such as Pandas, Polars, Numpy, and Scipy
• CFA Charter holder or equivalent foundational financial markets knowledge
• Bachelors or Masters degree in Financial Engineering, Finance and/or Statistics Direct experience in working with at least one financial asset class

• Self-driven with strong analytical abilities to solve real-time challenges.

title: Quant Developer - Paradex
description:
At Paradigm, we are changing the future of finance! By joining us at this early stage, you’ll be building cutting-edge, distributed financial service infrastructure that will reshape financial services across CeFi and DeFi markets.

About Paradigm
• Paradigm is a zero-fee, institutional liquidity network for derivatives traders across CeFi and DeFi.
• We provide unified access to multi-asset, multi-protocol liquidity on demand without compromising on execution preferences, costs, and immediacy.
• We’ve built the largest network of institutional counterparties in crypto, with over 1000 institutional clients trading over $10 B per month.
• We are a diverse, global team led by our organizational principles and united by our mission to bring on-demand liquidity for traders, anytime and anywhere, without compromises. We also strive to ship faster than anyone else in the industry!
• We are backed by the best traders and investors in the space, including Jump Capital, Genesis Trading, Dragonfly Capital, QCP Capital, Optiver US, IMC, GSR Markets, Akuna Capital, Fidelity Digital Assets CMT Digital, Goldentree Asset Management, Amber Group, OK Group, Bybit Fintech, and CoinShares.

About Paradex

Paradex is revolutionizing finance by bringing it on-chain, unlocking financial freedom for everyone. We're reshaping DeFi with a lightning-fast DEX built on Starknet’s first Appchain, integrating trading, asset management, and money market primitives. Our cutting-edge tech offers unmatched security, scalability, and deep liquidity. Backed by top-tier investors and incubated by Paradigm, we’re scaling rapidly and need innovators like you to shape the future of decentralized finance.

Quick Facts
• $36 Billion Lifetime Volume
• $100 Million Average Daily Volume
• $15 Million Total Value Locked

Paradex is committed to building transparently in public 👉 key platform stats
Your mission

As a Senior Quantitative Developer, you’ll play a pivotal role in advancing our high-performance derivatives trading platform, which features lightning-fast order execution and innovative on-chain risk management. This is a chance to be at the forefront of blockchain technology, shaping financial markets with groundbreaking solutions.

What You’ll Do
• Innovative Development: Lead the design and implementation of a decentralized clearing protocol for crypto derivatives trading, including backend systems and smart contracts.
• System Monitoring: Oversee monitoring, analytics, and reporting of all services you develop, ensuring optimal performance and responsiveness.
• Research and Development: Enhance trading performance through rigorous R&D and testing of the trading system to maintain high quality and reliability.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product and engineering teams to deliver customer-focused solutions while focusing on scalability and internal integrations.

What You Bring
• Proven Experience: 5+ years in backend engineering, building products from ideation to launch within a strong engineering team.
• Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge and experience with modern programming languages like Python, Golang, or C++.
• Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of financial markets with experience in trading systems and quantitative finance.
• Analytical Skills: Excellent problem-solving abilities, with strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
• Communication Proficiency: Outstanding communication and collaboration skills, essential for working across functions.

Your Perks & Benefits
• Competitive Pay: Top-tier compensation in the industry.
• Generous PTO: Unlimited vacation.
• Full Benefits: Comprehensive packages tailored by country.
• Technology & Learning Allowances: 3,500 USD for your first-year setup, $2,000 USD refresh every 2 years, plus $1,000 USD annually for learning and development.

Paradigm is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Senior Analytics Developer - Data Platform, Quant Analytics, Java, Python
description:

Responsibilities

• Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

title: Enterprise Sales - Junior Client Quant Developer (Excel & Python), Desktop Build Group - Singapore | Singapore, SG
description:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight. We use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. To ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Desktop Build Group (DBG) works closely with Bloomberg's existing and prospective clients to find solutions to business needs using Bloomberg's API for Excel and Python. Last year we delivered over 2500 projects to clients and our API solutions on the Bloomberg Terminal are used by over 120,000 financial professionals. We are a global team with colleagues based in London, New York, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney.

What's the role?
You will use your financial markets knowledge to consult with Bloomberg clients or prospective clients, helping them to develop and implement their investment strategies and research on leveraging our Excel APIs, VBA, our cutting edge query language (BQL) and Python based quant platform (BQuant Desktop).
You'll directly impact our revenue by working closely with our Sales teams to develop new tactical desktop applications to sell Bloomberg Terminals. Your role will involve full life-cycle development, from initial demos to prospective clients, requirement gathering, prototyping, implementation, deployment and adoption. In addition to software development, you will be expected to create resources and client-facing content that is both strategic in its appeal to our audience, while also taking advantage of current events in the marketplace.

We'll trust you to:

• Partner with Sales teams to build tactical Excel, Python, Power BI, and BQuant solutions to increase revenue opportunities for the company
• Provide assistance on new strategies or migration projects the clients wish to implement by using Bloomberg APIs
• Work on projects to provide short-term product gap solutions for the Bloomberg Terminal
• Provide continued support for clients to ensure adoption of BQuant Desktop
• Maintain and support Excel models accessible via the Bloomberg Terminal
• Work closely with our Product Development and Software Engineering teams to help drive improvements to our Excel APIs
Training and team support will allow you to gain:

• In depth knowledge of the Terminal and Bloomberg APIs
• A deep understanding of financial markets and investment processes on both buy-side and sell-side
• Experience of open source Python technologies for advanced data visualizations, widgets and analytics
You'll need to have:

• Minimum 3 years of experience working in financial services or a financial technology company
• Experience developing financial models using MS Excel/Python
• Experience in pitching or providing support on quant products / research to external clients
• Financial markets knowledge and exposure to one or more asset class (Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities, FX, etc.)
• A strategic mindset and proven commercial acumen which allows you to weigh up the business opportunities of a project before execution
• Confidence to have highly articulate and consultative interactions with clients
• Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation
• Strong presentation and communication skills in English
• Bachelor's degree or degree equivalent qualifications
We'd love to see:

• Experience or qualifications in Data Science
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/products/bloomberg-terminal/research/bquant/

Why Bloomberg?
We're individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We're interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

Learn more about our office and benefits:
Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore

Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, you'll need to have legal authorisation to work full-time in Singapore, without Bloomberg sponsoring your work authorization, to be considered for this role.

title: Software Engineer Intern, AI/LLM Initiative
description:
WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.

WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.

Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.

Project Overview

Join our AI/LLM initiative, a pioneering project focused on integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) with WorldQuant's strategy management tools. As an intern, you will contribute to building a platform that offers AI-assisted insights and automates tasks for Portfolio Managers. This is an opportunity to work on foundational infrastructure, data pipelines, and user-facing AI applications.

Role Summary

We are looking for an enthusiastic Intern Software Engineer to support the AI/LLM initiative team. You will assist in various aspects of the software development lifecycle, including development, testing, documentation, and data analysis. A key aspect of this role will involve supporting the deployment of new tools and providing assistance to end-users, particularly Portfolio Managers, during the installation and initial usage phases. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience with Python, API development, financial data systems, tool deployment processes, and cutting-edge AI technologies within a leading quantitative investment firm.

Key Responsibilities
• Assist senior developers in the design, development, and testing of MCP server components and tools using Python.
• Contribute to the enhancement of existing tools, potentially including our internal command-line data access tools, by addressing smaller bugs or implementing specific features under guidance.
• Support the development of new MCPs by working on well-defined modules or tasks.
• Facilitate the deployment of newly developed tools and software packages to user environments.
• Collaborate with Portfolio Managers and other end-users to guide them through tool installation processes and provide initial user support.
• Participate in unit testing and integration testing efforts, helping to ensure software quality.
• Assist in data validation and reconciliation tasks for strategy metrics and features.
• Help create and update technical documentation for MCPs, related systems, and user guides.
• Support the investigation of data sources and assist in finalizing data specifications.
• Collaborate with the team on debugging and troubleshooting technical issues
• Gain exposure to financial data concepts (PnL, risk) and quantitative trading systems.

Qualifications

Core Skills
• Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related technical field.
• Basic to intermediate proficiency in Python programming.
• Understanding of software development principles and methodologies.
• Familiarity with data structures and algorithms.

Domain-Specific Knowledge (Beneficial but not required, strong willingness to learn is key)
• Interest in finance, quantitative trading, or financial data.
• Basic understanding of APIs and data formats like JSON or CSV.

Technical Environment Familiarity (Helpful)
• Experience with Linux or a similar Unix-like operating system.
• Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
• Basic understanding of software deployment concepts.

Soft Skills
• Strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
• Eagerness to learn and a proactive attitude.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to assist technical and non-technical users.
• Good teamwork skills.
• Attention to detail.

Internship Duration
• Full time for a period of 4 to 6 months starting Aug 2025

title: Senior Software Engineer  Equities Electronic Trading Engines
description:
Citi Equities Technology is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our APAC Equities Electronic Trading Engines team. This team plays a crucial role in developing and maintaining Citi's cutting-edge, low-latency execution platform in the APAC region, specializing in Algorithmic Trading, Smart Order Routing (SOR), and our Matching Engine.

In this role, you will be responsible for the design, development, and delivery of the next generation of this critical platform. This involves collaborating closely with a talented team of developers and working with product development, other technology teams, production support, and quality assurance. A strong understanding of and alignment with the global strategy is essential for success.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and support the high-performance electronic execution platform.
• Partner with traders, quantitative researchers, and clients on product development.
• Continuously maintain and improve testing frameworks, development tools, and environments.
• Envision, design, and implement test cases for trading functions.
• Contribute to Agile and Continuous Integration processes.
• Build common solutions for trading platform monitoring, trade reconciliation, and application recovery.

Qualifications:
• Minimum 7 years of experience with strong technical knowledge and expertise in Java, C#, or C++.
• Proven experience developing automated trading platforms.
• Python knowledge is a plus.
• Strong understanding of automated testing techniques.
• Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and Continuous Integration processes.
• Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, set goals, and meet deadlines.
• Excellent communication skills with a demonstrable ability to present and grasp complex concepts in a multicultural environment.

title: Campus Quantitative Researcher (Intern)
description:
Jump Trading Group is committed to world class research. We empower exceptional talents in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science to seek scientific boundaries, push through them, and apply cutting edge research to global financial markets. Our culture is unique. Constant innovation requires fearlessness, creativity, intellectual honesty, and a relentless competitive streak. We believe in winning together and unlocking unique individual talent by incenting collaboration and mutual respect. At Jump, research outcomes drive more than superior risk adjusted returns. We design, develop, and deploy technologies that change our world, fund start-ups across industries, and partner with leading global research organizations and universities to solve problems.

Our trading teams are each comprised of a dynamic group of traders, quantitative researchers, and engineers who work together to examine the global markets, seeking to understand the complexities of various traded products and exchanges. They leverage their impeccable statistical analysis and data mining skills, using the results of their research to make forecasts and develop profitable predictive trading models.
• Quantitative Researcher, Internship (Singapore/Mumbai)
• Timing of application consideration and interviews will vary to accommodate university timelines. -------------------------------

About the Role:

We build predictive models from big data and develop algorithms to automatically execute trades in dozens of financial exchanges around the world.

At Jump you will have the opportunity to contribute in a blend of three roles – quant researcher / data scientist, trader, and software developer – based on your incoming skills and background, interest and curiosity, and the new skills and industry knowledge that you will learn at Jump.

Our 10-week internship program begins with a training program focused on enhancing your knowledge of trading, programming, and quant research. The training consists of in-house courses and trading simulation developed and delivered by experienced quant researchers, traders, and developers. We have experts from around the firm who will teach you advanced skills in a variety of areas such as Machine Learning, Trading / Market Mechanics, Statistics, R, Python, C++, and our research process.

You will later be coached to successfully apply those skills during rotations with trading teams and research projects with mentorship from experienced quants/traders. You will help build predictive models, leveraging one of the largest supercomputers in the world, and devise automated trading strategies to test in the markets against world-class competition. Other duties as assigned or needed.

Who Should Apply?

We are seeking the sharpest analytical minds from top undergraduate and graduate programs. Ideal candidates have an uncommon drive to learn and improve, an entrepreneurial spirit, and strong skills in programming and/or quantitative analysis (statistics, data mining, mathematics, machine learning, etc.).

No prior knowledge of finance or trading is necessary. We’ll give you the training that you’ll need.

Reliable and predictable availability required.

Although we strongly value training in Computer Science and Mathematics, we are excited to meet people with exceptional achievements in any technical discipline. Recent hires include students from fields such as Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Neuroscience, Materials Science, Operations Research, and more.

If you have outstanding skills in math and programming and you are curious about the challenge of improving research with daily feedback from competitive markets, we hope you’ll apply.

title: Engineering Lead​/Quant Investment Firm
description:
Position: Engineering Lead (Quant Investment Firm)

Our client is a global investment manager that blends cutting-edge technology, data science, and quantitative research to drive performance in today's most competitive markets.

We're hiring a hands-on Engineering Lead to drive the evolution of our Order Gateway platform - the critical bridge connecting our trading strategies to global exchanges and brokers.

The Opportunity:

Lead a team of sharp, high-performance engineers building and refining ultra-reliable, low-latency order gateways used across global markets and asset classes. You'll own the full engineering lifecycle, influence architectural direction, and play a pivotal role in advancing the trading infrastructure.

What You'll Do:
• Lead the design, development, and delivery of high-performance Order Gateway solutions
• Partner with traders, strategy teams, and global stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical execution
• Drive architecture, code reviews, and full-stack engineering best practices
• Optimize performance and ensure rock-solid reliability across our systems
• Foster a culture of growth - mentor, coach, and elevate your team
• Collaborate with Tech Ops to provide L2 support where needed

What you Bring:
• 5+ years of leading technology or technical teams within high-stakes, low-latency environments
• Deep knowledge of data structures, network programming, Linux systems
• Proficiency in Python and scripting for tooling and automation
• A track record of shipping production-grade systems under pressure
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Bonus Points For:
• Advanced degree in Computer Engineering or Math
• Experience with exchange connectivity protocols
• Financial markets knowledge (equities, derivatives, etc.)
• Familiarity with performance tuning, profiling, and latency optimization

This is greenfield innovation and technical leadership at the heart of a global quant powerhouse. You'll be working alongside some of the brightest minds in quant, engineering systems that directly impact performance and profit. Contact me if you are interested!
