description: JOB DESCRIPTION If you are passionate about commodities market and excel in dynamic global team environment, you have found the right team. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

title: Principal/Senior Quantitative Trader (D1)
description:
Who We Are

At OKX, we believe that the future will be reshaped by crypto, and ultimately contribute to every individual's freedom. OKX is a leading crypto exchange, and the developer of OKX Wallet, giving millions access to crypto trading and decentralized crypto applications (dApps). OKX is also a trusted brand by hundreds of large institutions seeking access to crypto markets. We are safe and reliable, backed by our Proof of Reserves. Across our multiple offices globally, we are united by our core principles: We Before Me, Do the Right Thing, and Get Things Done. These shared values drive our culture, shape our processes, and foster a friendly, rewarding, and diverse environment for every OK-er. OKX is part of OKG, a group that brings the value of Blockchain to users around the world, through our leading products OKX, OKX Wallet, OKLink and more.

About The Opportunity

A world-leading rapid growth digital asset trading firm is looking for a systematic trader to manage quantitative trading strategies and help improve the in-house trading and risk management platform. The firm has presence in major cryptocurrency exchanges and it trades different kinds of products in the market, ranging from spot to structural products. The firm is highly tech-driven with people from top-tier investment banks, hedge funds, and tech companies.

What You’ll Be Doing
• Make markets for delta1 instruments such as spots, swaps and futures in crypto market.
• Manage systematic trading strategies such as CEX/DEX arbitrage.
• Conduct research on alpha signals and backtesting to enhance the profitability of trading strategies.
• Work with developers to build and drive the continual improvement of the world-class risk management and trading tools.

What We Look For In You
• Degree in a relevant area (Mathematics/Physics/Engineering/Computer Science/Finance) from a top university.
• Proven records in systematic trading including market making and other systematic trading strategies.
• Deep understanding of cryptocurrency delta1 products and basic knowledge of the cryptocurrency product is a plus.
• Proficient in at least one programming language (Python/Java/RUST/C++).
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and make rational decisions under pressure.
• Good communication skills.

What We Offer
• World-class connections to major cryptocurrency exchanges and ultra-low latency trading system.
• User friendly strategy containers enable very easy and fast implementation, backtesting, and deployment of trading strategies.
• Top notch quant development team providing support in state-of-the-art infrastructure, robust strategy implementations, and data service.
• A chance to work and exchange ideas with brilliant ex-banking/ex-fund traders from various backgrounds.
• Very competitive remuneration package structure.

Perks & Benefits
• Competitive total compensation package
• L&D programs and Education subsidy for employees' growth and development
• Various team building programs and company events
• Wellness and meal allowances
• Comprehensive healthcare schemes for employees and dependants
• More that we love to tell you along the process!

title: Senior Trader
description:

Trade a broad range of financial products on multiple exchanges using internally developed trading models and state-of-the-art low latency technology. Research and develop new trading strategies to capitalize on anomalies in the market.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities for this Position:

- Price and trade financial products across various markets and asset classes, including

futures, equities, ETFs, FX, and cryptocurrencies

- Manage positions and formulate innovative trading strategies

- Continuously analyse the risk of positions

- Collaborate with other world-class traders, developers, and technologists to improve the

firm’s trading methods and models

Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge Required:

- Excellent numerical/analytical skills and affinity for trading and global financial markets

- Financial experience is a plus, but not required

- Bachelor’s degree, ideally in Business, Economics, Finance, or other quantitative majors

such as Mathematics, Physics, or Engineering

- Practical Python programming experience and superior knowledge of Excel

- Competitive, outgoing, and fast decision-making skills under pressure

- Critical and independent thinking skills

- Logical problem solver with the ability to quickly understand new, complex concepts

- Pragmatic self-starter with a flexible can-do mentality

- Clear communication skills in English

title: Equity Trader
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

The Trader is responsible for timely, accurate and whole life-cycle execution of equity and equity derivatives of different levels of complexity. The candidate is expected to have the sophistication and ability to communicate effectively within the trading and portfolio management teams. The role will also assist in portfolio reporting and data organization.
• Execute and manage trades at all levels of liquidity, complexity and size, and promptly provide market color to Portfolio Managers
• Follow through entire trading life-cycle, including clearance and settlement coordination with counterparties, to ensure the execution is accurate and complete
• Work with senior trader and Portfolio Managers to ensure trading objectives are met
• Assist to monitor and evaluate execution performance across multiple dimensions (i.e., including country, trading venue, broker, strategy, trader, execution strategy, portfolio, etc.) using in-house and third-party transaction cost analysis
• Communicate with other departments (Portfolio Management, Research, Technology, and Operations) to facilitate the implementation of cross-functional initiatives related to technology, compliance, workflow, and portfolio research
• Monitor the settlement process and liaise with the global offices of counter parties
• Perform research tasks and other projects as assigned by the Investment Team
• Open to covering trading shifts during the day and early night

Expectations
• Minimum 3 years of execution experience or equivalent
• Experience working with Equities/TRS or demonstrable knowledge thereof
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to operate and prioritize in a fast-moving & demanding environment and deal with complex situations
• Knowledge of execution analytics, trading strategies, and risk management techniques
• Experience working within a Trading department

Qualifications
• A minimum of a bachelor’s degree or relevant experience ideally in a quantitative subject
• A minimum of 3 years of financial services experience
• Familiar with at least one Trading Management System
• Must be strong in data analytics and versed with Excel/other similar data tools

title: Fixed Income and Derivatives Trader
description:
Manulife is a leading international financial services provider for financial advice, insurance as well as wealth and asset management, established since 1887. Our strong investment management expertise and capability has been developed over the years and spans a wide range of asset classes and geographies. We operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States.

The Asia General Account Investment function serves as the in-house investment manager for all of Manulife’s Asia Segment’s USD 120 billion of life insurance company assets. The team directs investment of funds backing insurance reserves amongst different asset classes and investment managers. It has direct responsibility managing over half of total Asia Segment’s assets in equities, bonds, mortgages, alternatives and derivatives and it oversees the investment management and performance of assets outsourced to Manulife Investment Management Public and Private Markets and other external managers. The team seeks to generate superior risk adjusted returns to support insurance product competitiveness and shareholder value.

The Asia General Account Trading team consists of trading professionals based in Hong Kong and Singapore that primarily supports the trading function of Manulife’s Asia General Account’s investment portfolio. The team works closely with the Fixed Income Portfolio Management team and is an integral part of Manulife’s investment process and provides market intelligence, investment hedging consultation, trade execution and counterparty management to achieve Manulife’s investment objectives.

The team is seeking an energetic team player to support the growing investment portfolio of Asia General Account Investments. Beyond supporting the Investments function, the Fixed Income and Derivatives Trader will also work closely with ALM, Products and Risk functions to achieve desired risk mitigation and investment return objectives by providing solutions and market intelligence to the various functional teams.

In addition, the Fixed Income and Derivatives Trader is responsible for the monitoring and maintenance of Manulife’s Variable Annuity Hedging (VAH) program. The VAH program is a risk monitoring program designed to manage the firm’s risk against variable annuity investment returns. The incumbent, along with the rest of the trading team, will partner with Manulife’s Toronto trading desk to monitor and rebalance the program 24/5.

Much of the work will involve making business decisions in real time. The Fixed Income and Derivatives Trader must be able to analyze the trade-offs inherent in a volatile and complex market against the desired investment and risk objectives. In this role, the incumbent will have the opportunity to learn and execute a wide variety of financial instruments and is encouraged to be creative and pragmatic to achieve best outcome for the firm and directly contribute to the company’s overall success.

Responsibilities:
• Execute fixed income (sovereigns, public credits) and derivatives trades (rates, repos, FX, futures, equity index options) for Asia General Account Investments.
• Monitor the dynamic risk exposure of the Variable Annuity Hedging programs and execute rebalancing orders (futures, IRS, equity index options).
• Manage counterparty onboarding and assess broker capabilities to ensure continued market access and liquidity to carry out Manulife’s investment and risk management objectives.
• Partner with internal stakeholders (Portfolio Managers, Insurance Lifeco teams, ALM, Risk, Compliance, Operations) to provide solutions to investment and risk management hurdles.
• Analyze market trends and share market intelligence to support the overall business.
• Develop new instruments to strengthen Manulife’s investment and risk management capabilities.
• Review and assess best execution strategy for Manulife’s investment and risk management programs.

Knowledge/Skills/Competencies/Education:
• University degree in a quantitative discipline e.g. engineering, math, science or economics / finance.
• 1-3 years of experience in a financial services environment. Experience working with derivatives products is a plus.
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills to build and maintain relationships and partnerships across the organization and with external dealers / counterparties.
• Ability to think strategically by identifying potential or evolving issues and proactively develop solutions.
• Ability to combine qualitative business judgement with quantitative analysis / modelling.
• Programming ability is a plus.
• Project management experience a plus.

Tentang Manulife dan John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation adalah penyedia layanan keuangan internasional yang membantu memudahkan keputusan dan membuat hidup lebih baik bagi nasabah. Untuk mempelajari lebih lanjut tentang kami, kunjungi https://www.manulife.co.id.

Manulife adalah Perusahaan dengan Kesetaraan Kesempatan Kerja

Di Manulife/John Hancock, kita merayakan keragaman. Kita berusaha menarik, mengembangkan, dan mempertahankan tenaga kerja yang sama beragamnya dengan nasabah yang kita layani dan untuk mengembangkan lingkungan kerja inklusif yang menerima kekuatan budaya dan individu. Kita berkomitmen untuk melaksanakan rekrutmen, retensi, peningkatan, dan kompensasi secara adil, dan kita mengatur semua praktik dan program tanpa adanya diskriminasi. Baik itu diskriminasi karena ras, keturunan, tempat asal, warna kulit, asal etnis, kewarganegaraan, agama atau keyakinan agama, kepercayaan, jenis kelamin (termasuk kehamilan dan kondisi terkait kehamilan), orientasi seksual, karakteristik genetika, status veteran, identitas gender, ekspresi gender, usia, status pernikahan, status keluarga, disabilitas, maupun alasan lain yang dilindungi oleh hukum yang berlaku.

Menyediakan akses hubungan kerja yang adil merupakan prioritas utama kita. Seorang perwakilan Human Resources akan bekerja dengan pelamar yang meminta akomodasi yang wajar selama proses lamaran kerja. Seluruh informasi yang dibagikan selama proses permohonan akomodasi akan disimpan dan digunakan dengan cara yang sesuai dengan hukum dan kebijakan Manulife/John Hancock yang berlaku. Untuk meminta akomodasi yang wajar dalam proses lamaran kerja, silakan hubungi recruitment@manulife.com.

title: Options Trader
description:
QCP is Asia's leading digital asset partner, empowering clients to seamlessly integrate digital assets into their portfolios.

We offer a comprehensive range of solutions - from spot on/off ramping and fixed income strategies to vanilla options and bespoke exotics.

Driven by the vision to be the most trusted partner in digital asset markets, we provide innovative solutions that make digital assets a core component of every portfolio, balance sheet, and treasury.

Since our founding in 2017, we have witnessed the potential of digital assets to transform financial markets and the world at large. We exist at the centre of change, successfully navigating three market cycles and bridging institutional and crypto ecosystems.

We work to build trusted partnerships, putting client success and care at the heart of everything that we do.

Responsibilities

Our options trading team is the global leader in crypto options, renowned for its cutting-edge strategies, deep market insights, and innovative approach to financial markets. As a leader in the global trading space, our team thrives on collaboration, data-driven decision making, and a relentless pursuit of excellence. We are at the forefront of options trading, utilizing advanced technology, sophisticated models, and a deep understanding of market dynamics to drive superior performance across all asset classes.

Our desk is comprised of top-tier professionals with diverse backgrounds in trading, quantitative analysis, and risk management, all united by a shared passion for financial markets and a commitment to pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Our team of traders work in shifts to provide a 24hr service, 365 days a year to this vibrant and exciting market.

Responsibilities
• Price and execute option trades.
• Manage the risks in the portfolio, and ensure that it complies with limits imposed on it
• Able to engage with stakeholders to explain trade strategies and new products
• Given the nature of the market, to be amenable to working shifts

Requirements
• Has an excellent understanding of options/derivatives trading
• Has 2 - 7yrs of experience in derivative market making and risk taking.
• Experience in Equity or FX would be an advantage.
• Programming experience will also be a plus

The ideal candidate will:
• Be an option market maker (preferably experiences in trading both OTC and exchange listed options) and business builder.
• Have strong track record of delivering trading revenue via high touch vanilla and exotic option products.
• A self starter and collaborator when it comes to generating trade ideas and working with sales teams to expand our product offerings.
• Comfortable interactiing with quant developers and researchers to design, build, and innovate new pricing, trading, and risk management systems.
• Be experienced in management level analysis and reporting of data sets from complex risk models.

Benefits

The Environment We Offer

As a growing firm with a tightly-knit team, we respect and listen to all our employees. You will get the chance to make an impact by having your voice heard by everyone, including the management.

Our employees enjoy a high level of autonomy at work. We focus on substance, not form - as long as you can perform, you will be recognized and rewarded. We are also dedicated to supporting our staff and ensuring they develop holistically to maximize their potential in the long- term.

We also provide flexible working arrangement as required and a casual and fun environment to boot!

title: Group Treasury Funding Trader
description:
Singapore

Finance

Group Functions

Job Reference #

308682BR

City

Singapore

Job Type

Full Time

Your role

Are you keen on following the markets and working in a global team? Do you have good basic understanding of funding and risk management?

We’re looking for someone like that who can:
• perform cash management on APAC currencies and funding for APAC entities;
• ensure that UBS and its subsidiaries and businesses are funded in line with the liquidity risk appetite of the Group and maintains internal fund transfer pricing curves;
• contribute to the planning and execution of our global funding strategy through issuance of long and short term debt in the region;
• work and collaborate with colleagues locally, regionally and globally across different functions to enhance systems and improve processes;
• manage broad range of risks, including but not limited to trading risk, execution risk, operational risk and compliance risk;
• follow regulations and internal policies, including quality of execution, pricing, hedging, trading limits and compliance policies.

Your team

You’ll be working in the Funding Management (FM) team within Group Treasury (GT) in Singapore. Group Treasury is responsible for the execution of Liquidity & Funding risk management as well as managing the risks of the firm's structural Cash, Rates and FX positions to maximize the financial returns generated. GT is part of Group CFO which sits under Group Functions.

The regional FM APAC team spans across 4 locations in Singapore, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Sydney. You will be working closely with both the regional and global GT teams, covering global funding responsibilities as well. Additionally, we offer rotation opportunities to juniors in other areas of GT (e.g. ALM Strategy) where you will be cross trained into other areas of ALM to get a holistic view of how GT manages various balance sheet risks.

Your expertise
• degree education or equivalent in a financial or analytical subject would be desirable
• basic knowledge of Fixed Income and OTC derivatives products e.g. Money Market, FX Swaps
• good understanding of regulatory environment, specifically in funding, capital and liquidity a plus
• prior work experience in a financial industry. Experience in trading and risk management a plus
• knowledge /experience in Excel analytics, PowerBi, Python or market data applications a plus.=
• a critical thinker capable of understanding complex numerical and analytical processes with attention to detail
• self-starter, as well as a committed team player with good interpersonal skills and enjoy the challenges of a fast-paced environment
• able to work under pressure and quickly assess the risk vs. reward of a trade/decision

About us

UBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

How we hire

We may request you to complete one or more assessments during the application process. Learn more

Join us

At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Contact Details

UBS Business Solutions SA
UBS Recruiting

Disclaimer / Policy statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Commercial & Investment Bank – G10 FX Option Trader – Vice President
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Are you ready to make an impact in the fast-paced world of FX trading? As a FX Option Trader within our Global FX Options team, you will play a crucial role in market-making, risk management, and client engagement across Asia. This position offers exciting career growth opportunities and the chance to work with a talented team in Singapore.

As a Vice President in our Global FX Options team, you will be responsible for providing liquidity to our global client franchise, including hedge funds, banks, asset managers, and corporates. You will manage risk exposures, develop trading strategies, and partner with sales teams to deliver value to our clients. Your role will also involve mentoring junior traders and contributing to the team's success in Asia.

Job Responsibilities:
• Provide liquidity to the global client franchise, including hedge funds, banks, asset managers, and corporates.
• Monitor and manage risk exposures, applying best-in-class risk disciplines and practices.
• Formulate, review, and execute macro trading strategies in partnership with FXO traders globally.
• Collaborate with sales teams to understand client needs and provide trade ideas and hedging solutions.
• Mentor and develop junior traders through active tutelage and guidance.

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field.
• 5 years of FX options trading experience with an investment bank.
• Proven track record of successful market-making and client engagement.
• Strong analytical skills and proficiency with trading concepts.
• Deep knowledge of option theory and practices.
• Excellent communication skills for horizontal and vertical interactions.

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills:
• Experience trading FX and/or fixed income exotic and hybrid products.
• Proficient knowledge of JPY fixed-income markets.

ABOUT US

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

ABOUT THE TEAM

J.P. Morgan’s Commercial & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets, securities services and payments. Corporations, governments and institutions throughout the world entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Commercial & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

title: Systematic Trader (Proprietary LLM/AI) – Dubai | Lead & Build | Tax-Free
description:
At RGG Capital, we are seeking an experienced Systematic Trader (5+ years) to spearhead the development and execution of quantitative strategies within a new, dedicated trading function at RGG Capital HQ in Dubai. This role offers a unique opportunity to lead, innovate with proprietary AI, and build a significant trading operation backed by patient, long-term capital. Learn more about us: https://rgg.capital/

Reporting directly to the CEO and leading a Quantitative Analyst, you will be instrumental in deploying high-frequency, event-driven trading strategies across commodities and equities. Your core analytical advantage will be unique alpha signals generated from our proprietary Large Language Model (LLM) technology.

Why This Role Presents a Unique Opportunity:
• Define the Edge with Proprietary LLM: Collaborate directly with our AI/ML research team to refine, iterate, and enhance the alpha-generating capabilities of our unique LLM. Your insights will be critical in shaping our technological and trading advantage.
• Build, Lead & Scale with Impact: Assume responsibility for an initial $10M+ book with a clear framework for capital scaling based on performance. Lead a Quantitative Analyst and directly influence the architecture and growth of our systematic trading capability.
• Direct CEO Access & Focused Operational Environment: Benefit from direct strategic alignment with our CEO within a discreet, focused environment conducive to rigorous quantitative work, free from common external fund management pressures.
• Exceptional Tax-Free Rewards & Comprehensive Relocation: Competitive Salary: AED 50,000 - AED 65,000 per month (tax-free), complemented by a performance bonus structure (e.g., directly linked to P&L – details provided to qualified candidates). Full Relocation to Dubai: Including flights, visa sponsorship, and initial accommodation.
• Cutting-Edge Infrastructure & Resources: Operate within an agile setup with access to high-performance computing, sophisticated analytical tools, and the necessary resources for deploying and optimizing low-latency strategies.

Key Responsibilities & Strategic Objectives:
• Strategy & Alpha Generation: Translate LLM-derived signals into robust, profitable trading strategies; continuously research and implement enhancements to alpha and execution quality.
• Portfolio & Risk Management: Manage and scale a $10M+ systematic portfolio, implementing and refining advanced risk controls appropriate for HFT environments.
• Algorithm Optimization: Drive the evolution of trading algorithms to minimize transaction costs (slippage, latency) and maximize performance.
• LLM Feedback & Iteration: Provide critical, data-driven feedback to the AI/ML team to systematically improve the LLM's predictive accuracy and signal efficacy.
• Team Leadership & Development: Mentor and guide a Quantitative Analyst, fostering a culture of rigorous research, quantitative discipline, and high performance.

Candidate Profile: Qualifications & Experience:

Required:
• Minimum 5 years of experience as a Systematic Trader with a verifiable track record of P&L generation in commodities and/or equities.
• Deep expertise in quantitative technical analysis and the full lifecycle of algorithmic trading (HFT/low-latency development, backtesting, deployment, and optimization).
• Demonstrated experience managing and scaling systematic trading portfolios of $10M+ with sophisticated risk management frameworks.
• Advanced proficiency in Python, R, or a similar language for quantitative research, advanced backtesting, and algorithm development.
• Expertise in real-time risk monitoring, mitigation techniques, and statistical performance analysis for systematic strategies.
• Strong capability to collaborate effectively with, and provide precise, actionable insights to, AI/ML research teams.

Preferred:
• Experience in building or significantly scaling a systematic trading desk or a new suite of strategies.
• Direct market microstructure knowledge in energy, agriculture, or specific large-cap equity markets.
• Master’s or PhD in a relevant quantitative field (e.g., Financial Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science).

Our Commitment: Skills-First, Transparent Hiring Process:

We value demonstrable expertise. Our recruitment process is designed to be efficient, objective, and fair, commencing with a Phase 1 online assessment that allows candidates to showcase their practical skills. This enables us to identify highly capable individuals effectively.

Opportunity to Build a Leading AI-Driven Trading Operation:

If you are a results-oriented systematic trader with a strong interest in making a foundational impact within a well-capitalized, technologically advanced, and innovative trading environment, we encourage you to apply.

If your expertise aligns with this unique opportunity to lead and innovate with proprietary AI in a dynamic Dubai setting, we encourage you to take the next step.

Click "Apply" to submit your profile and participate in our skills-based Phase 1 assessment.

title: Quantitative Strategist (Trader)
description:
About Quant Matter

At Quant Matter, we are an innovative quantitative trading firm specializing in crypto market-making and multi-asset algorithmic trading (including futures, equities, commodities, FX, and digital assets). We develop and deploy high-quality quantitative strategies and predictive signals (alpha) with a focus on sustainable, long-term success in global financial markets. We also seek to continuosly improve our aproach to risk management.Our edge lies in our ability to combine advanced technology, data-driven insights, and market expertise to deliver consistent, high-performance trading.

We are seeking an ambitious and self-driven Quant Trader to establish and manage their own trading desk. This role is ideal for algorithmic traders, but experienced traders without coding skills will also be considered. You must have your own trading strategies

What You’ll Do
• Lead and manage your own trading desk, taking full ownership of your strategies and P&L
• Develop, implement, and continuously enhance Alpha-seeking trading strategies
• Conduct market research to uncover new alpha opportunities
• Test and optimize trading models and algorithms to enhance performance
• Stay on top of market trends and macroeconomic developments that affect your trading strategies
• Implement robust risk management techniques to ensure alignment of strategies with the company's risk tolerance and market conditions
• Collaborate closely with quant researchers, engineers, and traders ensure proper execution as well as to optimize and scale strategies

What We’re Looking For
• A diploma, BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Quantitative Finance is preferred, but all majors are welcome.
• Minimum 2 years of experience trading one or more asset classes, including Equities, Options, Futures, Forex, or Crypto.
• Familiarity with markets such as the US, KRX, JPX, Australia, China, and cryptocurrencies.
• Preferably 3+ years of experience in the financial industry.
• Strong Proficiency in major programming languages such as Python, C++, Java, or Matlab
• Strong skills in quantitative analysis and model development.
• Ability to implement complex trading algorithms
• Ability to adapt to fast-changing markets and adjust to trading strategies as the market changes
• A self-motivated mindset with a strong problem-solving attitude.
• Proven trading track record.
• Broad understanding of macroeconomic drivers in financial markets.
• Passion for algorithmic and high-frequency trading (HFT).

Bonus Points For
• Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT) strategies
• Expertise in risk management and execution systems
• Track record in building and scaling trading strategies

What Else is Waiting for You?
• Unlimited upside commission based on performance.
• Career growth opportunities, including the ability to grow and scale your trading desk as you see fit.
• Work on the cutting edge of financial technology.
• access to a global trading network
• A collaborative and supportive team environment.
• Hands-on experience in a multi-cultural and dynamic workplace.
• Enhance your technical skills and capital market knowledge

If you are a motivated quant trader with a proven track record and an entrepreneurial spirit, we want to hear from you!

Ready to Join? Apply Now!

Send your resume, P&L track record, and a brief summary of your trading approach to fikri@quantmatter.com or click the 'Apply' Button.

description:

Job Description

The Trader Midpros, Asia will be responsible for leading ADM’s strategic and commercial efforts in the midprotein segment across key Asian markets. This includes identifying growth opportunities, building strategic partnerships, managing product portfolios, and driving business development across the region.

Your Responsibilities

Market Strategy & Growth
• Develop and execute the go-to-market strategy for midproteins in Asia aligned with global business objectives.

Driving Regional Midpro Trade

• Represent ADM in regional industry forums and customer engagements.

Your Profile

• Minimum 5–7 years of experience in commercial, category management, or product management roles in the commodities trading industry.
• Deep understanding of protein markets.
• Strong knowledge of Asian markets and business environments.
• Proven track record in driving regional growth strategies and commercial success.
• Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and project leadership skills.
• Ability to travel regionally as needed

#ADMHiring

#IncludingYou

Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together.

For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM.

At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. Our breadth, depth, insights, facilities and logistical expertise give us unparalleled capabilities to meet needs for food, beverages, health and wellness, and more. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over. Learn more at www.adm.com.

title: Senior Quantitative Trader/Market Maker
description:
We are a leading full-stack, high-frequency proprietary trading firm strategically located in New York, Taipei, and Singapore. Our company is equipped with a proprietary, latency-sensitive trading system, state-of-the-art trading algorithms, and a highly efficient execution platform, designed to optimize trading strategies across various asset classes. Moreover, we maintain comprehensive access to major exchanges worldwide, allowing us to execute complex trades efficiently and at scale. This global reach, combined with our technological expertise, positions us at the forefront of the financial trading industry.

About the role:

In this role, you will apply mathematical and quantitative methods to evaluate financial products or markets in order to find trading opportunities and calculate risks.

Responsibilties:
• Research DeFi markets, protocols, strategies, and manage a sizeable portfolio.
• Conduct in-depth research on Cefi and/or Defi markets and blockchain data.
• Design and deploy algorithmic trading strategies to the production environment.
• Expand automated trading business to new trading products and venues, calibrate and fine tune the performance.
• Provide reporting on daily market sentiment, risk exposure, P&L.
• Conduct post-trade analysis of trading strategies and algo performance risk mitigation strategies and responsible for portfolio/strategy optimization.

Who you are:
• STEM Degree from a top college or university.
• A quantitative trading strategy that is currently and consistently profitable in any asset classes. (not only in a simulation or back-test environment).
• We are open to small holding periods and mid to high trading frequencies.
• Excellent Return on Capital (ROC) A proven track record (not just back-test data).
• Ideally, experience at a proprietary trading firm, or hedge fund.
• Crypto experience will be a plus but not necessary.
• Must be able to do hands-on coding. It could be in any language of Rust/C++/Golang/Python.

General requirements:
• Candidate must be able to relocate to NYC office or Taipei office in Taiwan.
• For all the roles, 2-3 rounds of coding tests should be expected for 2-3 hours each.
• Excellent written and spoken English, any other languages will be a plus.

Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary
• Semi-annual discretionary bonus
• Relocation assistance if needed
• Dedicated mentors to accelerate your growth
• Fully stocked kitchen
• Unlimited sick days
• Friendly start-up working environment
• 15 days of PTO and 15 days of WFH on an accrual basis.
• Team lunch/ dinner.
• Gym subsidy
• Breakfast catering
• Social events
• Opportunity to visit our global offices

(For NYC candidates, 100,000 - 250,000 USD per year)

Please provide the following when you apply
• Summary of your research and/or trading strategies
• If applicable, whether your trading strategies have been (a) simulated/backtested only, or (b) traded live in production (if the latter, how long trading has been live)
• Your role on the team, and what tools or components you have experience building
• Daily PnL Breakdown
• Capital Allocation, Leverage, and Book Size
• Return % (please specify whether % of GMV or ROC%) Annual PNL (or Average Daily PNL)
• Max Drawdown
• Sharpe Ratio
• Target Volatility
• Holding Period
• Potential for scalability
• Market Capacity

As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title: IB - GEM e-Forward / Quant Trader - VP
description: Job Description: Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank’s Global Emerging Markets (GEM) Asia FX Trading desk is looking to hire a Quant Trader with focus on swaps trading to join its team in Singapore. The ideal candidate combines robust trading intuition with advanced coding, data engineering, and curve-building capabilities to enhance the precision, scalability, and profitability of forward curve management in both deliverable and non-deliverable FX markets. The focus of the role is innovation in quantitative trading, pushing the frontier of our trading sophistication and automation forward. This includes collaborative signal and model research, developing new electronic trading strategies, partnering with our technologists to get those into production, and working with the rest of the trading team to manage the optimisation and evolution of the system What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Your responsibilities will include: FX Forwards Trading & Curve Management Manage E-pricing and risks across FX forward curves and NDFs in Asia EM currencies. Price and hedge FX forward and basis risk with a deep understanding of curve dynamics, central bank liquidity windows, and regulatory impacts. Monitor and manage exposure to cross-currency basis, carry/roll, and volatility risks. Curve Construction & Analytics Design, optimize, and maintain forward curve models incorporating market data, central bank calendars, and local liquidity conditions. Develop tools to monitor dislocations across FX spot, NDF, and deliverable forwards. Automate curve construction, and hedging logic using clean, production-level code. Quantitative Strategy Development: Leverage quantitative techniques (e.g., PCA, spline fitting, regression models) to identify trading signals, arbitrage conditions, and risk premia. Collaborate with global quant and tech teams to automate and enhance forward curve analytics. Client & Sales Engagement: Provide market activities and forward curve insights to clients and other internal stakeholders, and support our FX Business Growth initiatives across the franchise. Customize forward structures and hedging solutions across client segments (corporates, asset managers, and sovereign clients). Your skills and experience: For Associate - Minimum 3 years of electronic trading experience in FX Spot, Swaps or (ND)Forwards. For VP - Minimum 5 years of electronic trading experience in FX Spot, Swaps or (ND)Forwards. A solid understanding and practical experience of Machine Learning (ML), including modern deep learning methods. Strong programming skills in python, KDB, Java and C++ Deep Experience in quantitative research, data analysis, timeseries modelling, trading strategy design and creation. Educated to master’s or bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Econometrics, Computer Science or similar subjects. Working knowledge of interest rate instruments, short-term funding markets, and cross-currency basis mechanics. Ability to distil complex technical insights into actionable trading decisions and collaborate across multi-disciplinary teams. Team player with strong communication skills and ability to interact with clients, quants, and senior management. Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply. How we’ll support you: Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do. Deutsche Bank & Diversity We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively. Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group. We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment. For over 150 years, our dedication to being the Global Hausbank for our clients has been driven by our people – in around 60 countries and across more than 150 nationalities. Their deep understanding, insights, expertise, and passion help our clients navigate an increasingly complex world – be it in our Corporate Bank, our Private Bank, our Investment Bank or our Asset Management (DWS) division. Together we can make a great impact for our clients at home and abroad, securing their lasting success and financial security. More information at: Deutsche Bank Careers (db.com)

title: Senior Trader, Base Metals, Book Manager for Base Metals Concentrates
company_name: MITSUBISHI CORPORATION RTM INTERNATIONAL PTE. LTD.
description:
The individual will be reporting to and working closely with Global Head of Base Metals, to support the following activities and responsibilities mainly:
• Profit and Loss for Base Metals Concentrate book of RtMI, managing various risks such as credit, market, legal and operational risk.
• Managing the Base Metals Concentrate book of RtMI, in collaboration with regional heads of RtMJ/RtMA/RtME/RtMB/China and other related offices, to increase the profit of Base Metals trading desk.
• Participate in the planning and design process of the Base Metals Concentrate book’s strategy together with Global Head (and/or General Manager) of Base Metals. Support in leading, executing and implement plans for enhancing the Base Metals Concentrate business.

Responsibilities

1. Team and People Management
• Communicate and implement company strategy and policy with the team members involved in Base Metals Concentrate trading (front/middle offices) and other relevant stakeholders such as trade operation members supporting the Base Metal Concentrates book.
• Set KPIs and targets for individual direct reports in alignment with Divisional KPIs and reviews their performance.
• Monitor and train team employees in all aspects of trading and related procedures as appropriate.
• Ensure effective communication between team members to ensure updated business developments especially in internal stakeholder management (i.e. active leadership role when liaising with and maintaining seamless communication with the headquarters, Mitsubishi Corporation in Japanese.
• Contribute to a positive atmosphere of motivation and encouragement within the trading team.
• Support other RtMI’s entities or RtM Global business in possible cross-commodities activities.
• Ensures that team members are collaborating well with members in corporate teams to realize and manage the business.
• Maintain and build good rapport, relationship with teams globally (including, but not limited to RtMJ/RtMA/RtME/RtMB/China/other related offices and MC Investment Division) and enhances “one-team” spirit across various organizations.

2. Base Metals Concentrates Trading
• Propose and set Divisional KPIs relevant for Base Metals Concentrates with Global Head of Base Metals.
• Maximize Profits and minimize Losses for Base Metals Concentrates trades on a Global basis, working closely with the corporate teams to manage various types of risks such as credit, market, legal and operational risk.
• Hold regular meetings with all entities and communicate with Heads of Department/Division and front office members from time to time, to capture the market status, business, and customers’ status in each region. Any internal application/report in need should be consulted / discussed before going to Global Head and GM of Base Metals.
• Handle the internal application/reports related to Base Metals (such as Gendo application, new transactions) in need for RtMI side (explanation to Global Head of Base Metals, application to EXECO cooperating with each entity.)
• Checks and approves the pre-deal arrangements (KYC/STC, partner code registration, Gendo application of Credit, Warehouse) and the deals (sales/purchase contracts, warehouse agreements etc).
• Monitors and ensure contracts and approval audit trails are well organized and documented.
• Develop and maintain relationships with industrial players (suppliers/customers/traders) to enhance trading capabilities based on existing business priorities.

3. Risk Management
• Monitor trading limit and ensure all the members trade within limits set and comply with internal rules.
• Ensure that risk is managed within the designated limit and make efforts to always minimize such risk.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with the risk management division to prepare and complete all credit line applications (including warehouse credit lines) and resolve issues with Credit Insurers in a timely manner.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with legal and compliance division and prepare the drafts of various special and ordinary contract clauses / agreements.
• Supervise team members to liaise with Legal and Compliance Department and prepare, modify company contracts and check counterparty contracts, amend documents as and when necessary.

4. Support Strategy Design and Provide Analysis
• Contribute ideas to Global Head by providing operations Analysis and Strategy planning: Conduct an in-depth analysis of Base Metals Concentrate activities in collaboration with regional heads where necessary. This includes studying the business models, market demands, forecasting industry and market trends. Ensures smooth integration of operations from mining to the end-user.
• Based on the analysis, design the team strategy relevant to Base Metals Concentrate together with Global Head and/or General Manager of Base Metals.
• Support Global Head/General Manager in Strategy Execution: Initiate, execute and implement the strategy designed especially those for enhancing the global procurement of Base Metals.

Required Knowledge and Experience
• Degree in business-related fields, and/or economics and mathematics.
• At least 6-8 years of relevant working experience in physical and paper trading of Base Metal Concentrates, as well as futures markets including hedging and position management.
• At least 2-3 years of relevant experience managing a team and proven people management skills.
• Good freight exposure/knowledge and knowledge of handling Bill of Lading, Letter of Credit and Bills for Collections, etc.
• Good knowledge & experience of offtake arrangements, paper markets, hedging and traded markets.
• Proven and balanced commercial decision-making skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills as well as influencing and negotiation skills.
• Advance knowledge of insurance, import duties, indirect tax such as VAT, GST etc and compliance.
• Business level proficiency in both English and Japanese (written and spoken) will be mandatory as the individual will be required to communicate with Mitsubishi Corporation’s Tokyo headquarters frequently and facilitate collaboration between the two regions.
• Business proficiency in Chinese is preferred but not mandatory for communication with counterparties.
• Ability to work under pressure and prioritize work.
• Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to details.
• Excellent PC skills – advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office as well as trading systems, and willingness to learn new systems.
• Excellent time management skills.

title: Carbon Trader
description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 Expertises:
• Asset management
• Energy transition services
• Energy supply & global commodities
• Risk management & market access

At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The APAC Green Solutions team in S&EM plays a critical role in originating, negotiating, and securing contracts to drive value and manage revenue streams for ENGIE renewables portfolio and developing strategies to optimize the APAC generation portfolio. Role:

As a Carbon Trader, you will report to the Head of BP APAC. The role is a permanent post to be based in Singapore. You will contribute to the fulfillment of the missions APAC Green Products Trading team requiring collaboration with Engie’s GMA team, commercial functions and support function staff.

Hard Skills:
• Having prior carbon trading experiences, in particular, carbon, EUA and EUA option markets.
• Building and leading EUA flat price and option trading activities from scratch, including pricing options for client flow, as well as trading prop EUA book.
• Being fully accountable for book PnL within the agreed risk framework, including VaR, drawdown and delta limits.
• Leading the development on new markets for carbon markets trading activities, such as voluntary & compliance carbon products, and transition carbon offsets etc.
• Exploring opportunities to trade EUA structure products for Asian clients activities.
• Holding expertise center for APAC region all carbon markets product front.

Soft skills:
• Quantitative analysis skills, preferably with the experience in Energy or Carbon Commodity markets.
• An effective team player and passionate about Energy Markets.
• Innovative and strong initiative to work independently under minimal supervision, a true self starter
• Strong Mathematical capability, attention to detail and problem solver.
• Proactive, and creative thinker
• Willingness to explore and learn about new markets and products with initiatives
• Team player

Education and professional background:
• University Degree in Business, Finance, Management, Economics or Engineering highly preferred.
• Minimum 5 years of carbon trading experiences with track record

Languages:
• English

Travels:
• Singapore – Asia Square Tower 1

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - BP ASIA PACIFIC

Legal Entity: ENGIE ENERGY MARKETING SINGAPORE PTE LTD

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree

title: Senior / Oil Trader

description:
A well-established trading firm located inSingapore is seeking a Senior / Oil Traderonpermanentposition.

Responsibilities:
• Support senior traders in conducting market research and analysis to identify trading opportunities and trends in the oil and gas market. Monitor supply and demand dynamics, geopolitical developments, and price movements of energy commodities.
• Assist in executing trades, including buying and selling oil and gas products, negotiating prices, and arranging logistics for product delivery. Follow established trading strategies and risk management protocols to optimize trading performance.
• Manage trade orders and ensure timely and accurate execution of trades. Coordinate with internal teams, counterparties, and logistics providers to facilitate the smooth flow of trade transactions.
• Assist in monitoring and managing trading risks, including market risk, credit risk, and operational risk. Adhere to risk limits and guidelines set by the trading desk and compliance department.
• Maintain accurate records of trade transactions, contracts, and related documentation. Prepare trade confirmations, invoices, and reports for internal use and regulatory compliance purposes.
• Build and maintain relationships with counterparties, brokers, and other stakeholders in the oil and gas industry. Communicate effectively with clients and vendors to address inquiries, resolve issues, and foster long-term partnerships.
• Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies governing trading activities. Stay updated on relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards affecting energy trading operations.
• Assist in analyzing trading performance and evaluating the effectiveness of trading strategies. Identify areas for improvement and contribute ideas to enhance trading profitability and efficiency.
• Continuously seek opportunities for learning and professional development in the field of energy trading and the oil and gas industry. Stay informed about market trends, industry developments, and new trading technologies/tools.

• Handle the internal application/reports related to Base Metals (such as Gendo application, new transactions) in need for RtMI side (explanation to Global Head of Base Metals, application to EXECO cooperating with each entity.)
• Checks and approves the pre-deal arrangements (KYC/STC, partner code registration, Gendo application of Credit, Warehouse) and the deals (sales/purchase contracts, warehouse agreements etc).
• Monitors and ensure contracts and approval audit trails are well organized and documented.
• Develop and maintain relationships with industrial players (suppliers/customers/traders) to enhance trading capabilities based on existing business priorities.

3. Risk Management
• Monitor trading limit and ensure all the members trade within limits set and comply with internal rules.
• Ensure that risk is managed within the designated limit and make efforts to always minimize such risk.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with the risk management division to prepare and complete all credit line applications (including warehouse credit lines) and resolve issues with Credit Insurers in a timely manner.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with legal and compliance division and prepare the drafts of various special and ordinary contract clauses / agreements.
• Supervise team members to liaise with Legal and Compliance Department and prepare, modify company contracts and check counterparty contracts, amend documents as and when necessary.

4. Support Strategy Design and Provide Analysis
• Contribute ideas to Global Head by providing operations Analysis and Strategy planning: Conduct an in-depth analysis of Base Metals Concentrate activities in collaboration with regional heads where necessary. This includes studying the business models, market demands, forecasting industry and market trends. Ensures smooth integration of operations from mining to the end-user.
• Based on the analysis, design the team strategy relevant to Base Metals Concentrate together with Global Head and/or General Manager of Base Metals.
• Support Global Head/General Manager in Strategy Execution: Initiate, execute and implement the strategy designed especially those for enhancing the global procurement of Base Metals.

Required Knowledge and Experience
• Degree in business-related fields, and/or economics and mathematics.
• At least 6-8 years of relevant working experience in physical and paper trading of Base Metal Concentrates, as well as futures markets including hedging and position management.
• At least 2-3 years of relevant experience managing a team and proven people management skills.
• Good freight exposure/knowledge and knowledge of handling Bill of Lading, Letter of Credit and Bills for Collections, etc.
• Good knowledge & experience of offtake arrangements, paper markets, hedging and traded markets.
• Proven and balanced commercial decision-making skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills as well as influencing and negotiation skills.
• Advance knowledge of insurance, import duties, indirect tax such as VAT, GST etc and compliance.
• Business level proficiency in both English and Japanese (written and spoken) will be mandatory as the individual will be required to communicate with Mitsubishi Corporation’s Tokyo headquarters frequently and facilitate collaboration between the two regions.
• Business proficiency in Chinese is preferred but not mandatory for communication with counterparties.
• Ability to work under pressure and prioritize work.
• Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to details.
• Excellent PC skills – advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office as well as trading systems, and willingness to learn new systems.
• Excellent time management skills.

title: Bunker Trader (Marine Fuels Trader)
company_name: OILMAR SHIPPING AND CHARTERING SGP PTE. LTD.
description:
The Bunker Trader is responsible for purchasing and selling marine fuel to vessels, ensuring competitive pricing and timely delivery. This role involves building and maintaining relationships with suppliers and clients, negotiating contracts, and managing the logistics of fuel delivery. The Bunker Trader must stay informed about market trends and pricing, and effectively manage financial and operational risks. This position requires strong negotiation skills, industry knowledge, and the ability to make quick, informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities :
- Primary activity is to carry out back-to-back bunker trading.
- Canvassing and developing customers for ship owners, operators, and charterers.
- Leveraging the existing team for supply sources.
- Monitor the entire supply chain and trade cycle, right from loading, operations, delivery, and payments.
- Responsible for maintaining and collecting accounts receivables and relevant payments for the trades.
- Generating daily indications and pricing from suppliers to the team and to the clients.
- Recording and follow up on all trade related activities and payments associated with trades.
- Maintaining and documenting the enquiries and deals in the database via excel and company ERP.
- Achieving KPI’s and monthly targets.
Requirements :
- A bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Maritime Studies, Logistics, or a related field is preferred.
- Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in bunker trading or a related field within the maritime industry.
- Strong understanding of the maritime industry, including knowledge of vessel operations, fuel specifications, and international bunkering regulations.
- Proven ability to negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with suppliers and clients.
- Understanding of financial markets, risk management, and the ability to analyze market trends and pricing.
- Familiarity with environmental regulations and best practices for pollution prevention in the maritime industry.
- Essential quality required is a team player and positive attitude.
- Thrive from the “round-the-clock” lifestyle of trading/shipping
- Strictly compliance driven and good organizational skills.
- Timekeeping and book
- keeping are essential attributes.
- Networking, Team player, result oriented, Passionate about oil industry, Can-do Attitude and Business Development are some of the key skills for the bunker Trader.

title: Senior Quantitative Trader/Market Maker
description:
We are a leading full-stack, high-frequency proprietary trading firm strategically located in New York, Taipei, and Singapore. Our company is equipped with a proprietary, latency-sensitive trading system, state-of-the-art trading algorithms, and a highly efficient execution platform, designed to optimize trading strategies across various asset classes. Moreover, we maintain comprehensive access to major exchanges worldwide, allowing us to execute complex trades efficiently and at scale. This global reach, combined with our technological expertise, positions us at the forefront of the financial trading industry.

About the role:

In this role, you will apply mathematical and quantitative methods to evaluate financial products or markets in order to find trading opportunities and calculate risks.

Responsibilties:
• Research DeFi markets, protocols, strategies, and manage a sizeable portfolio.
• Conduct in-depth research on Cefi and/or Defi markets and blockchain data.
• Design and deploy algorithmic trading strategies to the production environment.
• Expand automated trading business to new trading products and venues, calibrate and fine tune the performance.
• Provide reporting on daily market sentiment, risk exposure, P&L.
• Conduct post-trade analysis of trading strategies and algo performance risk mitigation strategies and responsible for portfolio/strategy optimization.

Who you are:
• STEM Degree from a top college or university.
• A quantitative trading strategy that is currently and consistently profitable in any asset classes. (not only in a simulation or back-test environment).
• We are open to small holding periods and mid to high trading frequencies.
• Excellent Return on Capital (ROC) A proven track record (not just back-test data).
• Ideally, experience at a proprietary trading firm, or hedge fund.
• Crypto experience will be a plus but not necessary.
• Must be able to do hands-on coding. It could be in any language of Rust/C++/Golang/Python.

General requirements:
• Candidate must be able to relocate to NYC office or Taipei office in Taiwan.
• For all the roles, 2-3 rounds of coding tests should be expected for 2-3 hours each.
• Excellent written and spoken English, any other languages will be a plus.

Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary
• Semi-annual discretionary bonus
• Relocation assistance if needed
• Dedicated mentors to accelerate your growth
• Fully stocked kitchen
• Unlimited sick days
• Friendly start-up working environment
• 15 days of PTO and 15 days of WFH on an accrual basis.
• Team lunch/ dinner.
• Gym subsidy
• Breakfast catering
• Social events
• Opportunity to visit our global offices

(For NYC candidates, 100,000 - 250,000 USD per year)

Please provide the following when you apply
• Summary of your research and/or trading strategies
• If applicable, whether your trading strategies have been (a) simulated/backtested only, or (b) traded live in production (if the latter, how long trading has been live)
• Your role on the team, and what tools or components you have experience building
• Daily PnL Breakdown
• Capital Allocation, Leverage, and Book Size
• Return % (please specify whether % of GMV or ROC%) Annual PNL (or Average Daily PNL)
• Max Drawdown
• Sharpe Ratio
• Target Volatility
• Holding Period
• Potential for scalability
• Market Capacity

As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title: Fx Options - Senior G10 Trading, Director

title: OTC Derivatives Sales Trader, Singapore & Europe
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Singapore, Portugal, Spain, Ireland

At Anchorage Digital, we are building the world’s most advanced digital asset platform for institutions to participate in crypto.

Anchorage Digital is a crypto platform that enables institutions to participate in digital assets through custody, staking, trading, governance, settlement, and the industry's leading security infrastructure. Home to Anchorage Digital Bank N.A., the only federally chartered crypto bank in the U.S., Anchorage Digital also serves institutions through Anchorage Digital Singapore, Porto by Anchorage Digital, and other offerings.

The company is funded by leading institutions including Andreessen Horowitz, GIC, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and Visa, with its Series D valuation over $3 billion. Founded in 2017 in San Francisco, California, Anchorage Digital has offices in New York, New York; Porto, Portugal; Singapore; and Sioux Falls, South Dakota. Learn more at anchorage.com, on X @Anchorage, and on LinkedIn.

Are you passionate about the fast-paced world of Over-The-Counter (OTC) derivatives on cryptocurrencies and possess a knack for building strong client relationships? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your market insights and strategic thinking directly contribute to the growth of our business? Do you enjoy working with customers to help find solutions for their needs? If so, we have an exceptional opportunity for you! Join our team as an OTC Derivatives Sales Trader, where you will be at the forefront of connecting a wide range of client personas with tailored crypto derivative solutions, navigating complex market dynamics, and driving revenue generation. This role offers a unique platform to leverage your expertise, expand your network, and make a significant impact within a collaborative and high-performing culture. Get ready to immerse yourself in the intricacies of global markets and play a pivotal role in shaping our clients' investment strategies.

We have created the Factors of Growth & Impact to help Villagers better measure impact and articulate coaching, feedback, and the rich and rewarding learning that happens while exploring, developing, and mastering the capabilities and contributions within and outside of the OTC Derivatives Sales Trader, Singapore role:

Technical Skills:
• Drive - Proactively identify and pursue new business opportunities within the OTC derivatives space. Demonstrate a strong sense of urgency and a results-oriented approach to customer service while also achieving and exceeding sales targets.
• Build - Establish and nurture strong, long-term relationships with institutional clients, understanding their specific needs and providing tailored derivative solutions. Develop a deep understanding of our product offerings and their applications.
• Develop - Use programming skills to find efficiencies in work flows and operational processes, reducing manual effort and the human error surface area.
Complexity and Impact of Work:
• Lead - Take ownership of client relationships and sales processes, guiding clients through the execution of complex derivative transactions. Provide market insights and strategic advice to help clients achieve their financial objectives.
• Manage - Effectively manage a portfolio of client relationships, ensuring their ongoing satisfaction and identifying opportunities for additional trading needs. Navigate regulatory requirements and internal compliance procedures.
Organizational Knowledge:
• Collaborate - Work closely with trading, structuring, legal, and operations teams to develop and deliver comprehensive solutions to clients. Share market intelligence and client feedback to enhance our product offerings and strategies.
• Deliver - Ensure the seamless execution of trades and the efficient delivery of post-trade services to clients. Maintain accurate records of client interactions and trading activities.
Communication and Influence:
• Listen - Actively listen to clients to understand their investment goals, risk tolerance, and market views. Solicit feedback to continuously improve our service and offerings.
• Contribute - Articulate complex derivative concepts clearly and concisely to clients, both verbally and in written presentations. Effectively communicate market trends and trading strategies.
You may be a fit for this role if you have:
• A strong understanding of OTC derivative products, particularly forwards and options trading
• Proven experience in a client-facing salestrading role
• Demonstrable track record of building and maintaining successful relationships with institutional clients (e.g., asset managers, hedge funds, corporations, banks)
• Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts clearly
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to understand and address client-specific needs
• A solid understanding of relevant market regulations and compliance requirements
• A Bachelor's degree in Finance, Financial Engineering, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.
Although not a requirement, bonus points if:
• Existing network of institutional clients within the relevant market segments
• Programming experience, particularly focused on operational efficiencies and auditability
• Strong background in macro trading and dominant themes in a variety of markets such as crypto, equities, fixed income, energy and fiat currencies.
• You were emotionally moved by the soundtrack to Hamilton, which chronicles the founding of a new financial system. :)About Anchorage Digital: Who we are

The Anchorage Village, what we call our team, brings together the brightest minds from platform security, financial services, and distributed ledger technology to provide the building blocks that empower institutions to safely participate in the evolving digital asset ecosystem. As a diverse team of more than 300 members, we are united in one common goal: building the future of finance by providing the foundation upon which value moves safely in the new global economy.

Anchorage Digital is committed to being a welcoming and inclusive workplace for everyone, and we are intentional about making sure people feel respected, supported, and connected at work—regardless of who you are or where you come from. We value and celebrate our differences and we believe being open about who we are allows us to do the best work of our lives.

Anchorage Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. Anchorage Digital considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with other legal requirements. “Anchorage Digital” refers to services that are offered either through Anchorage Digital Bank National Association, an OCC-chartered national trust bank, or Anchorage Lending CA, LLC a finance lender licensed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, License No. 60DBO-11976, or Anchorage Digital Singapore Pte Ltd, a Singapore private limited company, all wholly-owned subsidiaries of Anchor Labs, Inc., a Delaware corporation.

Protecting your privacy rights is important to Anchorage Digital, and we work to maintain the trust and confidence of our clients when handling personal or financial information. Please see our privacy policy notices here.
