title: Senior Officer/Officer (Money Trader in Treasury Group)
company_name: MITSUBISHI UFJ TRUST AND BANKING CORPORATION
description:
Overview of Role:
• The Treasury Group (TG) in our Singapore branch is responsible for managing the branch’s investment portfolio, overseeing Asset and Liability Management (ALM), and ensuring effective Liquidity Management to support our core business activities.
• We are currently looking for a Senior Officer/Officer to join the team providing key support in ALM, liquidity management and operational supports including Investment portfolio management for the group.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Manage and monitor the branch's liquidity position ensuring smooth cash flow operations by executing various money market transactions.
• Provide loan/deposit rates quotes to both internal and external counterparties to support business needs and maintain competitive positioning.
• Conduct monitoring and analysis financial markets ensuring the branch adhere to MAS liquidity regulations.
• Cultivate and sustain strong relationships with money market counterparties, participating in business trip as necessary to strengthen these connections and expand the branch’s network.
• Perform KYC due diligence on counterparties to ensure compliance and mitigate risk exposure.
• Accurately enter transactions (money markets and investment products etc.) into our internal systems and support the investment team.
• Compile various reports, such as position, markets and financial reports.

Job Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline.
• Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in the banking sector, specifically in ALM/Liquidity management.
• Knowledge of financial markets, particularly in money market products (e.g., Interbank cash trades, Repo and FX).
• Detail-oriented with strong analytical skills.
• Ability to multitask and work effectively under pressure.
• Independent and a team player with good interpersonal skill are required to engage diverse team of stakeholders across different group in the branch, and unit or division in Head Office.
• Preferably with FMRP certification.

title: Graduate Algorithmic Trader - DeFi
description:
About Wintermute

Wintermute is one of the largest crypto-native algorithmic trading companies in digital assets. We provide liquidity algorithmically across most cryptocurrency exchanges and trading platforms, a broad range of OTC trading products as well as support high profile blockchain projects and traditional financial institutions moving into crypto. We actively participate in the development of the blockchain ecosystem through investments, partnerships, and incubation of projects.

Wintermute was founded in 2017 by industry leaders and has successfully navigated multiple crypto industry cycles. Culturally, we combine the best of the two worlds: the technology standards of high-frequency trading firms in traditional markets and the innovative and entrepreneurial culture of technology startups. Read more here.

Working in the DeFi team

We are always on a look out for potential talent to join our DeFi team. Whether you are a developer, trader or a graduate, we are keen to hear from you. The focus is to help us build and maintain the systems that drive our on-chain searching. You will focus both on designing and implementing trading strategies as well as the core microservices and backend infrastructure required by the trading engine.

Our trading is very technologically focused and our traders are akin to programmatic problem solvers. Similar to the ethos of most builders within the space, this role requires you to wear many hats. You will work and contribute across multiple code bases in a variety of languages whilst pushing and exploring the frontiers of the design space within the ecosystem.

We pride ourselves on running a tight knit and collaborative team and so you can expect to work closely with experienced traders and developers who will be teaching and guiding you on how to contribute and improve our systems. Team members are encouraged to cultivate their own narratives, challenge each other and investigate new domains together.

Requirements:
• Proficiency in programming with at least one of the following: Python, Rust or Go
• Comfortable working on Linux environments and Git version control
• Experience with programmatic statistical analysis and quantitative / analytic skills
• High level understanding of high-frequency market making strategies
• Understanding of blockchain fundamentals and mechanics of the EVM
• Familiarity with smart contract development and the Foundry toolkit
• A passion for learning about protocol microstructure and design mechanisms

Note:
• Although we are unable to accept fully remote candidates, we support significant flexibility in regards to working from home and working hours.
• For UK - we are able to offer work permits and help with relocation
• For Singapore - we are able to sponsor an Employment Pass for exceptional candidates however, we do prefer applicants to have a Singapore PR.

title: Geylang - Junior Discretionary Trader
description:
Squarepoint is a global investment management firm that utilizes a diversified portfolio of systematic and quantitative strategies across financial markets that seeks to achieve high quality, uncorrelated returns for our clients. We have deep expertise in trading, technology and operations and attribute our success to rigorous scientific research.

As a technology and data-driven firm, we design and build our own cutting-edge systems, from high performance trading platforms to large scale data analysis and compute farms. With offices around the globe, we emphasize true, global collaboration by aligning our investment, technology and operations teams functionally around the world.

Building on our quantitative research platform and process-driven approach, Squarepoint also runs discretionary strategies to take advantage of opportunities which cannot be traded fully systematically.

We are looking to hire recent graduates to join our Discretionary Trading team. As a Junior Discretionary Trader, you will have the opportunity to work alongside our senior discretionary traders, who will provide on the desk training and mentorship.

Your goal will be to help maintain target portfolio positions by assisting the senior traders with daily portfolio monitoring, maintenance, and hedging. As a collaborative organization, our discretionary traders work closely with quantitative researchers to leverage our world-class research platform to improve both discretionary and systematic strategies.

You will leverage and develop a broad range of skills including fundamental and macro analysis, research, portfolio construction, risk management and execution. We currently run discretionary strategies in Equities, Commodities, Rates/FX, and Credit including Volatility trading across all asset classes.

If you have an interest in trading and would like to learn how to manage your own risk overtime, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with senior traders and quantitative researchers to structure and evaluate new trading opportunities
• Generate PnL tracking and attribution reports based on trade ideas
• Monitor and analyze portfolio performance to generate risk reports
• Hedge books and allocate hedges appropriately
• Execute large or complex trades which cannot be automated due to complexity or liquidity constraints

Qualifications:
• Recent, or soon to be graduate, with relevant course work, internship, or other applicable experience or knowledge
• Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or related field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, Finance
• Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate with teammates globally
• Strong sense of urgency with the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment
• Programming skills essential, with at least one major programming or scripting language, strong preference for Python.

title: Trader, Freight (Handysize)
company_name: LOUIS DREYFUS COMPANY FREIGHT ASIA PTE. LTD.
description:
Overview / Brief

Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 18,000 people globally.

Diversity & Inclusion

LDC is driven by a set of shared values and high ethical standards

Diversity is part of our DNA. LDC strives to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where people can thrive regardless of gender, sexuality, ethnicity or background.

Sustainability

Sustainable value is at the heart of our purpose as a company

We are passionate about creating fair and sustainable value, both for our business and for other value chain stakeholders: our people, our business partners, the communities we touch and the environment around us.

As part of the Freight Commercial Handysize Team, you will play a crucial role being a part of the Global Freight Team, segmented by vessel size with region specific responsibilities. The Freight Trader role demands a keen ability to navigate and interpret complex market dynamics. The primary challenge lies in being “on call” 24/7 in order to complete time-sensitive projects, attend trainings, or to respond to emergencies. This requires someone who is able to work in a fast-paced trading-floor environment. Effective communication and collaboration with the Global, Regional, and Local teams are essential to ensure timely and strategic decision-making in a highly competitive freight market.

Main Responsibilities:

1) Pricing of Freight and Rate Negotiation:
• Participate in external markets, spot and forward, to identify ‘replacement’ market prices
• Utilize in-house research and data analytics to identify market ‘mispricing’ and relative value trading opportunities
• Use the price forecast as the basis for generating firm freight rates to provide to internal commodity traders for completion of CNF sales and market research as well as for the basis of external trading on cargoes, contracts, and period vessels
• Identify and trade arbitrage and hedging opportunities in the freight derivatives and futures market, and assess the opportunity of applying a period ship or new period ship fixture against a freight sale

2) Position Management:
• Orchestrate and execute the optimization and profitable arbitrage of the regional book, interacting with the other Regional Traders to find the net best employment for period vessels
• Work in tandem with the regional offices including Vancouver and Geneva to optimize trading strategy of LDC physical cargo/tonnage book
• Liaise with the internal commodity teams to anticipate demand while ensuring smooth internal shipment program

3) Business Development:
• Expand third party network with a particular focus on accessing industrial cargo clients and bypassing operators/traders’ intermediaries
• Seek for both spot, medium and long-term opportunities, including COAs and joint ventures

4) Freight Contract Execution:
• Work closely with Freight Operations to stay on top of the itineraries, stowplans, and voyage execution PnLs. Ensure all documentary and administrative requirements are complete in a timely manner
• Evaluate and monitor contract performance to ensure compliance with contractual obligations and/or to determine the need for changes; consult the Senior Trader on unusual price strategy, policy and operational issues if necessary/applicable
• Adhere to the Corporate and/or Platform Risk, Credit, Compliance, and Ethics guidelines

5) Other Scope:
• Research and evaluate trading partners based on price, quality, selection, service, support, availability, reliability, production, distribution capabilities, reputation, and history
• Undertake and complete training on:
• Time charter and Voyage charter parties; FFA contract negotiation and execution; Vessel bunkering hedging and execution; Internal freight Accounting practices; Internal freight IT systems
• Internal Client Management

Experiences:
• At least 2-5 years of relevant working experiences in shipping industry
• Experience in drybulk shipping and Handysize are preferred; open to Supramax
• Genuine interest in global shipping and commodity markets
• Knowledge of Supply & Demand factors, pricing trends, regulations affecting commodity trade
• Experience and/or interest in analyzing balance sheets and working with researchers/data analysts
• Experience in working with teams in different geographical locations
• Experience working with other commercial teams to design trading strategies is a plus
• Experience in arbitraging freight positions on spot and forward markets
• Experience in performing advanced freight calculations
• Experience in negotiating time charter and voyage charter party terms
• Ability to manage data and summarize large quantity of data into key/actionable insights
• Ability to analyze trends, data, and numbers to draw meaningful conclusions and write comprehensive reports
• Know how to communicate/explain complex ideas in a simple way
• Highly organized and detail-oriented, with an attentive approach to analysis to ensure accurate assumptions and conclusions
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability and willingness to interact effectively with all levels of employees & management
• Interpersonal skills, ability to forge relationships with colleagues and external parties
• Ability to handle/prioritize multiple responsibilities
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
• Self-motivated, assertive, and problem-solver
• High emotional intelligence

Technical Skills:
• Proficiency in Excel
• Experience with BI tools for analytics is a plus

title: SVP/VP, FX Trader, Global Financial Markets
description:
Business Function

As an Asian leader in treasury operations, DBS Global Financial Markets (GFM) extends a broad range of capabilities ranging from trading, structuring and sales in foreign exchange, interest rates, money market, credit, equity, commodities, bonds, derivatives and securities. We are a key player in various regional markets and actively make market, structure, originate, innovate and distribute a wide range of products.

Our extensive network in Asia and our growing Asian focused franchises helps expand our product outreach and deepen product penetration. Altogether, our specialists are working across our expanding branch network to offer a full range of products and exceptional levels of services to clients investing and hedging in the global markets.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical FX Trader to join our dynamic trading team. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing foreign exchange trades on behalf of the bank and its clients, managing currency exposure, and generating profits within defined risk parameters. This role demands strong market intuition, disciplined decision-making and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Key Responsibilities
• Monitor global FX markets and economic indicators to identify trading opportunities
• Analyze market trends, news and data to support trading decisions and risk management
• Collaborate with risk management, research, and operations team to ensure effective trade execution and reporting
• Develop and refine trading strategics through qualitative and quantitative analysis
• Ensure compliance with regulatory requirement and internal policies

Qualification and Skills
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computing or Engineering, or a related field
• Proven experiences and track record in FX trading (5-10 years of experiences)
• Strong analytical and quantitative skills
• Excellent knowledge of financial markets, economic fundamentals, trading platforms
• High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to work under pressure
• Effective communication and decision-making skills
• Programming skills (Python, R, VBA etc.) are preferred

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

title: Equity Trader Asia
description:
WHO WE ARE

Leonteq is a Swiss fintech company with a leading marketplace for structured investment solutions. Based on proprietary modern technology, the company offers derivative investment products and services and predominantly covers the capital protection, yield enhancement and participation product classes. Leonteq acts as both a direct issuer of its own products and as a partner to other financial institutions. Leonteq further enables life insurance companies and banks to produce capital-efficient, unit-linked pension products with guarantees.

Leonteq generated turnover of CHF 27.6 billion and posted total operating income of CHF 238.5 million in 2024. As of 31 December 2024, Leonteq's shareholders' equity totalled CHF 803.8 million.

Leonteq has an investment grade rating from the rating agencies Fitch Ratings Ltd. and Japan Credit Rating Agency, Ltd., who have evaluated and assigned ratings to Leonteq AG and Leonteq Securities AG, respectively. Furthermore, Leonteq has ESG ratings from both MSCI as well as Sustainalytics.

Leonteq is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (SIX: LEON) and is a securities firm regulated by the Swiss Financial Market Authority FINMA and is a member of the Swiss Structured Product Association.

About the role

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Equity Derivatives Trader to join our dynamic trading team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Asian equity and structured products markets, strong quantitative skills, and a proven track record in executing and managing Exotics derivative risks on Asian underlyings.

At Leonteq, we are a leading player in the financial industry, renowned for our innovative approaches, our commitment to excellence and our entrepreneurial spirit. Our organisational values people together, passion, dedication, quality and expertise are our guiding north star.

What you'll do
• Manage an Asian Equity Exotics derivatives portfolio to maximize profitability from client flow while mitigating risks.
• Ensure that all market and pricing parameters are properly maintained.
• Deliver responsive and competitive quotes to clients, as well as offering top-quality service to sales and clients, including the production of trade ideas.
• Monitor equity markets, global economic events, central bank policies, and geopolitical developments that impact financial markets.
• Manage and optimize risk exposure within predefined risk parameters.
• Maintain compliance with all regulatory requirements and internal trading policies.

What you'll need
• Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field.
• Minimum of 5 years (ideally 10 years) of experience in Equity Exotics derivatives trading at a financial institution, with deep knowledge of Asian markets.
• Strong understanding of derivatives, pricing models, and risk management techniques.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure trading environment.
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Nice to have
• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python is a plus.

title: Associate Vice President, Metallurgical & Carbons Trader
description:
The Company is seeking an AVP Carbons/Met Coke Trader to join their expanding team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing key trading strategies in line with the Head of Carbons' expansion objectives. This role involves the day-to-day management of supplier and customer relations in the Met/Coking Coal markets, with a focus on expanding into new geographies. The AVP Trader will also be tasked with implementing trading strategies for the group's non-China, India business, particularly targeting the SEA, Far East, and South Korea markets within the Met Coal sector.

Applicants must have a minimum of 5-8 years experience in the Thermal Coal industry, including at least 2 years in trading with PnL responsibilities. A strong knowledge of the Thermal Coal industry and related markets across the SEA, and Far East is essential, as is experience with INCOTERMS, contract terms, transaction flow, and bulk freight. The role requires a professional who can develop and expand new markets and maintain long-lasting relationships with suppliers and customers. Fluency in English is required, with additional languages being beneficial. The ideal candidate will be able to work closely with senior management, traffic, operations, and finance teams, and be capable of managing the trading program for the division.

title: Agricultural Paper Trader
description:
We are partnering with a leading commodities trading firm to identify a talented Agricultural Paper Trader to join their Singapore trading desk. The ideal candidate will bring a strong understanding of Agri commodity markets and a proven track record in non-physical trading, either proprietary or client-driven.

title: Physical Commodities Trader / Business Director (Commodities Trading)
description:
About Us

Grandlink International (SG) Pte. Ltd is a fast-growing, globally active commodities trading company. With a strong network across oil, gas, metals, agriculture, and energy markets, we deliver end-to-end physical trading solutions backed by strategic insight, operational excellence, and solid market intelligence. As we scale our business, we are seeking senior-level talent who can not only trade, but lead.

Role Overview

We are looking for an experienced Physical Commodities Trader with strong business acumen and leadership potential to step into a strategic role—with a clear trajectory towards or starting from a Business Director capacity. You will be expected to leverage existing relationships, develop new markets, and drive business growth, while taking ownership of both trading operations and client engagement.

Key Responsibilities
• Business Development: Proactively identify and expand trading opportunities by leveraging your existing portfolio of suppliers, clients, and trading partners. You are expected to bring and activate commercial networks to accelerate business scale-up.
• Leadership & Strategy: Contribute to and implement business strategies in line with corporate growth goals. This role will evolve into or immediately assume business unit leadership responsibilities, depending on experience.
• Trading & Execution: Lead full-cycle trading of physical commodities (oil, metals, agriculture, etc.) including deal structuring, contract negotiation, and execution.
• Client Relationship Management: Develop and maintain long-term relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring high service standards and repeat business.
• Risk & Compliance: Oversee trade risk assessments and ensure compliance with international trade regulations and internal policies.
• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with supply chain, operations, and finance to ensure seamless trade execution and business alignment.

Requirements
• Experience: Minimum 5 years in physical commodity trading with proven business development success. Prior P&L responsibility or team leadership experience is a strong advantage.
• Resources & Network: Must bring an established network of suppliers, customers, or trading partners. Ability to onboard immediate business is a major plus.
• Entrepreneurial Drive: Demonstrated ability to identify untapped markets and convert opportunities into business. Previous involvement in scaling a trading desk or launching new verticals is ideal.
• Leadership Potential: Capable of evolving into a Business Director role, or ready to assume such responsibilities from the outset.
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or related field. Relevant certifications in commodities or risk management preferred.
• Soft Skills: Strong negotiation, communication, and analytical abilities. High integrity and adaptability in a fast-paced, global environment.

title: Quantitative Strategist (Trader)
description:
About Quant Matter

At Quant Matter, we are an innovative quantitative trading firm specializing in crypto market-making and multi-asset algorithmic trading (including futures, equities, commodities, FX, and digital assets). We develop and deploy high-quality quantitative strategies and predictive signals (alpha) with a focus on sustainable, long-term success in global financial markets. We also seek to continuosly improve our aproach to risk management.Our edge lies in our ability to combine advanced technology, data-driven insights, and market expertise to deliver consistent, high-performance trading.

We are seeking an ambitious and self-driven Quant Trader to establish and manage their own trading desk. This role is ideal for algorithmic traders, but experienced traders without coding skills will also be considered. You must have your own trading strategies

What You’ll Do
• Lead and manage your own trading desk, taking full ownership of your strategies and P&L
• Develop, implement, and continuously enhance Alpha-seeking trading strategies
• Conduct market research to uncover new alpha opportunities
• Test and optimize trading models and algorithms to enhance performance
• Stay on top of market trends and macroeconomic developments that affect your trading strategies
• Implement robust risk management techniques to ensure alignment of strategies with the company's risk tolerance and market conditions
• Collaborate closely with quant researchers, engineers, and traders ensure proper execution as well as to optimize and scale strategies

What We’re Looking For
• A diploma, BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Quantitative Finance is preferred, but all majors are welcome.
• Minimum 2 years of experience trading one or more asset classes, including Equities, Options, Futures, Forex, or Crypto.
• Familiarity with markets such as the US, KRX, JPX, Australia, China, and cryptocurrencies.
• Preferably 3+ years of experience in the financial industry.
• Strong Proficiency in major programming languages such as Python, C++, Java, or Matlab
• Strong skills in quantitative analysis and model development.
• Ability to implement complex trading algorithms
• Ability to adapt to fast-changing markets and adjust to trading strategies as the market changes
• A self-motivated mindset with a strong problem-solving attitude.
• Proven trading track record.
• Broad understanding of macroeconomic drivers in financial markets.
• Passion for algorithmic and high-frequency trading (HFT).

Bonus Points For
• Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT) strategies
• Expertise in risk management and execution systems
• Track record in building and scaling trading strategies

What Else is Waiting for You?
• Unlimited upside commission based on performance.
• Career growth opportunities, including the ability to grow and scale your trading desk as you see fit.
• Work on the cutting edge of financial technology.
• access to a global trading network
• A collaborative and supportive team environment.
• Hands-on experience in a multi-cultural and dynamic workplace.
• Enhance your technical skills and capital market knowledge

If you are a motivated quant trader with a proven track record and an entrepreneurial spirit, we want to hear from you!

Ready to Join? Apply Now!

Send your resume, P&L track record, and a brief summary of your trading approach to fikri@quantmatter.com or click the 'Apply' Button.

title: Senior Quantitative Systematic Trader

title: Senior Trader, Base Metals, Book Manager for Base Metals Concentrates
company_name: MITSUBISHI CORPORATION RTM INTERNATIONAL PTE. LTD.
description:
The individual will be reporting to and working closely with Global Head of Base Metals, to support the following activities and responsibilities mainly:
• Profit and Loss for Base Metals Concentrate book of RtMI, managing various risks such as credit, market, legal and operational risk.
• Managing the Base Metals Concentrate book of RtMI, in collaboration with regional heads of RtMJ/RtMA/RtME/RtMB/China and other related offices, to increase the profit of Base Metals trading desk.
• Participate in the planning and design process of the Base Metals Concentrate book’s strategy together with Global Head (and/or General Manager) of Base Metals. Support in leading, executing and implement plans for enhancing the Base Metals Concentrate business.

Responsibilities

1. Team and People Management
• Communicate and implement company strategy and policy with the team members involved in Base Metals Concentrate trading (front/middle offices) and other relevant stakeholders such as trade operation members supporting the Base Metal Concentrates book.
• Set KPIs and targets for individual direct reports in alignment with Divisional KPIs and reviews their performance.
• Monitor and train team employees in all aspects of trading and related procedures as appropriate.
• Ensure effective communication between team members to ensure updated business developments especially in internal stakeholder management (i.e. active leadership role when liaising with and maintaining seamless communication with the headquarters, Mitsubishi Corporation in Japanese.
• Contribute to a positive atmosphere of motivation and encouragement within the trading team.
• Support other RtMI’s entities or RtM Global business in possible cross-commodities activities.
• Ensures that team members are collaborating well with members in corporate teams to realize and manage the business.
• Maintain and build good rapport, relationship with teams globally (including, but not limited to RtMJ/RtMA/RtME/RtMB/China/other related offices and MC Investment Division) and enhances “one-team” spirit across various organizations.

2. Base Metals Concentrates Trading
• Propose and set Divisional KPIs relevant for Base Metals Concentrates with Global Head of Base Metals.
• Maximize Profits and minimize Losses for Base Metals Concentrates trades on a Global basis, working closely with the corporate teams to manage various types of risks such as credit, market, legal and operational risk.
• Hold regular meetings with all entities and communicate with Heads of Department/Division and front office members from time to time, to capture the market status, business, and customers’ status in each region. Any internal application/report in need should be consulted / discussed before going to Global Head and GM of Base Metals.
• Handle the internal application/reports related to Base Metals (such as Gendo application, new transactions) in need for RtMI side (explanation to Global Head of Base Metals, application to EXECO cooperating with each entity.)
• Checks and approves the pre-deal arrangements (KYC/STC, partner code registration, Gendo application of Credit, Warehouse) and the deals (sales/purchase contracts, warehouse agreements etc).
• Monitors and ensure contracts and approval audit trails are well organized and documented.
• Develop and maintain relationships with industrial players (suppliers/customers/traders) to enhance trading capabilities based on existing business priorities.

3. Risk Management
• Monitor trading limit and ensure all the members trade within limits set and comply with internal rules.
• Ensure that risk is managed within the designated limit and make efforts to always minimize such risk.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with the risk management division to prepare and complete all credit line applications (including warehouse credit lines) and resolve issues with Credit Insurers in a timely manner.
• Oversee team members in their liaison with legal and compliance division and prepare the drafts of various special and ordinary contract clauses / agreements.
• Supervise team members to liaise with Legal and Compliance Department and prepare, modify company contracts and check counterparty contracts, amend documents as and when necessary.

4. Support Strategy Design and Provide Analysis
• Contribute ideas to Global Head by providing operations Analysis and Strategy planning: Conduct an in-depth analysis of Base Metals Concentrate activities in collaboration with regional heads where necessary. This includes studying the business models, market demands, forecasting industry and market trends. Ensures smooth integration of operations from mining to the end-user.
• Based on the analysis, design the team strategy relevant to Base Metals Concentrate together with Global Head and/or General Manager of Base Metals.
• Support Global Head/General Manager in Strategy Execution: Initiate, execute and implement the strategy designed especially those for enhancing the global procurement of Base Metals.

Required Knowledge and Experience
• Degree in business-related fields, and/or economics and mathematics.
• At least 6-8 years of relevant working experience in physical and paper trading of Base Metal Concentrates, as well as futures markets including hedging and position management.
• At least 2-3 years of relevant experience managing a team and proven people management skills.
• Good freight exposure/knowledge and knowledge of handling Bill of Lading, Letter of Credit and Bills for Collections, etc.
• Good knowledge & experience of offtake arrangements, paper markets, hedging and traded markets.
• Proven and balanced commercial decision-making skills.
• Excellent interpersonal skills as well as influencing and negotiation skills.
• Advance knowledge of insurance, import duties, indirect tax such as VAT, GST etc and compliance.
• Business level proficiency in both English and Japanese (written and spoken) will be mandatory as the individual will be required to communicate with Mitsubishi Corporation’s Tokyo headquarters frequently and facilitate collaboration between the two regions.
• Business proficiency in Chinese is preferred but not mandatory for communication with counterparties.
• Ability to work under pressure and prioritize work.
• Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to details.
• Excellent PC skills – advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office as well as trading systems, and willingness to learn new systems.
• Excellent time management skills.

title: Junior Execution Equities Trader

title: Iron Ore Trader – Commodities Trading Firm
description:
• International trading with a strong financial background
• Attractive compensation package
• Excellent career progression opportunities

Description

The company is engaged in global trading, dealing in products ranging from petrochemicals to raw materials such as coal and steel. Due to expansion, they are currently hiring an Iron Ore Trader in Singapore to manage and grow the business.

Role

Reporting to the Global Head of Dry products, the trader involves sourcing and securing iron ore contracts from global producers, suppliers, and consumers while managing the entire trading process, including procurement, pricing, logistics, transportation, and delivery. He/she will negotiate favorable contract terms, develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, and monitor market trends, supply-demand dynamics, and geopolitical factors to guide trading decisions. Additionally, He/she will oversee inventory management, ensure efficient material movement across regions, and coordinate with internal teams such as logistics, operations, and finance for smooth, timely transactions. He/she will also analyze risk exposure, implement strategies to mitigate disruptions, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and internal policies..

Requirements

The successful candidate will hold a degree in Economics or a related field, with at least 5 years of experience in bulk trading. Experience in Iron Ore/Coking Coal is a plus. You will have strong knowledge of global iron ore markets, trade flows, pricing mechanisms, and logistics, along with expertise in managing complex physical trades, including international shipping and regulatory considerations. Excellent negotiation and relationship management skills are essential, as well as strong analytical abilities to assess market conditions, price fluctuations, and supply chain dynamics. The ability to manage risk and make sound decisions in a fast-paced, volatile market is crucial. Proficiency in trade finance and a solid understanding of key financial instruments related to physical trading are required. Fluency in English is necessary for communicating with international counterparties, and fluency in Chinese is preferred for engaging with Chinese-speaking counterparties.

Apply

To apply, please submit your resume to James Yan at James@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number JA 33661. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Options Trader - India
description:
At Mako, we believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation in pursuit of our collective ambition; excellence in trading. Our diverse community is connected through a commitment to being the best we can be with the highest standards of integrity.

About the Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Options Trader to join our market-making team in Singapore, with a focus on Index and Stock Options in the Indian market. You will be responsible for managing a proprietary trading book, generating actionable insights, and using quantitative tools to drive results.

Key Responsibilities
• Manage and optimise a proprietary trading book focused on Indian Index and Stock Options.
• Monitor and manage risk exposures in real-time.
• Generate and implement trading ideas using both intuition and data-driven research.
• Analyse historical trading performance to improve strategies and execution.
• Use quantitative tools to build hypotheses, design experiments, and backtest strategies.

Preferred Qualifications & Experience
• 2+ years of experience trading Indian options (Korean or other markets experience is a plus).
• In-depth knowledge of pricing, execution, and risk in index futures and cash equity markets.
• Familiarity with algorithmic trading systems (high- or mid-frequency strategies).
• Bachelor's or higher degree in a STEM discipline (e.g., Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science).
• Proficiency in Python and/or C++.
• Strong quantitative and analytical skills; ability to interpret large datasets.
• Experience in mathematical/statistical modeling using a range of techniques.
• Self-starter capable of conducting independent research and driving projects.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Passion for solving complex problems and delivering measurable results.

Not Sure You Meet Every Requirement?

That’s okay. If you're a driven, curious problem-solver who’s excited by this opportunity, we encourage you to apply. We're building a well-rounded trading operation and are open to diverse profiles that add value to our Indian options strategy.

We are Mako

Benefits

At Mako, we are welcoming, inclusive and collaborative. We work fast and smart in a supportive and dress-down environment that allows colleagues to be themselves and achieve great things. We uphold the principles of a flat structure that offers unrivalled engagement with senior leadership and career development opportunities. We have a comprehensive benefits package, including:
• Flexible leave and hybrid working policies
• Private health and dental insurance
• Employee wellbeing guidance and support
• Opportunity become involved in the rewarding work of the Mako foundation

About Mako

Mako is a leading options market maker with a global trading footprint. It has been at the forefront of options market making since 1999, from the open outcry trading pits to screen trading and automated algorithmic execution strategies that are driving the future of the industry.

From offices in London, Dublin, Amsterdam, Singapore, Sydney, Brisbane and Chengdu, Mako offers the best-in-class liquidity solutions across Equities, Fixed Income, Commodities and FX derivatives markets and prides itself in its entrepreneurial, collaborative and philanthropic culture.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or assistance during the recruitment process, please email hr@mako.com and we will arrange this.

For further information on the Mako Group please refer to our website: www.mako.com.

Mako does not accept unsolicited CVs or candidate details from recruiters or search firms and will not pay any fees to such firms without a signed agreement.

title: Delta 1 Trader
description:
WHO WE ARE

Leonteq is a Swiss fintech company with a leading marketplace for structured investment solutions. Based on proprietary modern technology, the company offers derivative investment products and services and predominantly covers the capital protection, yield enhancement and participation product classes. Leonteq acts as both a direct issuer of its own products and as a partner to other financial institutions. Leonteq further enables life insurance companies and banks to produce capital-efficient, unit-linked pension products with guarantees.

Leonteq generated turnover of CHF 21.3 billion and posted total operating income of CHF 260.0 million in 2023. As of 31 December 2023, Leonteq's shareholders' equity totalled CHF 780.1 million.

Leonteq has an investment grade rating from the rating agencies Fitch Ratings Ltd. and Japan Credit Rating Agency, Ltd., who have evaluated and assigned ratings to Leonteq AG and Leonteq Securities AG, respectively. Furthermore, Leonteq has ESG ratings from both MSCI as well as Sustainalytics.

Leonteq is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (SIX: LEON) and is a securities firm regulated by the Swiss Financial Market Authority FINMA and is a member of the Swiss Structured Product Association.

About the role

At Leonteq, we are a leading player in the financial industry, renowned for our innovative approaches, our commitment to excellence and our entrepreneurial spirit. Our organisational values people together, passion, dedication, quality and expertise are our guiding north star.

What you'll do
• Managing and monitoring Actively Managed Certificates (AMC's) and rule based Trackers
• Support Sales & Structuring to further develop and grow the AMC/DeltaOne business in Asian markets
• Pricing, trading, risk managing and monitoring of Leveraged Certificates
• Support projects around AMC's, Trackers and Leveraged Certificates, with specific focus on requirements of Asian Clients and Asian underlying
• Trading execution of a variety of asset class from stocks, bonds, FX forwards, IR futures, listed options, crypto currencies
• Working closely with other departments to maximize revenues and client flow while keeping risks under control
• Handling of various and recurring administrative tasks

What you'll need
• Commercial education/diploma in the Financial sector or Bachelor/Master degree
• Strong interest in financial markets and in Leonteq's product offering; relevant work experience is an advantage
• Ability to work independently, accurately and under time pressure in a fast-paced environment
• Profound analytical and quantitative skills
• Excellent communication skills; e. g. addressing quickly the core issue
• Team player mentality
• Fluency in business English, additional Asian languages like Mandarin would be a plus

Nice to have
• Experience in Cash Equity execution for Asian Markets, Asian Bond execution and/or prime brokerage margin calculation

title: Junior Trader – Base Metals Desk (all genders welcome)
company_name: thyssenkrupp Materials Trading Asia Pte Ltd
description:
Company

Operating on a global scale through an international sales and distribution network, thyssenkrupp Materials Trading is your partner for long-term success. With our local contacts around the world we are represented where the customers need us. Our core capabilities embrace complex logistic services for raw and finished steel materials along with supply chain dependability and consultancy for the downstream manufacturing and metalworking industries. Sustainable action is indispensable to enable future generations to have a tomorrow worth living. While the European Union has committed to climate neutrality from 2050, we will achieve this goal as early as 2030. To achieve this, we have firmly anchored sustainability in all its facets in our corporate strategy.

Your responsibilities
• As a member of our base metals team, you support our sales and trading activities, including pricing, deal execution, and documentation
• You actively monitor market movements and contribute to the development of basic pricing strategies using both physical and derivative tools (e.g. LME futures)
• Working closely with senior traders, you take responsibility for P&L monitoring and support in structuring deals
• You ensure smooth trade execution by coordinating with back office and logistics teams and supporting contract review and preparation in line with internal processes
• You build strong relationships with customers, suppliers, and internal stakeholders through daily communication and support
• You apply and further develop your knowledge of risk management concepts, including hedging strategies and exposure tracking in the base metals market
• You assist in researching new market opportunities, analyzing customer needs and competitor activities, and are open to occasional business travel to engage with clients to support our regional activities

Your profile
• You hold a bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a related field
• You bring up to 2 - 3 years of relevant experience in trading, commercial, or operations roles within commodities or logistics (internships included)
• You have a strong interest in base metals and commodity derivatives (LME knowledge is a plus)
• You demonstrate strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills
• You are eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced, international trading environment
• You are proficient in Microsoft Excel and other analytical tools to support your daily work
• You communicate fluently in English, additional language skills are a plus

You don‘t meet all the criteria but still want to be part of the #GENERATIONTK? We look forward to getting to know you.

Your benefits

We at thyssenkrupp Materials Trading are a highly global, diverse and dynamic team working in a challenging but exciting industry. You will get the possibility to shape the future and success of thyssenkrupp Materials Trading Asia Pte. Ltd. in Singapore, together with a motivated and high performing team. We offer you the following benefits:
• A competitive salary package and long-term incentive bonus
• Excellent development opportunities within the group
• A modern and flexible working environment with home office possibilities

title: Programmatic Trader/ Curation /m/f/d/
description:
We’re hiring a Programmatic Trader to execute and optimise our Curated media campaigns. You will be instrumental in setting up, managing, and improving the performance of curated PMPs and data-led campaigns across multiple DSPs and platforms.

This is a hands-on operational role working closely with Sales, Client Success, and our strategic Curation team. Your work will help us validate the value of curated media at scale—and deliver strong results for our advertiser partners.
• Set up and traffic curated PMPs using Curation Platforms
• Monitor campaign delivery, pacing and performance
• Optimise bids, targeting, and setup based on campaign goals
• Work with Sales and Client Success to align campaigns with client objectives
• Document learnings and best practices to improve scalability
• Identify delivery issues (e.g. overlapping targeting) and proactively resolve them
• Collaborate with the Curation Expert to improve strategy and product-market fit
• 3+ years of experience in programmatic media buying or trading
• Strong understanding of DSPs, SSPs, PMPs, and curation platforms (e.g. Microsoft Curate, Audigent, GumGum, etc.)
• Familiarity with at least one major DSP (e.g. DV360, The Trade Desk)
• Experience running PMPs and using audience data in campaign targeting, hands-on experience with at least one Curation platform a plus
• Comfortable owning execution from setup to reporting
• Strong communication and teamwork skills
• Results-oriented problem solver, with a pragmatic approach and a high level of attention to detail
• Tech-savvy, with a passion and aptitude for understanding technical products and systems
• Analytical and enjoy digging into data with your tool of choice e.g. Tableau, Excel, Google sheets
• Fluent in English; German or another European language is an advantage

On top of a competitive package…
• We are open to flexible work models: we work on a hybrid mode and remotely
• To encourage education and professional growth, we offer an individual yearly budget of 1,200€
• You are entitled to 30 vacation days per year
• We offer BVG company ticket, JobRad bike leasing, Urban Sports Club membership, company pension scheme
• We care about your mental health and provide you with coaching and counseling sessions through the collaboration with the Fürstenberg Institut
• Regular team events and company events organised by our People team (Trust us, they know how to throw a party!)
• We equip you with the latest hardware and provide you with all the tools you need to thrive

title: Commercial Manager - Trader
description:
Established in 2011 and headquartered in Melbourne, Pure Dairy has evolved into an agile dairy industry expert providing comprehensive end-to-end solutions globally. As a strategic partner and supplier, we develop optimal solutions for food manufacturers, distributors, food service companies, and supermarkets worldwide. Our innovative approach and flexible offerings add significant value through our global understanding and extensive procurement network. With trading relationships spanning much of the globe, our partnerships thrive because we embody our customer promise that 'nothing is impossible'.

Highlights

Pure Dairy is a dynamic player in the global dairy commodities market with an expanding international presence. As Commercial Manager based in Singapore, you contribute directly to business growth by creating value through strategic dairy commodity trading. Joining a respected Trade team with skilled peers and excellent logistics support positions you for success in this high-impact role.

What are you going to do?

As Commercial Manager at Pure Dairy, you drive the selling and purchasing of dairy products while developing B2B relationships throughout Asia Pacific and international markets. You identify and close opportunities ethically, analyze market conditions, and execute medium to long-term trading strategies. Your commercial acumen ensures profitable outcomes as you build lasting partnerships with producers and customers across defined territories.

Tasks and responsibilities:
• Source dairy commodities from producers in New Zealand and Australia for export to Pure Dairy customers
• Sell dairy products to B2B customers throughout Asia Pacific and international markets
• Develop and nurture strong relationships with manufacturers and buyers
• Execute medium to long-term market access strategies
• Analyze markets and provide meaningful reporting to support business decisions
• Establish inter-company supply flows from the USA and Europe into your region
• Contribute to cost reduction and margin improvement initiatives
• Collaborate with logistics teams to ensure smooth product flow

The offer

At Pure Dairy, you become part of an entrepreneurial, global team that values initiative and results. Our collaborative culture encourages open thinking and continuous learning. You work in an environment where your expertise is valued and your contributions make a tangible impact on business growth.
• Opportunity to grow with an expanding international business
• Collaborative team environment with skilled peers and logistics support
• Extensive network of global trading partners and relationships
• Clear accountability and autonomy to drive business results
• Development opportunities through exposure to diverse markets and cultures
• Platform to become a leading dairy trading expert in international markets
• Entrepreneurial culture that rewards initiative and achievement

Profile

You are a driven self-starter with excellent communication skills and the ability to build meaningful relationships across cultures and geographies. Your analytical thinking helps you identify opportunities, while your adaptability allows you to thrive in dynamic market conditions. You collaborate effectively to achieve team objectives.

Job requirements:
• Degree qualification, preferably in International Commerce, Accounting or Asian Studies
• 3-5+ years experience with international commodity trading
• Strong financial and commercial acumen
• Proven track record of identifying and closing deals ethically
• Experience in dairy or food commodities trading preferred
• Excellent problem-solving skills
• Ability to work effectively across different geographies and cultures

Location

Singapore

title: IB - GEM e-Forward / Quant Trader - VP
description:
IB - GEM e-Forward / Quant Trader - VP

Job ID: R0387428

Full/Part-Time: Full-time

Regular/Temporary: Regular

Listed: 2025-06-02

Location: Singapore

Position Overview

Details of the Division and Team:

Deutsche Bank’s Global Emerging Markets (GEM) Asia FX Trading desk is looking to hire a Quant Trader with focus on swaps trading to join its team in Singapore. The ideal candidate combines robust trading intuition with advanced coding, data engineering, and curve-building capabilities to enhance the precision, scalability, and profitability of forward curve management in both deliverable and non-deliverable FX markets.

The focus of the role is innovation in quantitative trading, pushing the frontier of our trading sophistication and automation forward. This includes collaborative signal and model research, developing new electronic trading strategies, partnering with our technologists to get those into production, and working with the rest of the trading team to manage the optimisation and evolution of the system

What we will offer you:

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.

You can expect:
• Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
• Comprehensive leave benefits
• Gender Neutral Parental Leave
• Flexible working arrangements
• 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include:

FX Forwards Trading & Curve Management
• Manage E-pricing and risks across FX forward curves and NDFs in Asia EM currencies.
• Price and hedge FX forward and basis risk with a deep understanding of curve dynamics, central bank liquidity windows, and regulatory impacts.
• Monitor and manage exposure to cross-currency basis, carry/roll, and volatility risks.

Curve Construction & Analytics
• Design, optimize, and maintain forward curve models incorporating market data, central bank calendars, and local liquidity conditions.
• Develop tools to monitor dislocations across FX spot, NDF, and deliverable forwards.
• Automate curve construction, and hedging logic using clean, production-level code.

Quantitative Strategy Development:
• Leverage quantitative techniques (e.g., PCA, spline fitting, regression models) to identify trading signals, arbitrage conditions, and risk premia.
• Collaborate with global quant and tech teams to automate and enhance forward curve analytics.

Client & Sales Engagement:
• Provide market activities and forward curve insights to clients and other internal stakeholders, and support our FX Business Growth initiatives across the franchise.
• Customize forward structures and hedging solutions across client segments (corporates, asset managers, and sovereign clients).

Your skills and experience:
• For Associate - Minimum 3 years of electronic trading experience in FX Spot, Swaps or (ND)Forwards.
• For VP - Minimum 5 years of electronic trading experience in FX Spot, Swaps or (ND)Forwards.
• A solid understanding and practical experience of Machine Learning (ML), including modern deep learning methods. Strong programming skills in python, KDB, Java and C++
• Deep Experience in quantitative research, data analysis, timeseries modelling, trading strategy design and creation.
• Educated to master’s or bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Econometrics, Computer Science or similar subjects.
• Working knowledge of interest rate instruments, short-term funding markets, and cross-currency basis mechanics.
• Ability to distil complex technical insights into actionable trading decisions and collaborate across multi-disciplinary teams.
• Team player with strong communication skills and ability to interact with clients, quants, and senior management.
• Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply

Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.

How we’ll support you:
• Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
• Coaching and support from experts in your team
• A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
• A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
• Training and development to help you excel in your career

About us and our teams:

Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do.

Deutsche Bank & Diversity

We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.
Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.
We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

title: Vice President, US Treasury Trader
description:
Primary Accountabilities / Responsibilities
• Serve as a key contributor to U.S. Treasury revenue production, managing client activity and corresponding risk portfolios while ensuring seamless trade execution and best in class service.
• Build and maintain analytical models, of both the macro- and micro-RV variety – including off-the-run valuation and cash-futures basis trading – to identify alpha-generating opportunities and inform trading and hedging decisions.
• Utilize same tools as the basis for generating marketable trade opportunities to the client base.
• Employ a disciplined and deliberate risk management framework to optimize risk-reward outcomes.
• Provide regular market commentary to the salesforce and institutional clients, focusing on UST market movements and positioning, central bank policy, and economic trends among other factors.
• Collaborate with business partners across products and regions to grow the U.S. Treasury trading franchise and expand institutional relationships.
• Drive client engagement efforts, including through office visits, internal representation, client entertainment and business travel.
• Exhibit broad industry awareness across a range of fixed-income products, leveraging market knowledge to enhance desk performance and identify cross-market opportunities.
• Adhere to company rules and compliance standards while contributing to a high-performance team.

Qualifications & Requirements
• Education: BA or BS degree, preferably in finance, economics, or a related field.
• Experience: 3-7 years of experience in trading U.S. Treasuries, ideally in a sell-side capacity.
• A track record of success in maintaining a regularly profitable revenue profile.
• Ideal candidate will be well-versed in micro-RV trading strategies within the UST complex, including cash-futures basis trading.
• Proficiency in advanced Excel (incl. VBA) and familiarity with other programming languages is a plus.
• Unrelenting drive to grow your client business, in the context of a team effort.
• An entrepreneurial mindset, team-oriented attitude, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
• Strong communication and organizational skills to manage relationships and navigate fast-paced market environments.
• Ability to multitask and adapt focus throughout dynamic market conditions.

title: VP/SVP, Crypto Option Trader, Global Financial Markets
description:
Business Function
As an Asian leader in treasury operations, DBS Global Financial Markets (GFM) extends a broad range of capabilities ranging from trading, structuring and sales in foreign exchange, interest rates, money market, credit, equity, commodities, bonds, derivatives and securities. We are a key player in various regional markets and actively make market, structure, originate, innovate and distribute a wide range of products.
Our extensive network in Asia and our growing Asian focused franchises helps expand our product outreach and deepen product penetration. Altogether, our specialists are working across our expanding branch network to offer a full range of products and exceptional levels of services to clients investing and hedging in the global markets.
Job Summary
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Cryptocurrency Option Trader to join our Digital Asset Trading team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of crypto derivatives, particularly options on major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. You will be responsible for market-making, directional and volatility trading, and managing risk within a well-defined framework.
Key Responsibilities
• Trade crypto options (vanilla and structured) across centralized exchanges (CEX) and OTC partners.
• Identify and exploit arbitrage, volatility, and skew opportunities across different maturities and instruments
• Design and implement trading strategies, including delta-hedging, gamma scalping, and calendar spreads
• Monitor and manage portfolio risk including Greeks, tail risks, and implied vs realized volatilities
• Collaborate with quant and tech teams to improve pricing models, backtesting infrastructure, and execution tools
• Collaborate with sales team to achieve revenue target.
• Support structuring team in designing bespoke crypto-linked structured products and payoffs
• Analyze market trends, news, and blockchain data to drive informed trading decisions

Qualifications & Skills
• 3+ years of experience trading options or other derivatives (preferably with crypto exposure)
• Strong understanding of option pricing, volatility surfaces, and risk management techniques
• Familiarity with crypto market structure, including perpetual futures, DEXs, and wallets
• Proficient in Python, KDB, or other relevant tools for trading analytics and automation
• Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field
• Entrepreneurial mindset, able to work in a fast-paced and evolving environment

Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

title: LMS Administrator
extensions: ['2 days ago', 'Work from home', 'Full-time', 'No degree mentioned']
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced LMS Administrator to manage, maintain, and optimize our TalentLMS platform. The ideal
candidate will have a strong background in LMS and CMS systems, be highly organized, and possess technical expertise in
troubleshooting, course management, and system integrations. This role requires a proactive problem-solver who takes
initiative, fields tickets, performs updates, and ensures seamless LMS operation.

The LMS Administrator will work closely with the training and development team to enhance the learning experience,
implement best practices, and improve overall system efficiency. The ideal candidate has a background in education,
instructional technology, or IT and is familiar with a range of systems and software.

Key Responsibilities

LMS Management and Maintenance

- Oversee daily operations and administration of TalentLMS, ensuring a seamless user experience.
- Manage course creation, updates, user enrollments, permissions, and learning paths within the system.
- Monitor LMS performance, troubleshoot technical issues, and work with vendors or internal teams to resolve problems.
- Implement system updates, patches, and new features to enhance platform functionality.
- Maintain LMS security, user roles, and data integrity.

Support and Troubleshooting
-Serve as the primary point of contact for LMS-related support tickets and issues.
- Provide technical assistance to employees, trainers, and learners, troubleshooting login issues, content access problems,
and other system errors.
- Work with IT to ensure smooth system integrations (e.g., Single Sign-On, APIs, reporting tools).
- Document system changes, troubleshooting steps, and solutions for knowledge base articles.

Course Development and Content Management
- Collaborate with instructional designers, trainers, and department leads to ensure high-quality learning materials.
- Optimize courses for engagement, accessibility, and compliance with best practices.
- Maintain version control for course updates and archive outdated materials.

Data and Reporting
- Generate and analyze LMS reports on course completion, user engagement, and performance metrics.
- Provide insights and recommendations to improve training effectiveness.
- Track and manage certifications, compliance training, and renewal deadlines.

Process Improvement and Initiative
- Identify and implement improvements to LMS workflows, automation, and learning processes.

- Research and recommend new tools, plugins, and integrations to enhance the LMS experience.
- Stay updated on LMS trends, e-learning technologies, and industry best practices.

Qualifications and Experience

Required:
- 2+ years of experience administering an LMS (preferably TalentLMS, but open to others like Moodle, Canvas, etc.).
- Familiarity with CMS platforms (e.g., Confluence and WordPress).
- Strong technical troubleshooting skills and experience with jira ticketing systems.
- Knowledge of e-learning standards such as SCORM, xAPI, H5P, and multimedia content.
- Ability to analyze LMS data and generate reports to support learning objectives.
- Experience managing user roles, permissions, and security settings within an LMS.
- Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
- Highly organized and detail-oriented with the ability to juggle multiple projects.
- Strong communication skills for training staff, documenting processes, and working cross-functionally.

Preferred:
- Experience integrating an LMS with HRIS, CRM, or other enterprise systems.
- Knowledge of basic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for LMS customization.
- Experience with AI-powered learning tools and automation in LMS environments.
- Background in education, instructional design, IT, or related fields.
- Experience with project management tools like Jira.

Why Join Us?
- Work in a fast-paced, innovative environment where learning and technology intersect.
- Be part of a growing training and development team that is building impactful learning experiences.
- Gain exposure to cutting-edge e-learning technologies and the finance/trading industry.
- Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for growth and professional development.

If you’re a tech-savvy problem solver with LMS experience and a passion for improving learning systems, we’d love to hear
from you!

title: Senior Director of Energy Trading
description:
Senior Director of Energy Trading

Location: Singapore / Malaysia / Vietnam / Thailand / Philippines

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Director of Energy Trading to establish and build out our energy trading operations in Singapore. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing trading strategies, managing risk, and maximizing profitability in the renewable energy market.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement trading strategies for renewable energy products
• Manage risk exposure and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
• Analyze market trends and identify opportunities for growth
• Build out and lead a team of energy traders and provide guidance and mentorship
• Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to optimize trading activities
• Monitor and evaluate performance metrics to drive continuous improvement

Required Skills and Experience:
• Minimum of 15 years of experience in energy trading, experience with renewable energy will be an added advantage
• Demonstrated track record of success in developing and executing trading strategies
• In-depth knowledge of energy markets and regulatory frameworks
• Strong leadership and team management skills
• Excellent analytical and decision-making abilities
• Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or a related field (MBA preferred)

title: Energy Trading Analyst
description:
We’re partnering with the Singapore trading arm of a leading state-backed energy group. They are looking to hire a Energy Trading Analyst to support their growing team with deep market insights, focusing on supply-demand trends, fundamentals, and trading strategy development.

Responsibilities
• Conduct in-depth quantitative and qualitative research on global energy markets, with a focus on energy transition and its impact on crude oil.
• Develop innovative research methods and leverage new data sources and tools to address key business questions.
• Apply advanced modeling techniques such as supply-demand analysis and scenario planning to evaluate medium- to long-term oil and gas market trends.
• Monitor energy market developments, policies, and regulations to generate strategic insights.
• Identify emerging opportunities and provide actionable recommendations to support trading strategies.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree with minimum 3 years of experience in oil and gas trading, with a strong focus on crude oil markets.
• Deep understanding of crude oil fundamentals, particularly supply and demand dynamics.
• Strong analytical skills with experience handling large datasets and deriving insights.
• Proven ability to improve models or systems through innovation and collaboration.

How to Apply:

Submit your application by emailing a detailed copy of your updated resume to Tiffany Dorjpalam (EA Personnel Reg. No. R1765533, Achieve Career Consultant Pte Ltd EA Licence No. 05C3451) by clicking the “Apply Now” or please submit your updated CV to tiffany.dorjpalam@achievegroup.asia. You may also reach out to me directly at 9652 3994 for a confidential discussion.

title: Trading Analyst (Crude Oil)
description:
This role sits within SK Energy International.

About SK Energy International (SKEI)

SKEI markets and trades crude oil and petroleum products. The company was incorporated in 1990 and is based in Singapore. SK energy international operates as a subsidiary of SK trading international.

Job Profile

The Trading Analyst will be a member in Crude Oil Trading Book, one of the trading books in Singapore, reporting to the department head and supporting SK’s commodities trading business. This role supports the front-office trading team with real-time analytics, market intelligence, and data-driven insights.

Job Responsibilities
• Construct and maintain databases for key crude oil statistics, derive key trends, and convert these observations into insightful notes. Prepare analytical reports in a timely, relevant, and thought-provoking manner
• Monitor global crude oil markets, including supply/demand fundamentals, geopolitical developments
• Develop and update analytical models (e.g., arbitrage models, refinery yield/margin models, freight economics)
• Track cargo flows, shipping movements, and inventory levels
• Assist and work closely with traders with market intelligence and short-term trading strategies
• Analyze pricing structures (e.g., spreads, benchmarks, differentials) and provide actionable insights
• Compile and present market reports to internal stakeholders

Candidate Profile

A self-motivated individual who value integrity, have willing brain engagement in going the extra miles to provide excellent and create happiness and values to stakeholders. A strong candidate should possess the following:
• Degree in Business, Economics, Finance or other relevant qualifications with strong mathematical inclination
• Minimum 3 years of relevant trading experience, preferably in the Oil & Gas industry
• Strong analytical and financial modelling skills to assimilate complex and ambiguous data to identify key issues and aid in decision making
• Strong knowledge of oil markets, trading instruments, and physical logistics
• Strong communication skills; able to summarize complex findings concisely and to convey complex ideas clearly
• Comfortable working under pressure and dynamic trading environment
• Strongly knowledge of MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
• A highly motivated and organized individual who exhibits strong integrity, work ethics and ability to perform under pressure

Salary will be commensurate with qualifications & experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified, typically within 2 weeks from the closing date of the posting.

title: Trading Analyst (Exposure Reporting) - Global Energy Trading
description:
Trading Analyst (Exposure Reporting) - Global Energy Trading

Description
This is a global energy and commodities trading group with an established presence in Singapore. In line with its growth ambitions and the evolving energy landscape, the Group is looking to appoint a Trading Analyst to join a high-performing team of analysts. This role offers the opportunity to be deeply embedded within a dynamic trading floor, with direct exposure to traders and senior stakeholders across global markets.

Responsibilities
The Trading Analyst will play a key role in supporting front-office decision making by providing actionable insights on trading exposures, risk positioning, and P&L drivers. He/She will work closely with traders to monitor portfolio performance, evaluate hedge effectiveness, and analyse market movements. In addition to exposure analysis, the role will involve streamlining reporting tools, supporting commercial strategy discussions, and contributing to the development of analytics capabilities across the team. There will also be opportunities to collaborate on process improvement projects and mentor junior analysts.

Requirements
The successful candidate will hold a degree in finance, engineering, or a quantitative discipline, with at least 5 years of relevant experience in a commodities trading environment. Prior exposure to oil or energy trading, along with a solid understanding of trade structures, risk metrics, and portfolio performance analysis, is essential. You are described as highly analytical, commercially minded, and capable of operating effectively in high-pressure and fast-paced environments.

To Apply

To apply, please submit your resume to Dhanushi De Silva at dhanushi@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number DH29833. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Ethanol Fuels Trader
description:
Fuel Trader – Iowa

Are you ready to take your trading expertise to the next level in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment? We’re looking for an experienced and strategic Fuel Trader to join a high-performing Alcohol Sales team. In this pivotal role, you’ll lead fuel alcohol marketing and sales initiatives, oversee key logistics functions, and work cross-functionally to drive customer success and operational excellence.

What’s in it for you
• Opportunity to join an award-winning organization recognized for operational excellence and growth.
• Key role in a high-impact, revenue-generating division within the company.
• Collaborative environment where your input influences strategy and execution.
• Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package.
• Career advancement within a company that values leadership and initiative.
• Exposure to diverse areas of the business including operations, logistics, and commodity trading.

This role will be responsible for
• Leading the marketing and sales of fuel alcohol products across multiple channels.
• Developing and managing strategic relationships with critical fuel alcohol customers.
• Overseeing logistics including barge and railcar coordination, terminal operations, and export sales.
• Managing customer and product inventories, material balance, and transportation between plants.
• Keeping detailed and up-to-date sales records in CRM systems and generating competitive analysis.
• Monitoring railcar and barge movements, utilization, and servicing to ensure timely delivery.
• Reporting market developments, competitor activity, and customer insights to leadership.

Expectations will include
• Cross-functional collaboration with departments including logistics, transportation, sales admin, commodities, and quality.
• Generating rail-rate sheets and customer rail demurrage reports to support competitive offers.
• Supporting the opening of domestic rail transfer warehouses and managing vessel export logistics.
• Actively participating in trade associations to stay connected with market trends and industry standards.
• Proactively communicating issues that may affect customers to the leadership team.
• Traveling up to 20% to maintain and grow customer relationships and attend industry events.

A qualified candidate will possess the following
• Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, business administration, agribusiness, or a related technical field (preferred).
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in the ethanol, energy, or wet milling industries.
• Proven success in developing and executing sales strategies within commodity markets.
• Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting sales data and market dynamics.
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to build lasting relationships.
• High proficiency with ERP, CRM, and related software tools.
• A self-starter mindset with strong time management and performance-driven focus.

Compensation: $145K+ DOE

Benefits: Full

Desired Location: On-site
• Candidates must be eligible to work in the US as well as meet the qualifications listed above in order to be considered for the Fuel Trader job.
