title: Japan Power Trader
description:
Japan Power Trader

About US (Engie S&EM):

ENGIE Supply and Energy Management (S&EM) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 expertises:
• Asset management
• Energy transition services
• Energy supply & global commodities
• Risk management & market access

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

Context:

The APAC Power desk in S&EM plays a critical role in leading power trading activities in Asia. Our existing power markets cover a wide range of countries, including Australia, New Zealand, Singapore and Japan, while working closely with asset business units within the group in developing power market, such as India, Philippine, Malaysia and Vietnam.

Role:

As a Japan Power Trader, you will report to the Head of BP APAC Power and Gas. The role is a permanent post to be based in Singapore. You will working together with Head of Japan and APAC Power desk, contribute trading strategies to Japan book. Alongside of trading, the role requires collaboration with Engie’s global analytics team, commercial functions and support function desk.

Hard skills:
• Having prior market analytics experiences, in particular, Japan power markets.
• Initiating and supporting Japan Power flat price and option trading activities from scratch, including setting up strategies, market updates, and structure products trading assessment and support to long term origination desk.
• Being accountable for book PnL, of which the agreed risk framework, including VaR, drawdown and delta limits will be given accordingly.
• Leading and Exploring the development on new trading products in Japan Power
• Holding expertise center for Japan Power market product front.

Soft skills:
• Quantitative analysis skills, preferably with the experience in Energy Commodity markets.
• An effective team player and passionate about Energy Markets.
• Innovative and strong initiative to work independently under minimal supervision, a true self starter
• Strong Mathematical capability, attention to detail and problem solver.
• Proactive, and creative thinker
• Willingness to explore and learn about new markets and products with initiatives
• Team player

Education and professional background:
• University Degree in Business, Finance, Economics or Engineering highly preferred.
• Minimum 2 years power trading, or 5 years power market analytics experiences, preferably with track record as a existing Japan Power trader.

Languages:
• English

Work Location:
• Singapore – Asia Square Tower 1

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - BP ASIA PACIFIC

Legal Entity: ENGIE ENERGY MARKETING SINGAPORE PTE LTD

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree

Why this matters to us

Our organisation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer reasonable accommodations upon request for individuals with disabilities.

title: Energy Trader Accountant
description:
As a Commodities Product Control Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of daily P&L reports.

The position is part of the P&L team, responsible for producing daily P&L reports, consolidating trade book reports, and resolving queries from traders or other departments.

Key responsibilities include validating physical commodity & derivative deal entries, maintaining price curves and associated calendars, and understanding different funding requirements for futures and forwards.

You will also be responsible for monitoring trading activity, highlighting unusual activity, and supporting Market and Credit risk monitoring.

A key aspect of this role is the ability to work autonomously, organizing workloads and managing delivery and expectation of front office teams.

In terms of qualifications and experience, we are looking for candidates with at least 1-5 years of work experience within an energy or commodity trading environment.

Economics, finance, or similar quantitative-based degrees are preferred, along with proficiency in Python or equivalent data analytics tools.

We value commercial awareness, adaptability, and strong communication skills. If you have GARP ERP or SCR certifications, it would be beneficial.

This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your skills and knowledge in the energy trading industry, with a clear path of career development and opportunities to learn from industry experts.

It's essential to be comfortable with large data sets, effectively display analysis for management, and possess seniority level as Associate or above.
• Candidates should be able to work in Oil and Gas, Financial Services, or International Trade and Development sectors.
• Preferred industries include Energy Trading, Finance, and Commodity markets.

This position aligns with roles like Capital Markets & Advisory, Graduate Analyst, and Finance Analyst - FP&A.

Your primary goal will be to provide accurate and timely financial information, analyze market trends, and contribute to strategic business decisions.

We're looking for individuals who can bring innovative ideas and problem-solving skills to the table, with experience in commodities AND/OR P&L required.

title: Power Trading Director
description:
1.Strategic Leadership
• Develop and execute a global power trading strategy aligned with the company’s renewable energy portfolio and growth objectives.
• Lead cross-functional teams (trading, analytics, risk, legal) to optimize trading of energy, capacity, and ancillary services across markets (e.g., spot markets, futures, OTC derivatives).
• Identify and evaluate new market opportunities (e.g., emerging renewable energy markets, green hydrogen integration, virtual power plants).

2.Trading Operations & Performance
• Oversee day-to-day trading activities, ensuring compliance with local regulations and market rules (e.g., EEX, Nodal, APX, CME).
• Manage a portfolio of power purchase agreements (PPAs), virtual PPAs, and structured deals to maximize revenue and minimize price risk.
• Leverage data analytics and AI-driven tools (e.g., our EnOS™ platform) to enhance trading algorithms, predict market trends, and improve decision-making.

3.Risk Management
• Develop and implement risk management frameworks for price, counterparty, and operational risks.
• Monitor and report on key risk metrics (VaR, margin requirements, exposure limits) to senior leadership and stakeholders.
• Negotiate and structure hedging instruments (futures, swaps, options) to protect against market volatility.

4.Market Development & Partnerships
• Engage with policymakers, regulators, and industry associations to shape market rules and advocate for renewable energy integration.
• Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders (utilities, industrial clients, traders, financial institutions).
• Collaborate with business development teams to design customized energy solutions (e.g., corporate PPAs, green tariffs).

5.Team Building & Governance
• Lead and mentor a global team of power traders, analysts, and strategists, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
• Establish trading policies, procedures, and KPIs to ensure operational efficiency and compliance with internal controls.
• Report to the C-suite and board on trading performance, market insights, and strategic initiatives.

Key Requirements
• Experience: 10+ years of senior leadership experience in power trading, energy marketing, or commodities trading, preferably in renewable energy.
• Market Knowledge: In-depth understanding of global power markets (EU, North America, APAC), including regulatory structures, pricing mechanisms, and renewable energy policies.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in trading platforms (e.g., ETRM systems), risk management tools, and data analytics. Familiarity with AI/ML applications in trading is a plus.
• Leadership: Proven ability to manage cross-cultural teams and drive collaboration across functions (engineering, finance, legal).
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, engineering, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
• Language: Fluency in English (mandatory); Chinese, Spanish, or other major languages are a plus.
• Mindset: Passion for sustainability, strategic vision, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, global environment.

What We Offer
• A role at the forefront of the energy transition, with impact across multiple continents.
• Competitive compensation package, including base salary, performance bonuses, and equity options.
• Opportunities for professional growth in a rapidly expanding global company.
• A collaborative, innovation-driven culture with a focus on sustainability and diversity.

title: Renewable Energy Trader
description:
About Us: Carbon Trading Opportunities

At ENGIE, we're committed to accelerating the transition towards a carbon-neutral world. Our team in Singapore plays a critical role in originating and securing contracts for our renewables portfolio.

We're seeking a talented Carbon Trader to join our APAC Green Products Trading team. As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for leading EUA flat price and option trading activities, including pricing options for client flow and trading proprietary EUA books.

You'll contribute to the fulfillment of our missions by collaborating with our GMA team, commercial functions, and support staff. Your expertise will help drive value and manage revenue streams for our ENGIE renewables portfolio.

The ideal candidate will have prior carbon trading experience, particularly in carbon, EUA, and EUA option markets. You'll build and lead trading activities from scratch, exploring opportunities to trade EUA structure products for Asian clients.

A successful Carbon Trader will be accountable for book PnL within agreed risk frameworks, including VaR, drawdown, and delta limits. They'll also hold an expertise center for APAC region all carbon markets product fronts.

We're looking for someone with strong quantitative analysis skills, preferably in energy or carbon commodity markets. An effective team player with a passion for energy markets is essential.

Innovative and proactive individuals who can work independently under minimal supervision are encouraged to apply. Strong mathematical capabilities, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills are required.

A University Degree in Business, Finance, Management, Economics, or Engineering is highly preferred. A minimum of 5 years of carbon trading experience with a track record is essential.

This role requires proficiency in English and the ability to travel to Asia Square Tower 1 in Singapore.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to creating a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

title: Crude Operator - Energy Trading Firm
description:
• Global Fortune 500 companies
• Strong asset base with ownership of refineries
• Large and well-established operations team

Description
A Global Fortune 500 company with a strong asset base including refineries, and a large, well-established operations team that drives efficient, high-volume execution across markets. products. They are hiring an experienced crude operator for the big team.

Role
Reporting to the Head of Operations, the Crude Oil Operator is responsible for managing the full lifecycle of crude oil cargo operations, ensuring timely delivery, cost efficiency, and risk mitigation. This includes overseeing the physical trade process from contract execution to post-delivery activities, handling pre-shipment documentation such as Letters of Credit (LC), Bills of Lading (BL), and surveyor nominations. The role requires close coordination with traders, charterers, suppliers, terminals, surveyors, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth cargo execution and scheduling. The operator will monitor inventory levels, track performance metrics, ensure compliance with contractual and regulatory requirements, and proactively resolve operational issues to support continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Requirements
The ideal candidate will hold a degree in Maritime Studies or a related field, with a minimum of 3 years of experience in cargo operations. Experience in crude oil operations, logistics, or trading within an oil major or energy company is highly preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential for efficiently addressing operational challenges, along with proficiency in MS Office Suite. A solid understanding of trade finance, Incoterms, and relevant documentation is required. Proficiency in Mandarin is a plus for engaging with Chinese counterparties.

Apply
To apply, please submit your resume to James Yan at [HIDDEN TEXT], quoting the job title and reference number JA33894. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Licence No: 16S8060
Registration no: R22104741

Desired Skills and Experience

Crude Oil, Cargo Operation, Trading Operations

title: Consultant - Senior Manager – Commodities and Energy Trading Consulting
description:
Role: Consultant - Senior Manager – Commodities and Energy Trading Consulting

Location: Singapore

About Baringa

We set out to build the world's most trusted consulting firm – creating lasting impact for clients and pioneering a positive, people-first way of working. We work with everyone from FTSE 100 names to bright new start-ups, in every sector.

You'll find us collaborating shoulder-to-shoulder with our clients, from the big picture right down to the detail: helping them define their strategy, deliver complex change, spot the right commercial opportunities, manage risk, or bring their purpose and sustainability goals to life. Our clients love how we get to know what makes their organisations tick – slotting seamlessly into their teams and being proudly geeky about solving their challenges.

We have hubs in Europe, the US, Asia and Australia, and we work all around the world - from a wind farm in Wyoming to a boardroom in Berlin. Find us wherever there's a challenge to be tackled and an impact to be made.

Our Energy & Resources practice are looking for an experienced Management Consultant to join the team.

Our energy and commodities trading team based in Singapore works predominately with tier 1 Energy, Metals/ Mining and Agricultural traders across APAC to help them to deliver strategic, digital, and operational change projects. Our deep content expertise is recognised by our clients and means that they come to us to help them with their most important or challenging projects.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be working on change projects for our Energy & Commodities Trading clients, which will include:

Designing Trading Operating Model and Processes.
Trading Systems Strategy & Planning Delivery Roadmaps.
Selecting Trading Systems, and advising clients on structuring implementation programmes – especially of CTRM/ETRM.
Designing Risk Management and Control frameworks.

Working as a team in the following types of day-to-day activities on projects:

Leading and Managing project workstreams including estimation, planning and execution, risks and issues management.
Leading face-to-face client meetings to understand client requirements and problem statements.
Direct management and coaching of one or more project resources (Baringa and/or client and/or vendor resources).
Producing high quality project deliverables and being able to ensure quality of output for team members.
Building trusted working relationships with key project stakeholders.
In addition, you will be expected to engage in internal 'grow our business' type activities.

Experience

Your skills and experience

Demonstrable transformation consulting experience from either
Management Consultancy/Big 4 Consulting
Working as an internal consultant at a Trading Company or Investment Banking
Energy & Commodities industry experience is desirable but by no means essential. As long as you can demonstrate a genuine interest for working in this sector, we'd love to hear from you!
You have experience working in a project-based environment and have run projects, or major workstreams on large programmes.
You possess a good understanding of a typical project lifecycle and systems delivery methodologies.
You have experience leading small teams – you have ideally had 1+ direct reports.
You have worked previously in an internal or external client-facing project role

Skills

You are curious, self-driven and comfortable navigating a steep learning curve.
You are passionate about learning and your personal growth.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills and a track record of effective team working.
You possess a problem-solving mindset.
You have a track record in building effective relationships both internally and externally to contribute to the growth of the business.
You can work in a start-up culture, being able to deal with uncertainty, have flexibility, and provide support across a range of different internal initiatives in conjunction with primary client project.

title: Compliance Manager, Gas and Power Trading
description:
Entity:
Strategy, Sustainability & Ventures

Job Family Group:
Ethics & Compliance Group

Job Description:

We have an excellent opportunity for a Compliance Manager, based in Singapore, to provide support to our wider LNG, Power, Low Carbon Trading, Hydrogen and Treasury solutions business in Japan and across the Asia Pacific region. This role will work closely with our global Ethics and Compliance (E&C) team to implement an effective and consistent program across various bp products and be responsible for providing timely advice and guide our business, all while sharing knowledge and building strong relationships across all E&C. In this role, you provide cover for our Tokyo and Singapore offices, under the guidance of the Compliance Lead, Senior Compliance Managers and the Regional Compliance Director based out of Singapore.

In more detail, you will have the exciting opportunity to:
• Identify, assess, monitor compliance risks and requirements applicable to traded products (physical and paper-based) and origination business;
• Monitor trading activity on exchanges to ensure alignment with Exchange rules and local regulatory requirements;
• Support training on regulatory and compliance requirements and bp’s policies and procedures related to trading compliance, including on all relevant financial services and market abuse regulations;
• Develop and maintain an understanding of regulatory and E&C requirements for both physical and financial traded products;
• Monitor developments and proposals and assist with the planning and the implementations of changes into respective business groups;
• Undertake activities in relation to the risk-based monitoring program and ensure that record keeping supports actions taken and any recommendations made, including but not limited to:
• Develop positive relationships/partnerships with the business and establish compliance as enabling business partner;
• Build strong working relationships with other E&C team members to ensure effective knowledge sharing and timely resolution of incidents;
• Provide E&C advice and oversight to the implementation of projects within the area; and
• Assist the business to identify and mitigate risks involved in new business activity
• Form positive relationships with applicable external stakeholders, e.g. exchanges, as well as internal with other E&C analysts and managers, Front office, and other functional staff to facilitate strategic alignment and support of the overall E&C – ST&S Program.
• Responsibilities will include a good understanding of laws, regulations, internal policies and procedures and company ethical standards in key risk areas arising from a global product supply and trading business strategies of both physical and paper-based trading.
• Demonstrates integrity, courage and sound judgement.
• Ability to understand and synthesize complex legal and regulatory concepts and translate for business stakeholders.
• Ability to impact and influence at all levels of the organization.
• Strong work ethic, initiative and creativity to achieve identified goals, both individually and as a team player working in a global and fast-paced environment.
• Strong problem-solving skills with ability to see the next step and follow through on operational detail.
• Strong interpersonal skills – capable of embracing a variety of styles to achieve the desired result.
• Communicating and advising on E&C matters through personal and written communication.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).
• Excellent analytical and report drafting skills with attention to detail.
• Develop and delivery of training materials.
• Demonstrate ability to build consensus with diverse stakeholders.

Why join us?

At bp, we support our people to learn and grow in a diverse and challenging environment. We believe that our team is strengthened by diversity. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment in which everyone is respected and treated fairly. There are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are meaningful, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life! These benefits can include flexible working options, paid parental leave policy among others!

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Travel Requirement
Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:
This role is not eligible for relocation

Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:
Agility core practices, Agility core practices, Analytical Thinking, Client Counseling, Communication, Conflict Management, Courage, Data Analysis, Decision Making, Employee and labour relations, Ethical judgement, Facilitation, Global Perspective, Global trend analysis across society, economies and structures, Industry knowledge and advocacy, Influencing, Intelligence writing and briefing, Issues and Policy Management, Knowledge Sharing, Presenting, Regulatory Compliance, Risk Management, Stakeholder Engagement, Stakeholder Management, Strategic Thinking {+ 2 more}

Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp’s recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

title: Energy Market Trader
description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced power trader to formulate and execute trading strategies in China's power market, including medium/long-term trading, spot trading, and ancillary service market transactions.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement trading strategies across the Chinese power market spectrum, encompassing short- to long-term trading, spot trading, and ancillary service market transactions.
• Cultivate customer relationships through receptions and project negotiations; prepare quotations and execute contracts effectively.
• Analyze power market policies, price fluctuations, and supply-demand dynamics to inform informed trading decisions.
• Optimize dispatch and portfolio management of company power assets (e.g., PV, wind, thermal power) for maximum efficiency.
• Nurture partnerships with grid companies, generation groups, and large consumers to expand trading channels and foster strong client relationships.
• Monitor trading risks, ensure regulatory compliance, and submit regular trading reports and profit analyses.
• Contribute to research on power market reforms and explore innovative initiatives like green power trading and carbon-electricity market linkage.
Requirements:
• Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Energy Economics, Finance, or related fields.
• Experience:
• A minimum of 3 years of power trading experience in China, with familiarity in provincial trading rules (e.g., Guangdong/Shanxi spot pilot markets).
• Prior experience in generation groups, electricity retailers, or renewable energy trading roles is highly desirable.
• Skills:
• Proficiency in power trading platforms (e.g., Beijing/Guangzhou Power Exchange).
• Familiarity with price forecasting models or quantitative tools (Python/Power BI) is a plus.
• Strong data analysis and risk management capabilities.
• Additional Requirements:
• Policy awareness with understanding of market reforms (e.g., spot markets, capacity pricing mechanisms).
• Excellent communication, coordination, and stress resilience for high-frequency trading environments.

title: Fuel Oil Broker
description:
About Us

Freight Investor Services (FIS) is a leading global brokerage of freight and commodities. We are the world’s largest broker on dry freight futures, and have a strong presence across the bulk commodities, metals, and energy markets. We were the first brokerage to trade in the cleared market on iron ore and later coking coal futures, we also maintain a strong position in broking steel futures on all exchanges, as well as fuel oil, base metals, fertilisers, and tanker freight. We are proud of our innovative ethos, having been first mover on a number of products, most recently on the cobalt and air freight futures markets. Not only do we provide excellent brokerage services, but also data services via our App, FIS Live, other data services, as well as education to help those entering new markets.

We have expanded via our network of trading associates and branch offices to offer coverage of derivative and physical shipping markets in London, New York, Houston, Dubai, Mumbai, Athens, Copenhagen, Geneva, Singapore and Shanghai. Through our global network, FIS offers full brokerage services, trade execution and in-depth market intelligence and data for freight and commodities, as well as providing physical ship and cargo services. Our expertise in managing credit and counterparty risk provides a vital competitive advantage while enabling clients to trade with confidence.

About The Role

We have an exciting opportunity for a Fuel Oil Broker with proven and demonstrable experience in a broking environment. This is a mid-level experience role for a dynamic individual who has a passion for the financial markets. You will be personable, tenacious and a natural networker, having a proactive approach to generating leads and securing new business.

In addition, you will be well-organised, highly analytical and thrive in a fast-moving environment with a flat management structure. You are able to work under your own initiative and be an excellent team player, able to adapt and fit in with close-knit desk teams.

Key responsibilities:
• Promote FIS as a company; providing market intelligence and analysis to clients
• Arrange trades via voice broking on and behalf of clients for execution at relevant exchange
• Ensure all trades are executed on a non-advice / execution only basis
• Reconcile and enter trades in Trade Manager and/or relevant exchange as necessary
• Maintain and enhance existing client relationships, making regular contact and tracking daily trading activities
• Proactively solicit feedback from industry participants via trade calls, surveys, industry events, trade shows and conferences
• Produce a daily/weekly update of market prices, market direction for international desks
• On-board new clients following correct Compliance and Operations procedures
• Regularly assess client needs and financial conditions to identify internal cross-selling opportunities
• Understand the desk’s business strategy; identify and seize new business opportunities relating to trends, future markets, products and clients
• Perform any other reasonable duties the company may require

Risk related responsibilities
• Understand regulation within the evolving regulatory landscape
• Support a risk and compliance aware culture and comply with FIS company policies
• Exercise judgement and act with integrity, due care, skill and diligence and co-operate with the regulators and exchanges
• Ensure full awareness of and adhere to internal policies that relate to the role or any relevant other activities
• Observe standards of market conduct and ensure understanding and adherence to all regulatory, exchange or clearing house requirements applicable to role

Training
• Seek regular feedback from Desk Head to ensure role requirements are met
• Complete any mandatory training required by the company and required deadlines
• Maintain own Continued Professional Development (CPD)

Requirements

Key competencies / skills
• Demonstrate experience in execution brokerage in related products covering commercial clients (financial markets or the physical markets) - essential
• Deep understanding of price risk management - essential
• Robust quantitative, presentation, and decision-making capabilities
• Entrepreneurial mindset / self-motivated
• Strong client focus; personable and engaging building relationships and networks wherever possible
• Degree in Economics or related degree – preferred
• Communicate effectively with clients and colleagues - essential
• Tenacious and thrives in a pressurised environment – essential
• Team orientated; works well with others and diverse groups / personalities – essential
• Excellent attention to detail; strong analytical and numeracy skills – essential
• Good IT Systems experience – Excel - essential

If you have the relevant Broker career experience skill sets and would like to know more about the above opportunity, then please apply now. We're looking for a highly motivated and intelligent broker to join our global desk in Singapore.

Benefits

Our rapidly growing business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers.
• Competitive salary and discretionary bonus
• Learning & Development / CPD opportunities
• Private healthcare
• 25 days holiday

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are committed to treating all of our candidates fairly and would like you to have every opportunity to excel in our application and interview selection process. If you need any adjustments to be made as part of the process (such as for a neurodiverse condition, a disability, a medical condition or other individual need) please let us know in good time , so that we can support you.

If the role is of interest and you are ready for the next step in your career, please get in touch, attaching a CV.

title: Corporate Account Manager - Environmental Markets Climate Solutions
description:
STX Group is seeking a Corporate Account Manager for Environmental Markets Climate Solutions in Singapore. The role involves identifying opportunities in the South East Asian carbon and renewable energy market, engaging with clients to create tailored solutions that support their decarbonization strategies and promote business growth. This is a full-time position.
The Business Development Manager will identify and analyze opportunities in the South East Asian carbon and renewable energy market, engaging with clients to develop tailored solutions that enhance their decarbonization strategies and drive business growth.

title: [PERM] Oil Trader/Analyst (Crude Oil & Refined Products)
description:
Key Responsibilities:
• Execute trades in physical and/or paper (futures, options, swaps) oil markets.
• Monitor global oil markets to identify trading opportunities and risks.
• Develop and maintain relationships with counterparties, brokers, and suppliers.
• Analyze supply-demand fundamentals, geopolitical developments, and market data.
• Manage exposure and implement hedging strategies to control risk.
• Maintain accurate and timely records of trades and ensure compliance with regulations.
• Collaborate with logistics, risk, finance, and operations teams for deal execution.
• Prepare regular reports on market outlook, trading performance, and P&L.

Qualifications & Skills:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field. Master's is a plus.
• 5+ years of experience in commodities trading, preferably oil or energy markets.
• Strong understanding of physical and/or financial oil markets.
• Excellent analytical, quantitative, and decision-making skills.
• Proficiency in trading software, Excel, and market analysis tools (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters).
• Knowledge of risk management principles and regulatory requirements.

Please state your availability, current and expected salary in the resume.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

e2i is the empowering network for workers and employers seeking employment and employability solutions. e2i serves as a bridge between workers and employers, connecting with workers to offer job security through job-matching, career guidance and skills upgrading services, and partnering employers to address their manpower needs through recruitment, training, and job redesign solutions. e2i is a tripartite initiative of the National Trades Union Congress set up to support nation-wide manpower and skills upgrading initiatives.

title: Commercial Analyst (entry level position)
description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in the energy sector with a presence across the spectrum; from oil through to power, renewables and carbon. It trades over 7 million barrels per day of crude oil and products and, at any time, has 250 ships transporting its cargoes.

Vitol’s clients include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves clients from some 40 offices worldwide and is invested in energy assets globally including: circa 17m m3 of storage globally, 500k bpd of refining capacity, 7,000+ service stations and a growing portfolio of transitional and renewable energy assets. Revenues in 2022 were $505 billion.

Job Description

Are you able to start in May 2025?

Then we are keen to speak to you about the Commercial Analyst position.
• Maintaining detailed position summary for respective business unit
• Compiling daily profitability reports enabling traders and brokers to determine how market moves are impacting their positions
• Contributing to the weekly summary to Board on P&L movement
• Ensure all deals have an accurate Mark to Market.
• Maintain, calculate and issue daily price exposure to the Matrix
• Maintain profit / loss reporting to ensure these are accurate at all times.
• Conduct ad-hoc analysis as required by brokers, traders, marketers and management

Personal Characteristics
• Results oriented and demonstrably commercial
• Incisive and accurate judgment
• Excellent attention to detail
• Outstanding communication and relationship management skills
• Global outlook. Able to work across organizational and cultural boundaries
• Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of personal integrity
• Energetic, resilient and resourceful, with an ability to work accurately under pressure
• Creativity and problem solving

Additional information

Relocation assistance is not provided for this position

Vitol Asia is committed to providing equal opportunities to all staff. Globally, Vitol seeks to conduct its business in accordance with the UN Global Compact’s ten principles, including those on human rights, one of which is to “Ensure a diverse and inclusive work place, where possible, free from discrimination regardless of age, gender, race, cultural heritage, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion or disability.”

Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Qualifications
• Graduate degree with an excellent academic record, preferably in an analytical discipline
• Strong quantitative and analytical capability and comfort with Excel
• Clear understanding of accounting and valuation concepts
• Additional language skills, an advantage
• Proficiency with VBA, Python, and R/Matlab would be an additional advantage

Additional Information
• Vitol is an international company with offices across all continents
• You will work in a flat and approachable organization

title: Biofuels Trader
description:
**Biofuels Trader, Low Carbon Trading Firm (Junior Oil Traders welcome to apply)**

Formative Search is privileged to be partnering alongside a leading low carbon trading firm seeking to expand their Biofuels Desk. They are looking to hire a Junior Biofuel Trader primarily for sourcing feedstock within South-East Asia, with third-party trading responsibilities.

Working alongside with the Senior Biofuel Traders, you would be working alongside with experienced professionals in the low carbon fuel business to build up the desk in Singapore and develop the market here in South-East Asia for both their trading supply and demand side. This includes but not limited to identify and utilise market opportunities in biofuels market for trading and profit optimisation, partnering alongside with the renewables fuels trading team in Europe and US to make this a reality.

Ideally, you possess commercial flair for business development & origination in the fuels space, though it is not necessary to have experience in Biofuels, but possess a dynamic spirit of entrepreneurialism to optimise and maximise trading P&L for the desk.
• *Requirements**:
You are a strong negotiator and natural originator in a commercial trading/supply trading role in the energy/fuels business industry.

An entrepreneurial mindset, you possess 3-5 years of fuels/energy trading/low carbon/biofuels trading, keen in pivoting into the low carbon/biofuels industry.

title: Head of Middle Office - China
description:
Founded in 2004, Mercuria is one of the world’s largest independent energy and commodities group. We supply products from areas of surplus to areas of need.
Our operations span five continents and engage more than fifty countries. We have principal commercial hubs in Geneva, Beijing, Shanghai, Singapore, London and Houston. More than 1,000 people are operating from offices worldwide to sustain the group’s extensive business reach with their market knowledge, diversity, and experience.
The group, primarily focused on energy, is present all along the commodity value chain with activities forming a balanced combination of commodity flows and strategic assets. Mercuria is a leader in trading of physical energy products ranging from crude oil, refined petroleum products and biofuels, petrochemicals, natural gas and LNG, power, emissions certificates and coal. Mercuria is also active in iron ore and metals. Worldwide, our activities range from sourcing, supplying, trading, and financing to investment, logistics storage and blending
Mercuria optimizes the commodity supply chain for its counterparts.
In 2016, ChemChina, one of China’s largest chemical companies, became an important minority investor with a 12 percent stake in the shareholding structure of Mercuria.
In recent years, Mercuria has built upon a series of strategic acquisitions including the physical commodities trading unit of JPMorgan Chase & Company; Noble Group’s U.S. gas and power business; and the Aegean Marine Petroleum Network, reorganized as Minerva Bunkering. The Group continues its journey by forging a pathway toward the energy transition by bringing added value, transparency and efficiency to the commodities trading world.
Head of Middle Office - China Business
This role is responsible for correct position reporting, PnL reporting, pricing reporting and adherence to trading limits.
SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Supervise and ensure timely and accurate reporting of position, PnL and pricing risk to traders.
- Manage the risk profile of the trading business in line with the agreed appetite for risk and risk limits
- Proactively develop and improve business processes and ETRM systems / functionalities in coordination with traders / IT and Chief Risk Manager
- Develop and maintain good working relationships with the various functions within the business, including finance, trading, middle office and operations
- EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS:
- A degree in a numerate discipline ie. Engineering, Mathematics etc.
- 10 - 15 years’ relevant experience in Middle Office in a commodities trading environment.
- Preferably an experienced Risk/ Business Analyst with team lead experience
- Strong understanding, knowledge and experience of Energy trading, knowledge of oil trading is a plus.
- Exposure to the Chinese commodities trading markets and strategies, including oil, metals and iron ore
- Technically competent with experience in setting up / managing risk management ETRM systems and tools.
- Familiar with back office and middle office processes in a commodities environment like Mercuria’s
PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:
- A strong but inclusive personality.
- Passionate about risk and processes, pragmatic rather than overly theoretical, capable of working with the business lines to embed risk awareness and culture into everyday processes
- Stable, confident, independently minded but an inclusive, non-political team player and leader, with the courage to voice his/her convictions to senior management and colleagues

title: Physical Commodities Trader
description:
About Us

Grandlink International (SG) Pte. Ltd is a fast-growing, globally active commodities trading company. With a strong network across oil, gas, metals, agriculture, and energy markets, we deliver end-to-end physical trading solutions backed by strategic insight, operational excellence, and solid market intelligence.
Role Overview

We are seeking senior-level talent who can not only trade, but lead. As we scale our business, we need an experienced Physical Commodities Trader with strong business acumen and leadership potential to step into a strategic role—with a clear trajectory towards or starting from a Business Director capacity.
Key Responsibilities:
• Business Development: Identify and expand trading opportunities by leveraging your existing portfolio of suppliers, clients, and trading partners.
• Leadership & Strategy: Contribute to and implement business strategies in line with corporate growth goals. This role will evolve into or immediately assume business unit leadership responsibilities, depending on experience.
• Trading & Execution: Lead full-cycle trading of physical commodities including deal structuring, contract negotiation, and execution.
• Client Relationship Management: Develop and maintain long-term relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring high service standards and repeat business.
• Risk & Compliance: Oversee trade risk assessments and ensure compliance with international trade regulations and internal policies.
• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with supply chain, operations, and finance to ensure seamless trade execution and business alignment.
Requirements:
• Experience: Minimum 5 years in physical commodity trading with proven business development success. Prior P&L responsibility or team leadership experience is a strong advantage.
• Resources & Network: Must bring an established network of suppliers, customers, or trading partners. Ability to onboard immediate business is a major plus.
• Entrepreneurial Drive: Demonstrated ability to identify untapped markets and convert opportunities into business. Previous involvement in scaling a trading desk or launching new verticals is ideal.
• Leadership Potential: Capable of evolving into a Business Director role, or ready to assume such responsibilities from the outset.
• Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or related field. Relevant certifications in commodities or risk management preferred.
• Soft Skills: Strong negotiation, communication, and analytical abilities. High integrity and adaptability in a fast-paced, global environment.

title: Intraday Power Trader, Singapore
description:
**Join us, be part of more.**

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently - we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.
• *About your team**:
At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use - powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

Centrica Energy is a leading power and gas trading company that has a strong presence in Europe, with further plans to globally expand our business into the American and Asian markets. Currently, our European Intraday Power Trading desk is looking to hire a Power Trader for the Singapore desk. We are looking for a motivated team player, who thrives while working in fast paced environment, who is not afraid of being challenged and challenging others, and who above all wants to learn and develop. To be successful in this role, you must have a flair for numbers and logical reasoning, you must be able to tackle and quickly solve problems, and you also need to be good at making decisions under pressure of time.
• *About the role**

We are a leading Power Trading team in Europe, so you will be able to learn from the most talented and experienced traders in the industry. We have a very flat team culture, therefore from the start you will see the direct impact of your actions on our team’s strategies and PnL.

Your key responsibilities will be:

- Trading proprietary intraday power in UK and Europe and helping us maximize PnL within our risk and compliance framework
- Participating in the shift rotation that includes day and weekend shifts
- Developing and executing day-to-day and intraday strategies
- Taking active part in developing and executing algorithmic trading and automatization
- Optimizing portfolios and exploiting the synergies between them
- Conducting market analysis to find new profit opportunities and build strategies to tap into them
- Obtaining expert understanding of the key drivers of the power market
- Taking responsibility for optimizing our daily procedures
- Providing open and honest feedback
- Constantly reviewing and reflecting on your own trading to look for ways to improve the performance, both your own and of the team

On our side, we offer you an exciting working environment, with plenty of opportunities to grow through accountability. We believe in learning by doing. Hence from day 1 you will start working together with traders in live markets, getting a chance to step right into commodity markets.

This role will be based in Singapore
• *About you**
- Finance/Economics or STEM degree
- A strong interest in trading, financial markets and energy systems
- An interest in the commodity markets
- Ability to remain calm under pressure
- Accuracy, timeliness and attention to detail
- Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team
- Proficiency in Excel and programming skills (VBA, Python, R, C++) is a plus
- Flexibility in terms of working weekends

It would be an advantage if you have experience as an analyst or a trader, but it is not a requirement.
• *Make a real impact and make the most of your talent**

This is your chance of joining a team of international colleagues who sets the bar high and that will help you develop both on a professional and personal level. If you are looking for a career where no days are the same and you are constantly given a chance to prove yourself and leverage your talent, this is the place to be.

So, take this opportunity to join one of the most successful European power trading teams. We look forward to hearing from you.
• *About Centrica Energy**

We’re a profitable company that understands the necessity of investment to achieve improvement. If you’ve got the willingness, ambitions, and right attitude we offer a work environment that will help you grow on a professional as well as personal level.

Energy markets are increasingly dominated by an ambitious decarbonization agenda, and so are we. Leveraging our in-house talent and specialists, extensive market expertise, technical capabilities, and the strong balance sheet of Centrica plc, we’re focused on delivering on the net-zero agenda as a vital enabler for our future growth. Our ambition is to become Europe’s No. 1 renewable energy trader and a globally important player, and we’re delivering on an ambitious corpo

title: Physical Trader
description:
**About Us**:

- Grandlink International (SG) Pte. Ltd is a leading global player in the commodities trading sector, with a strong presence across multiple asset classes. We specialize in sourcing, trading, and delivering physical commodities to clients worldwide, providing unparalleled expertise and market insights. Our dynamic and fast-paced environment offers exciting opportunities for professionals who are passionate about the commodities markets and have a proven track record in physical trading.
• *Role Overview**:

- As a Physical Commodities Trader, you will leverage your market knowledge, strong negotiation skills, and ability to manage complex logistics to source and deliver commodities to meet client needs. You will work closely with the supply chain, risk management, and operations teams to ensure the timely and efficient movement of physical goods.
• *Key Responsibilities**:

- Trading & Sourcing: Identify market opportunities, execute buy and sell transactions for physical commodities, and build a network of suppliers, customers, and third-party vendors.
- Market Analysis: Monitor market trends, commodity prices, and geopolitical developments to assess trading strategies and market risk.
- Negotiation: Negotiate trade terms, contracts, and pricing with suppliers, buyers, and logistics partners, ensuring favorable conditions for the company.
- Logistics Coordination: Oversee the transportation and delivery of physical commodities, coordinating with shipping, storage, and delivery teams to ensure smooth operations.
- Risk Management: Implement strategies to mitigate risks associated with physical trading, including price volatility, supply chain disruptions, and credit risk.
- Relationship Building: Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, suppliers, brokers, and internal teams.
- Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and company policies, particularly in relation to commodity trading, logistics, and financial reporting.
• *Requirements**:

- Experience: At least 5 years of experience in physical commodities trading (oil, gas, metals, agriculture, etc.) with a proven track record of successful trades and relationship management.
- Industry Knowledge: Strong understanding of the commodities markets, including supply and demand fundamentals, price dynamics, and geopolitical factors that impact commodity pricing and availability.
- Negotiation Skills: Proven ability to negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with multiple stakeholders.
- Analytical Abilities: Strong analytical skills, with the ability to assess market trends and develop actionable insights.
- Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate strategies and decisions to both internal teams and external partners.
- Education: A degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field is preferred. Additional qualifications in commodities trading or risk management are a plus.
• *Why Join Us?**
- Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and performance-based incentives.
- Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement in a fast-growing company.
- Dynamic Environment: Be part of a high-performing, collaborative team where your contributions are valued.
- Global Exposure: Work in a multinational, cross-functional environment with exposure to markets worldwide.

If you’re a results-driven, highly skilled commodities trader with a passion for physical trading and market dynamics, we’d love to hear from you

title: Junior Risk Analyst, Swiss Oil Trading
description:
Our client is the Singapore setup of a privately owned company headquartered in Geneva in2015. The company has quickly developed from a local market trader in the Black Sea and Mediterranean to a globally recognized energy trader. Today, the company is physically moving crude oil, refined oil products and dry-bulk energy commodities globally via sea-going vessel, barge, rail, truck and pipeline.
• *JUNIOR RISK ANALYST
This is a new role reporting to the Risk Team Representative in Singapore and focus materially on data assimilation doing the trade and price uploads, daily broker reconciliations and running data control processes. The goal is for the role to evolve over time to take on more responsibility around trade and market + risk reviews. Strong IT skills in Power BI, Python, and SQL with partial CFA will be advantageous. This role will eventually lead to facing the trade desks directly.
• *AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY
- Prepare MTM PNL report that includes positions breakdown, pricing exposures, hedging for both paper and physical trades
- Trade capture and position analysis in risk management system
- Daily assimilation and upload of market and trade data
- Able to do price assessment by using market data.
- Evaluate portfolios, understanding profit and loss drivers
- Responsible for analysis of MTM of trade transactions.
- Actively liaise with Trade Team to ensure timely reconciliation, identify error, closely work with trade team to identify any potential risk exposure.

- Strong technical/development skills - Power BI, Python and SQL, VBA
- Basic understanding of derivatives and commodities
- Strong analytical ability, team player, meticulous, and good communication skills, with the ability to self-start and work independently on certain tasks
- Pro-active and able to take initiative to pre-empt problems and complete tasks
