title: Trading Analyst (Exposure Reporting) - Global Energy Trading
description:
Trading Analyst (Exposure Reporting) - Global Energy Trading

Description
This is a global energy and commodities trading group with an established presence in Singapore. In line with its growth ambitions and the evolving energy landscape, the Group is looking to appoint a Trading Analyst to join a high-performing team of analysts. This role offers the opportunity to be deeply embedded within a dynamic trading floor, with direct exposure to traders and senior stakeholders across global markets.

Responsibilities
The Trading Analyst will play a key role in supporting front-office decision making by providing actionable insights on trading exposures, risk positioning, and P&L drivers. He/She will work closely with traders to monitor portfolio performance, evaluate hedge effectiveness, and analyse market movements. In addition to exposure analysis, the role will involve streamlining reporting tools, supporting commercial strategy discussions, and contributing to the development of analytics capabilities across the team. There will also be opportunities to collaborate on process improvement projects and mentor junior analysts.

Requirements
The successful candidate will hold a degree in finance, engineering, or a quantitative discipline, with at least 5 years of relevant experience in a commodities trading environment. Prior exposure to oil or energy trading, along with a solid understanding of trade structures, risk metrics, and portfolio performance analysis, is essential. You are described as highly analytical, commercially minded, and capable of operating effectively in high-pressure and fast-paced environments.

To Apply

To apply, please submit your resume to Dhanushi De Silva at dhanushi@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number DH29833. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Energy Modelling Analyst
description:
About the Position
This is a unique international opportunity for a recent university graduate or a professional seeking to build their career in the energy sector to join our Asia-Pacific region as an Energy Modelling Analyst. You will be based in our Singapore office. The role will focus on modelling energy commodities (notably electricity) markets, contributing to our efforts by developing analytical and computational tools, enhancing our modelling methodology, analysing data, formulating recommendations on future trends, and conveying insights to enhance clients’ decision-making.
Key Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain Aurora’s suite of energy marketing models
- Work closely with our research and consulting teams to derive insights from model results
- Contribute to continuously improving how the modelling team operates
What we are looking for
Required attributes:
- Relevant degree in Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or other quantitative field from a top university
- Exceptional problem-solving skills and analytical ability
- Ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information
- Knowledge of one programming language, e.g. C++, Matlab, Python, R, Java
- Strong interpersonal skills, and a great team player
Desirable attributes:
- Relevant Master’s degree or PhD
- 2+ years' work experience in a quantitative and/or technical role
- Knowledge of and interest in energy markets, and a belief that well-designed models significantly improve decision making
- Knowledge of statistical and/or optimization techniques
- Knowledge of an algebraic modelling language, such as GAMS (preferred) or AMPL
What we offer
- A dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and supportive environment
- The opportunity to grow with the company, take on further responsibilities and bring in your own ideas
- The opportunity to develop real expertise relevant to the energy transition
- A fun and international work culture
- Employee discount platform - Perkbox
- Private Health Insurance
- Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills.
- Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects.
About us
From its academic roots, Aurora Energy Research has grown to become the largest dedicated power market analytics company in Europe, providing data-driven intelligence for strategic decisions in the global energy transformation. We are a diverse team of around 600 experts with vast energy, financial and consulting backgrounds, covering power, renewables, hydrogen, carbon and fossil commodities.
We are active in Europe, the Asia-Pacific region, and the Americas, working with world-leading organisations to provide comprehensive market intelligence, bespoke analytic and advisory services, and cutting-edge software. We are a thriving, rapidly growing company with offices across the globe and more opening soon. We currently serve around 200 of APAC’s most influential energy sector participants, including utilities, investors, and governments, and expect to continue to grow rapidly, adding new countries and products to our portfolio.

title: Analyst, Renewable Energy Solutions
description:
World Fuel Services is seeking an Analyst for Renewable Energy Solutions in Singapore. The role involves supporting project managers with renewable energy assessments, market research, and financial analysis. The analyst will work with a multinational team to assist clients in achieving decarbonization goals. The position offers a hybrid working environment, allowing for partial remote work based on project demands.
At World Kinect, our employees are the key to our global success. We are industry leaders due to the innumerable talents of our approximately 5000 strong professional team. Our people thrive in an entrepreneurial and culturally-diverse environment, where innovative thinking, collaboration and efficient execution are highly valued. Our high-performance culture is what allows us to drive sustained growth. Stronger together, we promote an environment where individuals can thrive.

Kinect Energy Group is part of the World Kinect Corporation (NYSE: WKC) - a global leader in the downstream marketing and financing of land, marine and aviation fuel products and related services. With revenues in excess of $40 billion and over 4,000 employees worldwide, World Kinect Corporation is a fortune 100 company that offers its customers a value-added outsource service for supply, quality control, logistical support and price risk management.

Kinect Energy Group is a leading global energy management company specializing in providing best in class advisory, brokerage, procurement, agency, Supply & Trading, sustainability & environmental and carbon compliance services to its clients worldwide.

https://www.world-kinect.com/

Summary

The Analyst, Renewable Energy Solutions APAC plays an important role working with project managers to prepare and execute our renewable energy related assessment/advisory projects to new and existing C&I Customers, ensuring timely delivery, stakeholder alignment and effective coordination. The analyst will also be involved in electricity market research, renewable energy project financial analysis and policy update monitoring, etc. In this fast growing industry, World Kinect APAC provides an employee friendly, international and hybrid working environment. The analyst will be working with a highly experienced multi-national team, providing expertise to international companies to achieve their decarbonization plan in Asia Pacific region. The analyst is able to work remotely partially depending on the actual demand of the project.

Key Responsibilities
• Support and enhance the design of renewable energy related assessment/advisory projects, including scope of work, schedule and deliverables
• Support the identification and prospecting of existing customers and potential new clients for our renewable energy solutions
• Support internal teams to deliver renewable energy related assessment/advisory projects
• Support the negotiation and execution of enabling agreements between clients and developers of utility scale renewable energy projects
• Support the negotiation and execution of enabling agreements between clients and developers of Onsite renewable and other distributed energy projects
• Engage, synthesise and collaborate with functional teams on programs for optimal success
• Track and report on delivery and performance against project timeline and progress.
• Deliver the day-to-day management of the client relationship for products and services.
• Support business development and commercial activities where required, providing expertise and input to proposals including renewable energy developers relationship building.
• Support international data analysis teams on project financial modelling
• Prepare presentation or analysis materials for Customer or internal team requirements
• Be accountable for Customer success, delivery excellence and program performance.
• Maintaining knowledge of Renewable Energy market trends, opportunities and new technologies and applying a customer lens and viewpoint.

Core Requirements:
• Bachelors or master’s degree in engineering, Economics, Finance or Sustainability or similar
• 3+ years of energy or renewable energy experience [solar PV, onshore or offshore wind and other technologies]. Including project development experience, project finance, corporate PPA’s and/or Corporate Energy procurement.
• Good understanding of global renewable energy incentives and regulatory structures
• Strong problem-solving, mathematical, basic understanding of financial modelling and organizational skills
• Fluent English communication ability, business level Japanese, Korean, Chinese or other Asian language skills will be a huge plus to communicate with regional team

#LI-YY1

#WKC
Please note that by submitting an employment application you consent to World Fuel Services processing your information for this role and potentially for future employment opportunities, in accordance with applicable laws. To learn more about how we protect and/or process personal information, please visit the WFS Privacy Center at: https://www.wfscorp.com/en/privacy-center.

title: Analyst - Senior Principal Analyst (Energy Technologies Dept)
description:
What the role is:
The Energy Market Authority (EMA) is a statutory board under the Singapore Ministry of Trade and Industry. Through our work, we seek to build a clean energy future that is resilient, sustainable, and competitive. We aim to ensure a reliable and secure energy supply, promote effective competition in the energy market and develop a dynamic energy sector in Singapore.

Responsibilities

You will be part of a team that assesses the feasibility of deploying new and emerging energy technologies in Singapore, with the objective of exploring possible options to support Singapore’s transition towards a clean energy future.

You will need to undertake technical assessments to ascertain the technical viability of these technologies in Singapore. In fulfilling your responsibilities, significant amount of coordination with consultants, academia, government agencies and technology vendors would be required.
• Assess feasibility of deploying new and emerging energy technologies in Singapore
• ​​Conduct techno-economic studies on new and emerging energy technologies.
• Assess the feasibility, risks, and benefits of implementing these technologies.
• Propose strategic roles that these technologies could perform as part of Singapore’s energy landscape.
• Integrate findings into recommendations to shape policies and plans.
• Develop / implement plans and policies to enable deployment
• Develop policies, legislation, and regulations to enable the deployment of promising energy technologies.
• Study and develop the necessary ecosystem (e.g. human resource, supporting infrastructure, research capabilities etc) required to sustain the deployment and operation of these technologies.
• Understand and develop funding and financing frameworks / mechanisms to facilitate deployment.
• Develop and implement stakeholder engagement plans to support efforts in communicating complex technological concepts or policies to stakeholders in clear and easy-to-understand manner.
• Develop energy technology-related capabilities through the engagement of international organisations
• ​​​Develop and submit reports to the Government and international organisations in collaboration with other agencies.
• Facilitate peer-review engagements by international organisations.

Who we are looking for:
• ​Relevant working experience in the energy industry would be an advantage.
• Strong understanding of technology concepts and trends, with the ability to assess economic and policy implications.
• Strong interest in new and emerging energy technologies, including nuclear.
• Able to coordinate complex workstreams with multiple stakeholders such as Government agencies and consultants.
• Familiarity with Government policy formulation and implementation will be an advantage.
• Excellent analytical, planning, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under tight timelines.

About Energy Market Authority
The Energy Market Authority (EMA) is statutory board under the Singapore Ministry or Trade and Industry (MTI). Through our work, we seek to build a clean energy future that is resilient, sustainable and competitive. We aim to ensure a reliable and secure energy supply, promote effective competition in the energy market and develop a dynamic energy sector in Singapore.

At EMA, we are dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, continuous learning and employee well-being. Joining us means embarking on a meaningful career where you will be part of a transformative journey towards a clean energy future, experiencing a unique adventure of discovery and growth.

We empower our people to drive innovation at every level Our open culture encourages teams to embrace diverse perspectives, enabling you to push beyond the status quo We are committed to energising your growth through ample opportunities for skill development. helping you become an expert in your field and a valuable asset to the energy industry.

You also stand to enjoy a comprehensive suite of benefits which are designed to meet your needs and prioritise your holistic well-being.

Visit: www.ema.gov.sg for more information.

title: Energy Trading Analyst
description:
We’re partnering with the Singapore trading arm of a leading state-backed energy group. They are looking to hire a Energy Trading Analyst to support their growing team with deep market insights, focusing on supply-demand trends, fundamentals, and trading strategy development.

Responsibilities
• Conduct in-depth quantitative and qualitative research on global energy markets, with a focus on energy transition and its impact on crude oil.
• Develop innovative research methods and leverage new data sources and tools to address key business questions.
• Apply advanced modeling techniques such as supply-demand analysis and scenario planning to evaluate medium- to long-term oil and gas market trends.
• Monitor energy market developments, policies, and regulations to generate strategic insights.
• Identify emerging opportunities and provide actionable recommendations to support trading strategies.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree with minimum 3 years of experience in oil and gas trading, with a strong focus on crude oil markets.
• Deep understanding of crude oil fundamentals, particularly supply and demand dynamics.
• Strong analytical skills with experience handling large datasets and deriving insights.
• Proven ability to improve models or systems through innovation and collaboration.

How to Apply:

Submit your application by emailing a detailed copy of your updated resume to Tiffany Dorjpalam (EA Personnel Reg. No. R1765533, Achieve Career Consultant Pte Ltd EA Licence No. 05C3451) by clicking the “Apply Now” or please submit your updated CV to tiffany.dorjpalam@achievegroup.asia. You may also reach out to me directly at 9652 3994 for a confidential discussion.

title: Energy Markets Analyst​/Electricity Portfolio
LNG Analyst
description:
LNG Analyst

Department: Markets

Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

Location: Singapore

Reporting To: Min Na

Description
At Energy Aspects, we pride ourselves on the exceptional talent that forms the foundation of our remarkable success story. We are excited to announce that we are looking for an Analyst to enhance our dynamic team. This is an outstanding career opportunity for an analyst with a commercial mindset and knowledge of the relevant oil markets. Are you ready to contribute to and grow with a respected and rapidly evolving research consultancy?

In the role of an energy markets analyst, you will be a key player in our oil service, adeptly navigating and interpreting the ever-evolving market landscape. We value prior experience and a comprehensive understanding of crude supply, demand, or midstream sectors.

The role demands adaptability and a commitment to excellence as part of a collaborative team. We encourage all our team members to cultivate their professional standing within the industry, backed by some of the industry's most esteemed commentators. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and possess the organisational skills necessary for planning and prioritising tasks to achieve outstanding results.

In exchange, we offer excellent remuneration, a high-performance culture, with challenging and exciting work.

Key Responsibilities
The responsibilities of this role will span the full cycle of our work, from monitoring market developments, writing concise analysis, presenting to clients, and helping upkeep supply/demand/pricing models. Other responsibilities will include:
• Producing relevant and insightful reports and analyses on market movements, to highlight challenges and opportunities for traders, etc.
• Predicting and commenting on market movements, formally through our publications and on an ad-hoc bases with our clients.
• Keeping updated on any, and all latest developments in crude production, refining, imports, exports, storage, midstream and pricing.
• Analysis of upstream and midstream companies’ earnings reports (10Ks/Q2s) and reviewing financial performance.
• Collecting data sets, then highlighting key changes in the data and providing insights on how it affects short-term market balances.
• Presenting our views to clients verbally and through writing.
• Building and maintaining strong internal and external networks

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
• 2-5 years of experience analysing a commodity, with prior experience in crude oil preferred.
• A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Data Analytics, or a related field.
• Strong MS Excel skills are required. Programming skills are preferred (Python, SQL, Power BI).
• The ability to communicate market views clearly and concisely to clients in English (written and verbal).
• Experience running supply and demand balances and using these to analyse future pricing trends.
• A strong eye for detail and drive to ensure content published is client-ready and follows the company’s strong ethos.
• The ability to meet deadlines and work effectively with others, including colleagues in different time zones, to deliver timely analysis will be critical.

Benefits
Welcome to our unique workplace where a passion for our industry-leading product sits at the heart of who we are.

Life at EA is completely eclectic, fostered through the global nature of the business and a real appreciation of the many cultures of our diverse team. We unite as a single, cohesive team through an array of social clubs that cater to a spectrum of interests, from running and yoga to football and culinary adventures. These groups create a collegial and dynamic atmosphere that extends beyond work, promoting a healthy and balanced lifestyle for our team.

Our strategically located offices are all set in prestigious buildings, offering you the convenience of nearby gyms, retail therapy, diverse dining options, and accessible public transport.

Our office spaces are thoughtfully equipped to enhance your day-to-day experience whether working independently or collaborating with teammates. Enjoy the simple pleasures of a freshly brewed coffee, healthy snacks, and a social space for celebratory moments. One of the unique traits of life at Energy Aspects is the way our international colleagues often delight us with treats from around the globe. It’s safe to say you’ll never go hungry in our offices!

We recognize your contribution with a competitive compensation package that includes annual bonuses, comprehensive private health insurance, and substantial pension contributions. Additionally, we offer company share options, subsidized gym memberships, and a generous holiday policy to support your financial and personal well-being.

Join a company that values your professional growth and personal fulfilment, all within a supportive and engaging environment.

title: New Energy Ratings Analyst
description:
About Us:

HySights is a mission-driven ratings agency dedicated to the energy transition. We evaluate and rate emerging energy infrastructure projects — across all hydrogen-to-X and biomass-to-X pathways — with the aim of supporting investors, developers, and policymakers in making transparent, data-driven decisions that accelerate decarbonization.

As we scale our impact, we are looking for a mid-level analyst to join our multidisciplinary team and contribute to the delivery of rigorous, consistent ratings across diverse low-carbon energy technologies.

Role Summary:

The Energy Ratings Analyst will be responsible for conducting and delivering project ratings for a wide variety of new energy infrastructure assets. The role requires a deep understanding of project techno-economics, a strong grasp of energy systems, and the flexibility to work across multiple technologies and geographies. You will work closely with the sales and marketing team to synthesize project data into robust, standardized ratings outputs.

Key Responsibilities:
• Ratings Delivery
• Conduct structured ratings assessments of hydrogen, ammonia, and biofuels projects using internal methodologies and data tools.
• Evaluate projects across multiple dimensions, including technical feasibility, economic viability, execution risk, offtake, and environmental factors.
• Write clear and defensible project rating reports for internal review and external publication.
• Technoeconomic Analysis
• Review and interpret detailed project inputs such as cost breakdowns (CAPEX/OPEX), process configurations, energy sources, and offtake agreements.
• Apply critical thinking to assess project assumptions and stress-test economic performance.
• Benchmark projects against reference plants and industry norms.
• Cross-Technology Work
• Maintain the flexibility to pivot between fuel types — including hydrogen (green, blue), ammonia (green, blue), and various forms of biofuels (biomethane, bio-SAF).
• Stay up to date with evolving value chains and market structures across these technologies.
• Stakeholder Interaction
• Engage with project developers, investors, and technology vendors to clarify assumptions and gather contextual insights.
• Support internal and client-facing presentations and discussions around rating outputs.
• Methodology Development (Optional)
• Provide feedback to improve the ratings methodology based on sector developments and project learnings.

Required Qualifications:
• Education: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, Energy Systems, Economics, Finance, or related field.
• Experience:
• 3–6 years of relevant experience in energy infrastructure, consulting, ratings, or project finance.
• Exposure to new energy technologies (especially in clean molecules) through development, advisory, or investment roles.
• Skills & Knowledge:
• Solid understanding of project technoeconomic evaluations and drivers of commercial viability.
• Familiarity with energy project development, and overall energy transition trends.
• Proficiency in Excel-based financial models and comfort interpreting technical data (e.g., process flows, energy balances).
• Strong communication skills, especially in synthesizing complex material into written ratings or project summaries.
• Ability to manage competing priorities and work on multiple projects in parallel.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience with LCOE modelling, emissions analysis, or lifecycle carbon metrics.
• Understanding of regulatory landscapes, incentive structures, or certification regimes for new fuels.
• Exposure to infrastructure risk assessment frameworks.
• Only candidates who are authorized to work in Singapore will be considered

title: Analyst - Energy & Infrastructure
company_name: HJA-Jones Lang LaSalle Property Consultants Pte Ltd
description: JLL empowers you to shape a brighter way. Our people at JLL and JLL Technologies are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology for our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people and empowering them to thrive, grow meaningful careers and to find a place where they belong. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades or technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, join our team as we help shape a brighter way forward. The combined needs of economic growth, energy security, decarbonization, electrification and digitalization are driving unprecedented demand for Energy and Infrastructure investment across Asia Pacific. With the rising demand for private sector led solutions to this challenge and the need for innovative financing and transaction solutions in the infrastructure and renewables sectors, JLL invites experienced analysts to join our newly established Asia Pacific Energy and Infrastructure team. This role provides an exciting opportunity to support our operations across Singapore and significant markets in the Asia Pacific region providing equity, financing and capital raising services to clients in the renewable energy, storage and energy transition sectors. title: Renewable Energy Investment Analyst
description:
D'Arcy Weil is hiring a Renewable Energy Investment Analyst in Singapore. The role involves market research, financial analysis, due diligence, and portfolio management for renewable energy investments. Candidates should have a bachelor's degree and at least 5 years of relevant experience. The company promotes sustainable growth and offers ongoing training in a collaborative work environment focused on innovative clean energy solutions.

title: Junior Reporting Analyst
description:
Job Title:
Junior Reporting Analyst

Contract Type:
Permanent

Time Type:
Full time

Job Description:

Summary of Company
• Gunvor Group is one of the world’s largest independent commodities trading houses by turnover, creating logistics solutions that safely and efficiently move physical energy from where it is sourced and stored to where it is demanded most. With strategic investments in industrial infrastructure—refineries, pipelines, storage, and terminals—Gunvor further generates sustainable value across the global supply chain for its customers. Gunvor, founded in 2000, generated US $135 billion in revenues on volumes of 240 million MT in 2021. The company remains on track to meet its goal of cutting Scope 1 and 2 emissions 40% by 2025.
• Gunvor has more than 1,500 employees and it maintains offices in Singapore, Amsterdam, Beijing, Dubai, Geneva, Houston, London, Shanghai, and Tallinn with new offices planned in strategically relevant markets.

Overview of Role
• The Junior Reporting Analyst, based in Singapore, will be responsible in supporting the global credit team by ensuring accurate and up-to-date information. This includes identifying missing or incorrect data and performing tasks independently. The individual will also work in collaboration with the Business Analysts and IT to support the automation of data feeds between systems to ensure accurate credit exposure reporting.

Main Responsibilities
• Conduct research and provide summaries of new markets that the Group is entering into.
• Correct ETRM interface files where that are obvious mistakes and before a permanent solution can be implemented in the ETRMs.
• Conduct regular Credit System consistency checks
• Monitor/ calculate exposures on a number of counterparties to have accurate exposure data
• Provide exposure data updates on majors with LNG mark-to-market exposure
• Enter and update external ratings in Benefit-Cost Ratio (BCR) and ensure up to date information in the monitoring lists with S&P and Fitch
• Calculate various margin exposures that are currently not being managed automatically
• Enter silent covers, discounting and insurance covers in BCR
• Static data clean-up/ enrichment
• Market and counterparty research
• Update credit system based on results and findings from research and review, focusing on group structures and country risk
• Update data repository with static data
• Collaborate with compliance to align data and share findings
• Compare and align credit system with excel-based open credit lists
• Clean up inconsistencies in data across different systems and sources within Gunvor Group
• Research and summaries information on new markets
• Assist with other relevant tasks as needed
• Perform other ad-hoc duties assigned by your manager
• Work to automate manual process tasks where possible

Profile
The individual should have the following experience:
• Fresh Graduate or Recent graduate are welcome to apply.
• Ideally, Bachelor degree with a major in Finance, Economics or Business Administration is preferred.
• Experience in the Commodities Trading market (a plus)
• Proficient in Microsoft office
• Detail-oriented and meticulous in work
• Strong numerical skills
• Fluent in English and Mandarin skills required (additional languages, especially Japanese, will be a plus)
• Inquisitive and self-motivated learner
• Strong communicator and team player

If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

title: /Energy Finance Analyst  Steel Sector /2 Positions/
company_name: Institute For Energy Economics And Finan
description:
Energy Finance Analyst – Steel Sector (2 Positions)

The Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis (IEEFA) is seeking two professionals to join our Global Steel Team:

· Energy Finance Analyst – Steel Sector (Preferably located in India)

· Senior Energy Finance Analyst – Steel Sector (Preferably located in Australia)

Both roles focus on analysing the financial and economic aspects of the steel sector, with a particular emphasis on technology transitions, energy and resource security, and decarbonisation. These are remote positions, and candidates may be based anywhere in Asia Pacific, preferably in India or Australia.

We are looking for professionals with expertise in global steel manufacturing, energy finance, and industry decarbonisation. The Energy Finance Analyst will focus on data-driven research and financial analysis, while the Senior Analyst will take on additional strategic and leadership responsibilities. The ideal candidates must possess a commitment to IEEFA’s mission to accelerate the transition to a diverse, sustainable, and profitable energy economy.

In the context of the steel sector, this means critically analysing the threats and opportunities faced by steel manufacturers, including their supply chain of iron ore, coking coal, electricity procurement, hydrogen and scrap steel. Due to the ongoing need to meet growing steel demand whilst addressing energy and resource security and the need to decarbonise industry. The Analysts will conduct and disseminate economic and financial analysis with the aim to influence policies and investment in the steel sector.

IEEFA is a rapidly-growing NGO/not-for-profit that conducts research and analysis on financial and economic issues related to energy markets, trends and policies. Headquartered in the United States, IEEFA has a team of analysts and communications personnel located across the globe. Our dynamic teams work collaboratively the across regions and different research areas including the coal, gas, and electricity markets.

IEEFA produces a significant volume of original research, as well as ongoing analysis and reports on issues affecting energy industries. Our major research reports, daily commentaries, press coverage and other resources can be found on our website: www.ieefa.org.

Roles and Responsibilities

For Both Roles:

· Research, interpret, and publish financial and industry data related to the steel sector.

· Analyse technology developments in low-emission steel and their implications for the sector.

· Assess the impact of iron ore, coking coal, electricity procurement, hydrogen, and scrap steel on the steel supply chain.

· Conduct financial analysis, financial modelling, and market analysis in Excel.

· Draft, format, and proof reports, submissions, and press releases.

· Create and update PowerPoint presentations for public, media, and industry briefings.

· Monitor energy and finance news, including downloading press articles, annual reports, and investor presentations.

· Review and provide commentary on company strategies, policies, and technologies in the steel sector.

· Track financial performance, company investment trends, technology developments, and strategic announcements.

· Liaise with stakeholders, think tanks, and industry representatives to foster collaboration.

· Build relationships with industry, government, regulators, and financial contacts to enhance research impact.

· Provide insights to the media and respond to requests to contribute to public discussions.

· Other duties as assigned.

Additional Responsibilities for the Senior Energy Finance Analyst:

· Lead high-level research projects and drive strategic insights into the steel sector transition.

· Act as a subject matter expert in external engagements with industry leaders, investors, policymakers, and financial institutions.

· Oversee the development and dissemination of research reports and publications.

· Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts, supporting professional development.

· Shape IEEFA’s thought leadership by influencing policy discussions and investment strategies in the steel sector.

Required Qualifications

Energy Finance Analyst:

· 1 to 4 years of experience in finance, energy, engineering, or a related field.

· Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, engineering, or relevant experience.

· Strong analytical, financial modelling, and quantitative skills.

· Excellent writing and communication skills, demonstrated through reports and publications.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Box, and ClickUp (or equivalents).

· Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment.

Senior Energy Finance Analyst:

· 7+ years of experience, including in strategic finance, investment analysis, or industry research.

· Bachelor's or Master’s degree in finance, economics, engineering, or relevant experience.

· Demonstrated ability to lead projects and engage with senior stakeholders.

· Strong understanding of energy transition, decarbonisation strategies, and investment risks in the steel sector.

Compensation and Benefits

Full-time, 12-month fixed-term contract with the possibility of extension by mutual agreement. We offer a market-competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

The remuneration range for the senior analyst is AUD 155,233 to $187,350 base plus super for locations in Australia. Pay rates are based on education, skill, experience level and internal equity.

Locations outside of Australia: IEEFA aims to offer comparable salaries, benefits, and leave to employees living outside of Australia in line with our fully transparent compensation framework. More information can be requested by contacting IEEFA’s HR team.

Work Schedule

Full-time, 5 days/week with occasional evening or weekend work as required. IEEFA is an international organization, so some late evening, early morning and weekend work will be required due to time zone differences and for on-site event coordination.

Travel

Some travel is required. All global team members attend IEEFA’s annual conference and regional or international team retreat.

Physical Demand and Work Environment.

Must be able to work for prolonged periods at a computer. Computer work can involve repetitive motion, eyestrain, back, and neck strain.

EOE Statement/ Diversity and Inclusivity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at IEEFA. All members of under-represented groups are especially encouraged to apply. We are committed to providing all team members with a work environment free from discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy/parental status or disability status.

Reasonable Accommodation Statement

IEEFA provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact the Office of Human Resources at +61 422 859 321. Determinations will be made on a case-by-case basis.

To Apply

Qualified applicants should submit a resume and cover letter. The first review of applicants will begin on 15th April 2025. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. Please be sure to add notifications@app.bamboohr.com to your contact list to ensure delivery of all correspondence from us.

title: Trading Analyst (Crude Oil)
description:
This role sits within SK Energy International.

About SK Energy International (SKEI)

SKEI markets and trades crude oil and petroleum products. The company was incorporated in 1990 and is based in Singapore. SK energy international operates as a subsidiary of SK trading international.

Job Profile

The Trading Analyst will be a member in Crude Oil Trading Book, one of the trading books in Singapore, reporting to the department head and supporting SK’s commodities trading business. This role supports the front-office trading team with real-time analytics, market intelligence, and data-driven insights.

Job Responsibilities
• Construct and maintain databases for key crude oil statistics, derive key trends, and convert these observations into insightful notes. Prepare analytical reports in a timely, relevant, and thought-provoking manner
• Monitor global crude oil markets, including supply/demand fundamentals, geopolitical developments
• Develop and update analytical models (e.g., arbitrage models, refinery yield/margin models, freight economics)
• Track cargo flows, shipping movements, and inventory levels
• Assist and work closely with traders with market intelligence and short-term trading strategies
• Analyze pricing structures (e.g., spreads, benchmarks, differentials) and provide actionable insights
• Compile and present market reports to internal stakeholders

Candidate Profile

A self-motivated individual who value integrity, have willing brain engagement in going the extra miles to provide excellent and create happiness and values to stakeholders. A strong candidate should possess the following:
• Degree in Business, Economics, Finance or other relevant qualifications with strong mathematical inclination
• Minimum 3 years of relevant trading experience, preferably in the Oil & Gas industry
• Strong analytical and financial modelling skills to assimilate complex and ambiguous data to identify key issues and aid in decision making
• Strong knowledge of oil markets, trading instruments, and physical logistics
• Strong communication skills; able to summarize complex findings concisely and to convey complex ideas clearly
• Comfortable working under pressure and dynamic trading environment
• Strongly knowledge of MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
• A highly motivated and organized individual who exhibits strong integrity, work ethics and ability to perform under pressure

Salary will be commensurate with qualifications & experience.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified, typically within 2 weeks from the closing date of the posting.

title: Business System Analyst/Senior Executive
description:
Singapore, Central, Singapore

Job Function

N.A.

Department

Business Development (Projects)

Job posted on

Apr 09, 2025

Employee Group

Permanent

Experience range (Years)

0 - 0

About Sembcorp

Sembcorp is a leading energy and urban solutions provider headquartered in Singapore. Led by its purpose to drive energy transition, Sembcorp delivers sustainable energy solutions and urban developments by leveraging its sector expertise and global track record.

Play a role in Powering Asia’s Energy Transition

Drive Asia’s energy transition with us! Our Gas & Related Services segment is a key growth engine, delivering reliable and efficient energy to industries and communities across multiple countries. We support Asia’s growing energy needs while advancing the shift to a lower-carbon future.

PURPOSE AND SCOPE

The Business System Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Programme Manager on the key initiatives below.

Drive post-acquisition integration of key business functions and operations across multiple corporate functions and workstreams between the organisations –
• Ensuring alignment with organisational goals and successful execution of the integration strategy
• Developing, standardising and optimising business processes for post-acquisition effectiveness

Implementation of specific Digital/IT projects across organisations.

Project planning and process excellence towards business development programmes –
• Assist in development of bid and proposal management
• Support in project planning, project development execution as well as corporate approvals process (with a view to streamline across organisations)
• Assist in process excellence for the department, including designing database and tools for market intelligence (e.g., for prices, costs, pipelines)

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Integration Strategy & Planning
• Support the development and execution of the integration programme, ensuring alignment with overall business goals.
• Support in develop detailed project plans and roadmaps for the integration, ensuring all functions and departments are aligned.

Project Execution
• Manage and oversee the day-to-day execution of integration activities across multiple workstreams (e.g., HR, Digital/IT, Finance, etc.).
• Ensure integration milestones are achieved on time and within scope.
• Coordinate with cross-functional teams, ensuring that resources, timelines, and priorities are effectively managed.

Performance Monitoring & Reporting
• Monitor and track the progress of the integration programme against defined KPIs and objectives.
• Provide regular status reports to the senior leadership, and other key stakeholders.
• Evaluate integration outcomes and suggest improvements for future integration efforts.

Bid & Proposal Management
• Support in development, timeline management and documentation of bids and proposals during project development phase, including seeking internal approvals in accordance with corporate and investment governance processes

Process Excellence
• Assist in process excellence for the department, including designing database and tools for market intelligence (e.g., for prices, costs, pipelines)
• Support in standardisation of templates, management paper and inter-departmental process flow to achieve process and resource efficiency

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or related fields.
• Preferably 2-3 years of relevant working experience in the energy or utilities industry. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
• In-depth knowledge and experience in business process improvement and project management and implementation preferred.

SKILLS/COMPETENCIES & PREFERRED CHARACTERISTICS
• Strong project management skills, with a proven ability to manage multiple workstreams and ensure timely delivery.
• Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and manage stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.
• Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to tailor messages to different audiences and for reporting.
• Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project or similar) and Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
• Ability to manage approval processes and work with senior leadership to gain necessary corporate sign-offs.

Our Culture at Sembcorp

At Sembcorp, our culture is shaped by a strong set of shared behaviours that guide the way we work and uphold our commitment to driving the energy transition.

We foster an institution-first mindset, where the success of Sembcorp takes precedence over individual interests. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do, as we work seamlessly across markets, businesses, and functions to achieve our goals together. Accountability is a core principle, ensuring that we take ownership of our commitments and deliver on them with integrity and excellence. These values define who we are and create a workplace where our people can thrive while making a meaningful impact on driving energy transition.

Join us in making a real impact!

title: Analyst (Korean Speaking)
description:
Analyst (Korean Speaking)

Description
Based in Singapore and supporting key ASEAN countries, Taiwan, and South Korea, you will contribute to the firm, by developing analysis and conveying insights to enhance clients’ decision making. You will play an active role in all aspects of client engagement: helping identify issues, forming hypotheses, conducting analysis, and synthesising conclusions into recommendations.

You will combine technical strength with a strong track record of leadership and performance in team-oriented environments.

You will work in a dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. You will enjoy autonomy, the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, and to grow into an industry expert under the guidance of senior members of the team with deep experience addressing major strategic issues at the world’s leading advisory firms.

The position suits a recent STEM graduate of a bachelor’s or master’s programme.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop timely and rigorous quantitative analyses to enhance clients’ decision making
• Work closely with our modelling team, structuring economic problems into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results
• Contribute to our product development, by identifying new opportunities and expanding our capabilities
• Engage with clients to thoroughly understand their requirements
• Communicate findings to clients

What we are looking for
Required attributes:
• First-class or high second-class degree in a quantitative subject (Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, Finance)
• An ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information
• Evidence of strong performance in team-oriented environments
• An ability to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical parties.
• Fluency in both Korean and English

What we offer
• The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector
• Direct engagement with clients through Aurora conferences, workshops and webinars
• The opportunity to grow into a publicly visible industry expert
• A fun, informal and international work culture
• Private medical insurance

• Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills
• Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity/paternity.

title: Payroll & Treasury Analyst
description:
We're the global leader in providing energy solutions that help businesses grow and communities thrive.

We work as a team and we’re proud of the difference we make to customers, to local communities, and towards a sustainable future for the world.

We’re looking for a Payroll & Treasury Analyst to provide Payroll and Treasury support to all countries across Asia. The role will be the main lead owning the Payroll, Bank and Petty cash processes across Asia, reporting to the Regional Financial Controller based in Singapore.

Why Aggreko?
• Competitive compensation package & annual bonus program
• Industry-leading benefit plans
• Continuous training and development with career growth opportunities
• Safety-focused culture

What you’ll do:
• Oversee Asia Payroll Processing: Coordinate with People Services and external vendors to ensure smooth payroll operations across Asia.
• Finance Ownership of Payroll: Review and approve payroll computations from vendors.
• Facilitate On-Time Payments: Manage bank uploads to ensure timely employee disbursements.
• Payroll Data Reconciliation: Reconcile payroll data and upload it to the ERP system.
• Monthly Balance Sheet Reconciliation: Conduct monthly reconciliations of payroll and employee-related balance sheet accounts.
• Manage Treasury Processes: Maintain bank mandates and update Trezone, including logging guarantee requests.
• Petty Cash Reconciliation: Reconcile petty cash.
• Monitor Cash Forecasting & Bank Reconciliation: Oversee weekly cash forecasting and bank reconciliation processes.
• Primary Wipro BPO Contact: Serve as the main point of contact for the Wipro BPO vendor regarding cash and bank matters.
• Petty Cash & Cash Advance Ownership: Manage petty cash and cash advance processes, ensuring valid spending and timely expense liquidation.

You’ll have the following skills and experience:
• Education/Experience: Hold a Bachelor's degree or have equivalent work experience, with a professional accounting/auditing qualification being a plus.
• Relevant Experience: Possess a minimum of 3 years of experience in payroll and treasury accounting.
• Communication Skills: Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken, particularly in English.
• Microsoft Office Proficiency: Be proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
• Adaptability: Show an ability to adapt to highly dynamic work environments.
• Credibility & Discretion: Exhibit a high level of credibility and capability in handling sensitive information.
• Proactive Engagement: Be able to proactively communicate with and engage stakeholders.
• Organizational Skills: Possess effective planning, organizational, and time management skills.
• Quality & Detail-Oriented: Be quality-oriented with strong attention to detail.
• Deadline Management: Be capable of working effectively to meet deadlines.

Find out more and apply now.

title: Japan Power Trader
description:
Japan Power Trader

About US (Engie S&EM):

ENGIE Supply and Energy Management (S&EM) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 expertises:
• Asset management
• Energy transition services
• Energy supply & global commodities
• Risk management & market access

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

Context:

The APAC Power desk in S&EM plays a critical role in leading power trading activities in Asia. Our existing power markets cover a wide range of countries, including Australia, New Zealand, Singapore and Japan, while working closely with asset business units within the group in developing power market, such as India, Philippine, Malaysia and Vietnam.

Role:

As a Japan Power Trader, you will report to the Head of BP APAC Power and Gas. The role is a permanent post to be based in Singapore. You will working together with Head of Japan and APAC Power desk, contribute trading strategies to Japan book. Alongside of trading, the role requires collaboration with Engie’s global analytics team, commercial functions and support function desk.

Hard skills:
• Having prior market analytics experiences, in particular, Japan power markets.
• Initiating and supporting Japan Power flat price and option trading activities from scratch, including setting up strategies, market updates, and structure products trading assessment and support to long term origination desk.
• Being accountable for book PnL, of which the agreed risk framework, including VaR, drawdown and delta limits will be given accordingly.
• Leading and Exploring the development on new trading products in Japan Power
• Holding expertise center for Japan Power market product front.

Soft skills:
• Quantitative analysis skills, preferably with the experience in Energy Commodity markets.
• An effective team player and passionate about Energy Markets.
• Innovative and strong initiative to work independently under minimal supervision, a true self starter
• Strong Mathematical capability, attention to detail and problem solver.
• Proactive, and creative thinker
• Willingness to explore and learn about new markets and products with initiatives
• Team player

Education and professional background:
• University Degree in Business, Finance, Economics or Engineering highly preferred.
• Minimum 2 years power trading, or 5 years power market analytics experiences, preferably with track record as a existing Japan Power trader.

Languages:
• English

Work Location:
• Singapore – Asia Square Tower 1

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - BP ASIA PACIFIC

Legal Entity: ENGIE ENERGY MARKETING SINGAPORE PTE LTD

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree

Why this matters to us

Our organisation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer reasonable accommodations upon request for individuals with disabilities.

title: Power Trading Director
description:
1.Strategic Leadership
• Develop and execute a global power trading strategy aligned with the company’s renewable energy portfolio and growth objectives.
• Lead cross-functional teams (trading, analytics, risk, legal) to optimize trading of energy, capacity, and ancillary services across markets (e.g., spot markets, futures, OTC derivatives).
• Identify and evaluate new market opportunities (e.g., emerging renewable energy markets, green hydrogen integration, virtual power plants).

2.Trading Operations & Performance
• Oversee day-to-day trading activities, ensuring compliance with local regulations and market rules (e.g., EEX, Nodal, APX, CME).
• Manage a portfolio of power purchase agreements (PPAs), virtual PPAs, and structured deals to maximize revenue and minimize price risk.
• Leverage data analytics and AI-driven tools (e.g., our EnOS™ platform) to enhance trading algorithms, predict market trends, and improve decision-making.

3.Risk Management
• Develop and implement risk management frameworks for price, counterparty, and operational risks.
• Monitor and report on key risk metrics (VaR, margin requirements, exposure limits) to senior leadership and stakeholders.
• Negotiate and structure hedging instruments (futures, swaps, options) to protect against market volatility.

4.Market Development & Partnerships
• Engage with policymakers, regulators, and industry associations to shape market rules and advocate for renewable energy integration.
• Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders (utilities, industrial clients, traders, financial institutions).
• Collaborate with business development teams to design customized energy solutions (e.g., corporate PPAs, green tariffs).

5.Team Building & Governance
• Lead and mentor a global team of power traders, analysts, and strategists, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
• Establish trading policies, procedures, and KPIs to ensure operational efficiency and compliance with internal controls.
• Report to the C-suite and board on trading performance, market insights, and strategic initiatives.

Key Requirements
• Experience: 10+ years of senior leadership experience in power trading, energy marketing, or commodities trading, preferably in renewable energy.
• Market Knowledge: In-depth understanding of global power markets (EU, North America, APAC), including regulatory structures, pricing mechanisms, and renewable energy policies.
• Technical Skills: Proficiency in trading platforms (e.g., ETRM systems), risk management tools, and data analytics. Familiarity with AI/ML applications in trading is a plus.
• Leadership: Proven ability to manage cross-cultural teams and drive collaboration across functions (engineering, finance, legal).
• Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, engineering, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
• Language: Fluency in English (mandatory); Chinese, Spanish, or other major languages are a plus.
• Mindset: Passion for sustainability, strategic vision, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, global environment.

What We Offer
• A role at the forefront of the energy transition, with impact across multiple continents.
• Competitive compensation package, including base salary, performance bonuses, and equity options.
• Opportunities for professional growth in a rapidly expanding global company.
• A collaborative, innovation-driven culture with a focus on sustainability and diversity.

title: Intraday Power Trader Analyst
description:
Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support
the most exciting missions in the world! When you join EDF Trading you’ll
become part of a diverse international team of experts who challenge
conventional ideas, test new approaches and think outside the box. Energy
markets evolve rapidly so our team needs to remain agile, flexible and ready

LPG, oil and environmental products. EDF Group and our customers all over the

Gender balance and inclusion are very high on the agenda at EDF Trading so you
will become part of an ever-diversifying family of around 800 colleagues based
in London, Paris, Singapore, Tokyo and Houston. Regular social and networking
events, both physical and virtual, will ensure that you always feel connected
to your colleagues and the business. Who are we? We are EDF Trading, part of
the EDF Group, a world leader in low-carbon sustainable electricity generation
partnered with JERA, one of Japan’s largest utilities; the perfect
organisation at which to begin or progress your career in the commodities
sector. Join us, make a difference and help shape the future of energy. Job
Description: Department EDF Trading Markets Limited is the Paris Branch of EDF
Trading and provides the base for the European Optimisation business. The
optimisation of the EDF SA production assets on the European wholesale markets
is conducted on a 24/7 basis by the Trading and Analytical Teams in Paris in
close cooperation with the EDF Asset management. Optimisation and proprietary
trading are conducted across multiple markets. The day-ahead power trading
activity of EDF Trading for France, Germany, Switzerland and Austria The
intraday power trading activity of EDF Trading across Europe Position purpose
As an Intraday Power Trader and at EDF Trading, you will play a crucial role
in our dynamic trading team. We are seeking candidates who possess a unique
blend of commercial acumen, analytical prowess, and technical proficiency to
make rapid decisions in a fast-paced trading environment. Your
responsibilities will encompass a wide range of activities, including trading,
model development, strategy enhancement, and mentorship. We are seeking a
candidate who is not only technically skilled but also possesses the
determination and discipline to excel in the demanding world of power trading.
The ability to make decisive decisions under pressure is crucial for success
in this role. Attention to detail is vital in ensuring the accuracy of trades
and analyses, and effective communication skills are essential for
collaborating with team members and sharing insights. Furthermore, as an
Intraday Power Trader and Analyst at EDF Trading, you will frequently use
coding languages like VBA and Python to develop and optimise trading models.
Proficiency in these languages and strong IT skills are essential for this
position. While prior knowledge of the gas market is not mandatory, it would
be a valuable asset to trade in interconnected energy markets. Main
responsibilities Intraday Power Trading: Execute power trades across all
European markets, including products that can be traded mere minutes before
physical power delivery. Model Development: Collaborate with our team to
develop and refine trading models using various programming languages, such as
Python and VBA. Continuous Improvement: Work closely with analysts to enhance
existing trading strategies and models, ensuring we remain at the forefront of
the Intraday power market. Portfolio Management: Manage one of the largest
portfolios in Europe, leveraging the expertise of our experienced colleagues.
Training: Undergo an extensive training program to quickly become proficient
in trading. Transition to detailed fundamental market analysis and develop
analytical tools for the trading desk. Market Knowledge: Develop a deep
understanding of various commodities and power markets across Europe.
Mentorship: As you gain expertise, have the opportunity to mentor junior
traders and share your knowledge to foster a collaborative team environment.
This role is subject to the Front Office Supervision Procedures and you are
required to adhere to them at all times and attest that you have read and
understood them on an annual basis. Experience required 1-2 year experience in
either a commodities trading environment (trading, asset optimisation, risk
management or portfolio analysis) or in a closely related working environment.
Technical requirements Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Finance,
Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, or related disciplines). Advanced degrees
are a plus. Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with an ability to make
swift decisions in a trading environment. Proficiency in programming
languages, particularly VBA and Python, and a strong aptitude for IT tools.
Excellent attention to detail, communication skills, and a collaborative team
spirit. Motivated, disciplined, and able to thrive in high-pressure situations
Knowledge or experience in the gas market is highly appreciated but not
mandatory Hours of work: The position requires flexibility on work hours and
days due to market requirements. Shift rota including night and weekend shifts
(24/7).

title: Senior Crude Operator - Energy Trading Firm
description:
• Global Fortune 500 companies
• Strong asset base with ownership of refineries
• Large and well-established operations team

Description

A Global Fortune 500 company with a strong asset base including refineries, and a large, well-established operations team that drives efficient, high-volume execution across markets. products. They are hiring an experienced crude operator for the big team.

Role

Reporting to the Head of Operations, the Crude Oil Operator is responsible for managing the full lifecycle of crude oil cargo operations, ensuring timely delivery, cost efficiency, and risk mitigation. This includes overseeing the physical trade process from contract execution to post-delivery activities, handling pre-shipment documentation such as Letters of Credit (LC), Bills of Lading (BL), and surveyor nominations. The role requires close coordination with traders, charterers, suppliers, terminals, surveyors, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth cargo execution and scheduling. The operator will monitor inventory levels, track performance metrics, ensure compliance with contractual and regulatory requirements, and proactively resolve operational issues to support continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will hold a degree in Maritime Studies or a related field, with a minimum of 3 years of experience in cargo operations. Experience in crude oil operations, logistics, or trading within an oil major or energy company is highly preferred. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities are essential for efficiently addressing operational challenges, along with proficiency in MS Office Suite. A solid understanding of trade finance, Incoterms, and relevant documentation is required. Proficiency in Mandarin is a plus for engaging with Chinese counterparties.

Apply

To apply, please submit your resume to James Yan at James@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number JA33894. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Licence No: 16S8060

Registration no: R22104741

Desired Skills and Experience

Crude Oil, Cargo Operation, Trading Operations

title: APAC Gas Trader (f/m/d)
description:
Workload: 100%

As an APAC Gas Trader, you will drive gas derivatives proprietary trading across major indices, ensuring profitability and compliance. Your deep knowledge of the gas and LNG markets and strong collaboration with internal teams will be key to expanding Axpo's position in the APAC region.

What you will do:
• Develop and manage gas derivatives proprietary trading strategies across JKM/TTF/HH/Oil indices.
• Collaborate with LNG and APAC power desks on trading strategies, hedging, and position management.
• Execute orders across JKM, TTF, HH, JCC, and Brent indices for LNG and APAC power desks.
• Enhance models by working closely with analytical teams in Singapore and Switzerland.
• Maintain compliance with Axpo’s risk management policies and expand commercial networks in APAC.
• Communicate risk/reward strategies clearly to management and risk teams.

What you bring & who you are:
• University degree in mathematics, engineering, computer science, economics, or chemistry.
• 5+ years of gas trading experience, with a focus on physical and derivative markets in Asia.
• Strong knowledge of US/EU/Asia gas and LNG markets and their interactions.
• Expertise in trading natural gas/oil options and translating models into strategies.
• Fluency in English; an Asian language is a plus. Strong coding and database skills preferred.

About the team:

You will be part of a highly collaborative trading team, interacting with desks in Singapore and Switzerland. Together, we work to enhance market models, share intelligence, and ensure that we meet both P&L and risk management objectives.

title: Intraday Power Trading Strategist
description:
Quantitative Trader Opportunity

An Intraday Power Quant Trader will sit at the intersection of quantitative modeling and real-time trading, developing, executing, and optimizing trading strategies across European intraday power markets. The role requires a strong background in quantitative analysis, trading strategy development, or algorithmic execution, ideally in power, commodities, or short-term markets.
Key Responsibilities:
• Design and Maintain Forecasting Models
• Build and Optimize Execution Algorithms
• Develop Analytics Tools for Market Visibility
• Contribute to Asset Fleet Optimization
• Partner with Operations and Technology Teams
• Monitor and Interpret Power Market News
Requirements:
• A strong understanding of European power market fundamentals is essential.
• Proven ability to design, code, and implement trading algorithms, with expertise in Python and C++.
• Familiarity with Stack, Delta models, load forecasting, or other power-specific models is highly advantageous.
• A strong analytical mindset for trading insights and experience with backtesting frameworks and statistical model validation techniques are required.
• The ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders is crucial.
• A degree in a technical field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance) or equivalent practical experience is necessary.

title: Intraday Power Trader, Singapore
description:
**Join us, be part of more.**

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently - we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.
• *About your team**:
At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use - powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

Centrica Energy is a leading power and gas trading company that has a strong presence in Europe, with further plans to globally expand our business into the American and Asian markets. Currently, our European Intraday Power Trading desk is looking to hire a Power Trader for the Singapore desk. We are looking for a motivated team player, who thrives while working in fast paced environment, who is not afraid of being challenged and challenging others, and who above all wants to learn and develop. To be successful in this role, you must have a flair for numbers and logical reasoning, you must be able to tackle and quickly solve problems, and you also need to be good at making decisions under pressure of time.
• *About the role**

We are a leading Power Trading team in Europe, so you will be able to learn from the most talented and experienced traders in the industry. We have a very flat team culture, therefore from the start you will see the direct impact of your actions on our team’s strategies and PnL.

Your key responsibilities will be:

- Trading proprietary intraday power in UK and Europe and helping us maximize PnL within our risk and compliance framework
- Participating in the shift rotation that includes day and weekend shifts
- Developing and executing day-to-day and intraday strategies
- Taking active part in developing and executing algorithmic trading and automatization
- Optimizing portfolios and exploiting the synergies between them
- Conducting market analysis to find new profit opportunities and build strategies to tap into them
- Obtaining expert understanding of the key drivers of the power market
- Taking responsibility for optimizing our daily procedures
- Providing open and honest feedback
- Constantly reviewing and reflecting on your own trading to look for ways to improve the performance, both your own and of the team

On our side, we offer you an exciting working environment, with plenty of opportunities to grow through accountability. We believe in learning by doing. Hence from day 1 you will start working together with traders in live markets, getting a chance to step right into commodity markets.

This role will be based in Singapore
• *About you**
- Finance/Economics or STEM degree
- A strong interest in trading, financial markets and energy systems
- An interest in the commodity markets
- Ability to remain calm under pressure
- Accuracy, timeliness and attention to detail
- Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team
- Proficiency in Excel and programming skills (VBA, Python, R, C++) is a plus
- Flexibility in terms of working weekends

It would be an advantage if you have experience as an analyst or a trader, but it is not a requirement.
• *Make a real impact and make the most of your talent**

This is your chance of joining a team of international colleagues who sets the bar high and that will help you develop both on a professional and personal level. If you are looking for a career where no days are the same and you are constantly given a chance to prove yourself and leverage your talent, this is the place to be.

So, take this opportunity to join one of the most successful European power trading teams. We look forward to hearing from you.
• *About Centrica Energy**

We’re a profitable company that understands the necessity of investment to achieve improvement. If you’ve got the willingness, ambitions, and right attitude we offer a work environment that will help you grow on a professional as well as personal level.

Energy markets are increasingly dominated by an ambitious decarbonization agenda, and so are we. Leveraging our in-house talent and specialists, extensive market expertise, technical capabilities, and the strong balance sheet of Centrica plc, we’re focused on delivering on the net-zero agenda as a vital enabler for our future growth. Our ambition is to become Europe’s No. 1 renewable energy trader and a globally important player, and we’re delivering on an ambitious corpo

title: Trade Energy Futures
description:
Commodity Trader Roles

We are recruiting for two commodity trader positions. The roles involve trading energy derivatives.
• Energy Derivatives Trader Role in Singapore
• Energy Derivatives Trader Role in Shanghai
About the Roles:

The successful candidates will be responsible for trading various energy derivatives including crude oil, fuel oil, naphtha, petrochemicals and LNG.

The ideal candidates will have strong analytical skills and experience in trading energy derivatives.
Key Responsibilities:
• Trading energy derivatives on global markets
• Analysing market trends and making informed trading decisions
• Building and maintaining relationships with clients and counterparts
Requirements:
• Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
• Experience in trading energy derivatives
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Benefits:

The successful candidates can expect a competitive compensation package and opportunities for career growth and development.
Why Join Us:

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and contribute to the growth of our business.

title: Energy Trading Software Support Professional
description:
About the Role

This exciting opportunity is open to individuals with 12 years of experience in software development, specifically in database design, SQL, .NET, and C#.

As a Commodity Trading Application Support Analyst, you will be responsible for participating in implementation, enhancement, and integration projects.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless delivery of software solutions.
